job_description_formatted:
Job Title: Senior Mobile Engineer (React Native)

Salary: Up to 4,500 USD/month

Work Location: Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

Type: Remote at first, hybrid later.

Candidate Acceptance: Open to Vietnam candidates currently based in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City.

Job Overview

Join an early-stage fintech startup building the next generation of crypto banking. We are looking for a Senior Mobile Engineer (React Native) to lead mobile development, shape product features, and deliver seamless experiences to thousands of users.


As a Senior Mobile Engineer, you will work closely with engineers, designers, product managers, and leadership to build and launch mobile applications. You will own the end-to-end development process, from architecture and coding to deployment, while helping grow and mentor the mobile engineering team.


Responsibilities
  • Build, test, and ship mobile features and applications using React Native, TypeScript, ES6, and Redux.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate product vision into technical solutions.
  • Write high-quality, well-tested code that meets performance and scalability requirements.
  • Leverage native APIs for deeper integration with iOS and Android platforms.
  • Mentor and guide junior engineers, fostering a strong engineering culture.
  • Maintain high standards for code quality, architecture, and system design.


Requirements

Must-Have:

  • 3+ years of experience building production apps with React Native and TypeScript.
  • Proven experience designing and scaling distributed systems and high-volume applications.
  • Track record of building and deploying products from scratch.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-uncertainty startup environment.
  • Fluency in English (spoken and written).
  • Vietnam candidate based in HN or HCM.
  • Candidates with an excellent academic background and/or international experience are strongly preferred.


Nice-to-Have:

  • Competitive programming background (Olympiad, ACM-ICPC).
  • Experience with blockchain technologies (Ethereum, Solana, etc.).
  • Prior experience working on consumer, finance, or security-related mobile apps.
  • Strong understanding of iOS SDK/Android frameworks and application lifecycles.
  • Excellent academic background and/or international experience.


Company Overview

We are an early-stage fintech startup operating at the intersection of crypto and banking. Our team combines international expertise with local execution in Vietnam, aiming to deliver secure and innovative financial solutions. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, ambitious team and make a direct impact on the company’s growth.


Working Time

Normal working hours, Monday to Friday, according to Vietnam time.


Benefits
  • Competitive salary up to 4,500 USD/month.
  • Labor contract signed with our banking partner.
  • Work fully remote initially, with a hybrid setup later.
  • Direct impact on building a fintech product from the ground up.
  • Opportunity to grow into a leadership role in mobile engineering.


The hiring process includes one interview round with the Co-founder (1–2 hours), followed by a take-home assignment.

job_title: Lead Software Engineer, Customer Data Platform
job_summary: Company Description About Grab and Our Workplace Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility. Job Description Get to Know the Team Clickstream Intelligence Platform (Scribe) is Grab's in-house app instrumentation and insights platform that captures and analyzes user clickstream activity across all Grab apps. The platform supports observability, real-time personalization, and business analytics by processing tens of billions of events per hour at petabyte scale. Customer Data Platform (CDP) enables Grab Teams to onboard and register Grab's customer data and make it available for Online Serving, ML Models, Segmentation, and Real Time targeting to power personalization use cases across the company. Our platform is leveraged across many mission-critical Grab services such as app personalization, experimentation, ads serving, and marketing. Get to Know the Role We Are Looking For a Technical Lead For Either Scribe Or CDP Team That Has a Strong Breadth Of Different Technical Stacks Web Portal: React.JS and Golang Backend. Online Serving: AWS infrastructure, MySQL, Redis, AWS Dynamo DB, Scylla DB. Data Processing / Storage: Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Trino, StarRocks, Hive, Delta Lake. Applied AI / ML: LLM, Python Backend, Vector DB. The role will report to Engineering Manager in Singapore and work onsite at Grab Vietnam office (District 7, HCMC). The Critical Tasks You Will Perform Build platform capabilities to facilitate scalable onboarding of user data that can be easily re-used across the company. Improve the serving capabilities of CDP's user data. Develop scalable real-time data pipelines and architecture that is cost efficient, while allowing non-technical teams to use these real-time capabilities. Lead and mentor an engineering team with diverse technical stacks. Qualifications What Essential Skills You Will Need Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related undergraduate degree. Minimum of 7+ years of experience in Software Engineering with well-proven track record of leading an engineering team with diverse skillsets. Proficient in at least one of the following programing languages: Python, Go, or Scala Experience developing large-scale backend systems and has good understanding of technical trade offs and evaluations needed to enable high load, low latency systems, while maintaining system reliability and cost efficiency. Strong English communications with prior work experience in regional & global environment (Optional) A Big Plus If You Have Experience with Apache Flink (for real-time processing) and Apache Spark (for batch processing). Proficiency in CI/CD tools, AWS, Terraform, and Kubernetes. Additional Information Life at Grab We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer: We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance. With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations. Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges. Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours What We Stand For At Grab We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique. job_description_formatted:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

  • Clickstream Intelligence Platform (Scribe) is Grab's in-house app instrumentation and insights platform that captures and analyzes user clickstream activity across all Grab apps. The platform supports observability, real-time personalization, and business analytics by processing tens of billions of events per hour at petabyte scale.
  • Customer Data Platform (CDP) enables Grab Teams to onboard and register Grab's customer data and make it available for Online Serving, ML Models, Segmentation, and Real Time targeting to power personalization use cases across the company. Our platform is leveraged across many mission-critical Grab services such as app personalization, experimentation, ads serving, and marketing.

Get to Know the Role

We Are Looking For a Technical Lead For Either Scribe Or CDP Team That Has a Strong Breadth Of Different Technical Stacks

  • Web Portal: React.JS and Golang Backend.
  • Online Serving: AWS infrastructure, MySQL, Redis, AWS Dynamo DB, Scylla DB.
  • Data Processing / Storage: Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Trino, StarRocks, Hive, Delta Lake.
  • Applied AI / ML: LLM, Python Backend, Vector DB.

The role will report to Engineering Manager in Singapore and work onsite at Grab Vietnam office (District 7, HCMC).

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

  • Build platform capabilities to facilitate scalable onboarding of user data that can be easily re-used across the company.
  • Improve the serving capabilities of CDP's user data.
  • Develop scalable real-time data pipelines and architecture that is cost efficient, while allowing non-technical teams to use these real-time capabilities.
  • Lead and mentor an engineering team with diverse technical stacks.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

  • Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related undergraduate degree.
  • Minimum of 7+ years of experience in Software Engineering with well-proven track record of leading an engineering team with diverse skillsets.
  • Proficient in at least one of the following programing languages: Python, Go, or Scala
  • Experience developing large-scale backend systems and has good understanding of technical trade offs and evaluations needed to enable high load, low latency systems, while maintaining system reliability and cost efficiency.
  • Strong English communications with prior work experience in regional & global environment

(Optional) A Big Plus If You Have

  • Experience with Apache Flink (for real-time processing) and Apache Spark (for batch processing).
  • Proficiency in CI/CD tools, AWS, Terraform, and Kubernetes.

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

  • We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
  • With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
  • Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
  • We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
  • Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

job_description_formatted:
Mô tả công việc

  • Phụ trách công việc biên phiên dịch tài liệu, dịch họp (nếu cần).
  • Theo dõi các hạng mục công việc được giao, thống kê tiến độ các dự án, làm báo cáo.
  • Giải quyết công việc phát sinh, trao đổi với cấp trên và các bộ phận liên quan.
  • Làm báo cáo công việc cho cấp trên theo tuần, tháng.
  • Các công việc theo yêu cầu từ cấp trên.

Yêu cầu công việc

  • Thành thạo tiếng Trung 4 kỹ năng
  • Có kinh nghiệm trợ lý, kinh doanh hoặc các vị trí tương đương là một lợi thế
  • Tốt nghiệp trung cấp trở lên các chuyên ngành
  • Sử dụng thành thạo tin học văn phòng
  • Kỹ năng giao tiếp, kỹ năng làm báo cáo

Tại sao bạn yêu thích làm việc tại đây

  • Môi trường làm việc trẻ trung, năng động
  • Thưởng hiệu quả công việc; Thưởng cuối năm;…
  • Tham gia BHXH đầy đủ theo quy định
  • Liên hoan bộ phận hàng quý;
  • Được mua điện thoại OPPO giảm giá 20%;

job_description_formatted:
LARION, a global software outsourcing partner with 2 decades of deep industry expertise. We are a 100% Vietnam technology company specializing in turnkey solutions and building highly skilled development teams for companies of all size and types of business. Run by a team of successful entrepreneurs and dedicated technical experts - LARION is a unique symphony where we create a frictionless future for customers with passion, while maintaining full compliance with your needs and objectives.


We are looking for a talented Senior C++ Embedded Engineer to join the project development of digital LCD measuring instruments for various types of vehicles.


I. What You’ll Do

- Design, develop, and maintain embedded software using C++ in a Linux environment for digital LCD measuring instruments

- Work with cross-functional teams to understand customer needs and translate them into software solutions.

- Develop and maintain embedded systems for optimal performance.

- Work closely with hardware engineers to ensure smooth integration between software and hardware.

- Conduct code reviews, debugging, and troubleshooting to ensure high-quality software delivery.

- Continuously improve the development process, identifying areas for optimization and proposing improvements.

- Document software designs, processes, and solutions to ensure clarity and maintainability.


II. What You’ll Bring

- 4+ years of experience in C++ embedded systems or automotive software.

- Proficiency in Linux for building custom Linux distributions and embedded systems.

- Have good experience with the Qt framework for GUI development in embedded systems, including QML for dynamic user interfaces.

- Experience with multi-threading, and multi-process programming.

- Experience with CAN bus protocol for communication in automotive or embedded systems.

- Knowledge of encryption libraries for secure communication and data handling.

- Strong understanding of OOP and design patterns.

- Familiarity with hardware-level development and integration.

- Experience in Agile development environments.

- Familiarity with Git, Jenkins, Docker.

- Good English communication.


III. Why You'll Love Working Here

1. Workplace

  • Join a vibrant team working on cutting-edge projects.
  • Collaborate with global experts to enhance your skills.
  • Thrive in a culture of openness and respect, encouraging your full potential.


2. Benefits Comprise

  • Competitive compensation: 13th-month salary and performance bonuses.
  • A flexible working model exclusively applies for this job, allowing you to join us from anywhere
  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage, including accident insurance.
  • Generous allowances: lunch, marriage, newborn, bereavement, and more.
  • Fully equipped pantry for a comfortable lunchtime experience.
  • Diverse sports and social activities: Yoga, football, badminton, tech clubs, charity, etc.
  • Annual company trip and team-building events.
  • Recognition awards: Quarterly, annual, individual, team, and long-term service honors.
  • Advanced English and soft skills training for career growth.
  • Engaging monthly events: Happy gatherings, mini-games, team birthday celebrations, year-end party, and more.
  • Exclusive company support funds for personal loans (home, vehicle, tuition, etc.).


Let’s embark on your career path journey with LARION at phuongnnh@larion.com


Gentle notice to our candidate about Decree No.13/2023/NĐ-CP

- According to Decree No.13/2023/NĐ-CP on protecting personal data, LARION would apply a "Personal Data Processing Agreement" with all candidates to ensure compliance with the decree.

- By submitting this application to LARION, you agree to allow LARION to proceed with your provided information by "Personal Data Processing Agreement" that you have read, fully understood and agreed to the entire content at link https://larion.com/privacy-policy/

job_description_formatted:
As a member of the Data Science team, you will focus on working on cutting-edge customer projects in diverse areas from product recommendations, fraud detection, supply chain optimization, and demand forecasting.

Full of energy, fresh ideas, and ambition, you are the sort of person who loves learning new things, is open to being challenged and has the confidence to challenge us too.

We are looking for fresh graduates (with < 1 yr of post-graduation experience) with the enthusiasm, creativity, and business acumen to drive real innovation and become our future leaders.

In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math, and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine learning and research.

Your goal will be to help our customers analyze trends to make better decisions.

  • To develop analytical models for insight generation that improve business decision-making
  • Responsible for experimenting with and implementing machine learning techniques on internal/external customer projects
  • Responsible for learning new data science techniques/programming languages and exploring their viability on current projects
  • Will contribute to data science team discussions, providing insight into current approaches and methods,
  • Follows established MLOps practices in software development
  • Data science model selection and implementation
  • Working independently while collaborating well within the team
  • Have worked autonomously and delivered results on schedule


About Rackspace Technology

We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology

Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

job_description_formatted:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Job title                                  : Business Analyst

Position type              : Full time

Quantity                     : 1



Job descriptions

Business Analysis & Requirement Management

  • Work directly with EU customers, willing to work nightshift. 
  • Conduct requirement meetings/workshops with business users, customers, and stakeholders to gather ideas and requirements.
  • Create and maintain Business Requirement Definitions, Software Requirement Specifications, Mockups, User Stories with clear acceptance criteria, and other related documents.
  • Make presentations to demonstrate requirement understanding and gain approval from key stakeholders.
  • Ensure requirements align with business objectives and add real value.
  • Prioritize requirements and backlogs based on business needs.
  • Translate requirements into actionable tasks for the project team, ensuring every member understands what they’re doing and why.
  • Perform Project Acceptance Tests before UAT.
  • Run workshops and training sessions to enable stakeholders to effectively use the delivered software/applications.
  • Scrum Master / Agile Facilitation
  • Facilitate Agile ceremonies (Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review, Retrospectives).
  • Support the Product Owner in managing and refining the product backlog.
  • Help remove impediments that block the team’s progress.
  • Coach and guide the team and stakeholders on Agile/Scrum principles.
  • Promote transparency, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the team.



Job qualifications

  • Good educational background, preferably in the fields of computer science or engineering
  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Business, or related field.
  • 3–5 years of experience as a Business Analyst in software development projects.
  • Strong skills in requirement elicitation, analysis, documentation, and prioritization.
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).
  • Experience writing user stories, acceptance criteria, business process flows, and functional documentation.
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum practices and working in cross-functional teams.
  • Strong facilitation and presentation skills.
  • Nice-to-Have Skills
  • Experience as a Scrum Master or relevant certification (CSM, PSM).
  • Knowledge of Agile project management tools (Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps).
  • Domain knowledge in manufacturing, ERP, or MES is a plus.


Benefits


Successful candidates will be part of a friendly, motivated and committed talent teams with various benefits and attractive offers:

·      Attractive offer, plus annual compensation and performance bonus.

·       “FPT care” health insurance provided by AON and is exclusive for FPT employees.

·      Support for learning and certificate examination.

·      Chance to work onsite in US, Euro and Asian countries 

·      Company shuttle buses provide convenient way of transportation for all employees.

·      Salary review 2 times/year or on excellent performance

·      Annual Summer Vacation: follows company’s policy and starts from May every year

·      International, dynamic, friendly working environment

·      Annual leave, working conditions follow Vietnam labor laws.

·      Other allowances: transportation allowance, lunch allowance, working on-site allowance, etc.

·      FTown Campus provide many facilities for FPT employees such as football ground, basketball & volleyball, gym & yoga centre, restaurant, cafeteria, etc.



Contact Person

Interested candidates should submit a completed Curriculum Viate/ Résume and Cover Letter (if any) to:            

Email: MyDTD1@FPT.COM

Zalo: 0965352418    

 

FPT Software – Where talents meet

job_description_formatted:
As the Project Manager for the Creator Collaboration Program, you will own, manage and oversee the successful planning, execution, and delivery of initiatives that connect the technology with a global network of creators. You will support the client’s vision and agenda when bringing innovative creator campaigns and programs to life.


You'll be working closely with our client, a global technology and video-sharing platform. Their content solutions help to transform ad innovations into tailored client solutions, enabling customers to maximize advertising products and the new-era ad platform.


By collaborating with Sales teams, this team supports robust commercial strategies while equipping customer-facing teams with essential product knowledge to deliver impactful solutions.


You’ll be leading the alignment with business goals and fostering meaningful partnerships with creators. This role demands strong leadership, strategic project management, and a passion for creator-driven content.


If you’d been here last week you might have done the following...

  • Drive the execution of creator collaboration initiatives, ensuring they align with the company's strategic goals and deliver measurable impact.
  • Develop and implement project frameworks that enhance collaboration, streamline workflows, and integrate creative strategies to amplify program success.
  • Serve as the central point of contact for the client partner, internal teams, external creator partners, and other stakeholders, ensuring clear communication, seamless coordination, and alignment on objectives.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams—including marketing, product, partnerships, and legal—to ensure the delivery of innovative, high-impact campaigns.
  • Monitor project schedules and budgets, making necessary adjustments to meet milestones and financial targets while maintaining program quality.
  • Leverage insights and emerging trends to recommend strategies and solutions that empower creators and elevate the program's effectiveness.
  • Evaluate program outcomes, analyzing data and feedback to continuously improve processes and foster long-term creator relationships.


Your background

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field
  • Minimum of 3 years of project management experience, preferably in creative, marketing, or tech environments.
  • Experience managing partnerships or collaborations with creators and influencers and building a bridge between the brands and internal sales and marketing teams in a matrix environment.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple timelines, budgets, and resources with strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to liaise effectively between stakeholders from all levels and backgrounds with different agendas.
  • Experience with project management tools and software, leveraging them to improve workflows and team efficiency.
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to shifting priorities and solve challenges in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent business-level English and local language skills, verbal and written, are required.


----

About Mash

Mash is a global agency that curates bespoke teams that solve brand challenges. With a mission to empower the world to work for itself, we’ve rapidly and proudly matured into one of the most vibrant agency and talent services platforms - curating bespoke teams for start-ups, SMEs, and some of the world's most revolutionary brands.


‘The Mash approach’ means effectiveness is the force behind every talent, project and creative solution we offer. We mean it when we say this – “Client’s success is our KPI.”


Please note. Due to the high volume of applications, we unfortunately can’t get back to each and every one of you and only successful applications will be contacted. Also, when you share your details with us, we consider this as consent for us to use your data during the application process.

job_description_formatted:
AppCurators Technologies is a leading custom software development company, dedicated to building high-performance mobile apps, web platforms, and digital solutions tailored to your business vision. With a passion for innovation and a deep understanding of industry-specific needs, we empower startups, SMEs, and enterprises across domains like FinTech, EdTech, Health & Fitness, Gaming, and E-commerce.

Our team of experienced designers, developers, and strategists believes in transforming ideas into intuitive, scalable, and user-centric digital products. From MVP development to full-scale deployment, we offer end-to-end services that ensure speed, quality, and growth.

Why AppCurators?

Industry-specific expertise

Agile & transparent development process

Scalable tech architecture

Strong UI/UX design focus

Proven track record across global markets

Whether you're a non-tech founder or an established business, we’re your trusted partner in creating apps that not only function flawlessly — but also make a real impact.

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For

  • Writing well-designed, testable and efficient code.
  • Gathering and evaluating user feedback.
  • Working as a part of a dynamic team to deliver winning products.
  • Providing code documentation and other inputs to technical documents.
  • Supporting continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and new technologies and presenting these for architectural review.
  • Troubleshooting and debugging to optimise performance.
  • Leading the design, creation, and implementation of a suite of software.
  • Building on new features, software analysis, software design, code implementation, software integration, module verification and validation.

Ideal Profile

  • You possess a Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
  • You have at least 4 years experience, ideally within a Software Architect or Software Engineer role.
  • You are a strong networker & relationship builder
  • You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
  • You are adaptable and thrive in changing environments

What's on Offer?

  • Excellent career development opportunities
  • Flexible working options
  • Leadership Role

job_description_formatted:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in ServiceNow, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Master's degree or Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration
  • You have at least 3 years of professional experience working with ServiceNow
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model. In this role you will need to hold an expert level of linguistics. You will have conversations in both Vietnamese and English with chatbots in order to measure their progress, as well as write novel conversations in order to teach them what to say. Benefits This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position You‚Äôll be able to choose which projects you want to work on You can work on your own schedule Projects are paid hourly starting at $20+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work Responsibilities Give AI chatbots writing and editing tasks and evaluate their outputs Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance Qualifications Fluency in English and Vietnamese Detail-oriented Excellent command of grammar, style, and brand voice A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required Notes Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. Only applicants in Vietnam will be considered for this role. This is an independent contract position. #vietnamese Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
We are looking for a Bilingual Customer Support Specialist to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

In this role you will need to hold an expert level of linguistics. You will have conversations in both Vietnamese and English with chatbots in order to measure their progress, as well as write novel conversations in order to teach them what to say.

Benefits

  • This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
  • You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
  • You can work on your own schedule
  • Projects are paid hourly starting at $20+ USD per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities

  • Give AI chatbots writing and editing tasks and evaluate their outputs
  • Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications

  • Fluency in English and Vietnamese
  • Detail-oriented
  • Excellent command of grammar, style, and brand voice
  • A current, in progress, or completed Bachelor's degree is preferred but not required

Notes

Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. Only applicants in Vietnam will be considered for this role. This is an independent contract position.

job_industries: Manufacturing and Food and Beverage Services
job_description_formatted:
Overview

Cooperate with engineering team to identify and eliminate as many potential losses at the design stage. Stable machine cycle time increasing mean time between failure (MTBF)

  • Integrate the new equipment into existing lines. Deterioration is easily measured and corrected. Routine maintenance tasks are easy to perform and carried out by internal personnel. Short MTTR.
  • Develop and refine Preventive Maintenance and condition monitoring routines for new equipment. Advise technical training needed for maintenance technicians
  • Define costs and value drivers to support life cycle cost reduction and maximize return on capital invested

Responsibilities

  • Business Results
  • Maximize Technical Availability and Asset Reliability across all production lines by effectively leading, promoting and introducing analytical problem solving techniques to maximize the overall asset effectiveness.
  • Lead the site Asset Reliability program. Own and develop the site Analytical Problem Solving, (APS) Root Cause Analysis (RCA) systems, be the “gatekeeper” for effective closure ensuring all relevant improvements are coordinated via appropriate teams.
  • Manage the Condition Monitoring & Lubrication program on route to “zero (planned) maintenance time concept” - this will drive an increase in technical availability
  • Project:
  • Undertake a comprehensive Con Mon/lube skills “gap analysis” to help develop technical training
  • Engage with operational sites and field M&R teams to discuss current capabilities and develop tactical game plan
  • Internal Contacts - Maintenance Support Department (All), Manufacturing Technicians (Including Asset Care), Operations Managers, Finance - MOH/Direct cost techs

Qualifications

  • Qualifications
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Engineering - Electrical / Mechanical or related engineering fields
  • Excellent problem solving skills. Prepared to challenge assumptions.
  • Fundamental knowledge of mechanical systems through qualifications and/or experience
  • Excellent analytical skills, problem solving, performance management, decisive thought leader with excellent managerial skill
  • Ability to work in a constantly changing dynamic and challenging environment
  • Experience
  • Strong experience at least 5 years experience in programming PLCs and microprocessor-based control equipment for major projects.
  • Previous experience of condition monitoring & lubrication systems
  • Deep awareness of modern Maintenance techniques and best practice implementation (TPM, Operator asset care, 5S, RCA, RCM)
  • Good knowledge of process and packaging technology
  • Fluently in English communication (writing, reading and speaking)

job_summary: Hashlist is a platform for tech positions & projects within the automotive industry. We establish supplier relationships with automotive companies and provide a one-stop shop for candidates interested in working in the industry. Are you ready to be a part of that journey? As an ADAS Specialist , you will be responsible for the development and integration of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), ensuring seamless functionality across sensor fusion, control systems, and autonomous driving features. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance ADAS algorithms, real-time processing, and system validation, while ensuring compliance with industry standards such as ISO 26262, ASPICE, and SOTIF (ISO/PAS 21448). Your work will contribute to the advancement of L1‚ÄìL3 autonomous driving, vehicle dynamics, and sensor calibration. Engagement Details: Length: 6 months contract with possible extension Allocation: 100%, full-time Start date: March or April Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, or Danang Freelancers accepted Responsibilities: Develop and integrate ADAS features, focusing on sensor fusion, real-time processing, and vehicle control systems. Ensure compliance with ISO 26262, ASPICE, and SOTIF in ADAS development and validation. Conduct Hardware-in-the-Loop (HiL), Software-in-the-Loop (SiL), and vehicle testing to validate system performance. Support ADAS software and system integration using MATLAB/Simulink and model-based development (MBD). Collaborate on DFMEA, functional safety analysis, and performance reporting to enhance system reliability. Qualifications: Degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Mechatronics, or Electrical Engineering. Experience in ADAS feature development, sensor fusion, and control systems. Strong knowledge of ADAS software architecture, sensor calibration, and vehicle dynamics. Proficiency in CANoe, CANalyzer, Vector Tools, MATLAB/Simulink, and Teamcenter. Ability to work with cross-functional teams and solve complex challenges in ADAS technology and autonomous driving. Next steps: Press "Apply" We will review your application If qualified, you will be accepted into the network and can be considered for this and similar positions & projects Show more Show less
job_industries: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing and Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing
job_description_formatted:
Hashlist is a platform for tech positions & projects within the automotive industry.


We establish supplier relationships with automotive companies and provide a one-stop shop for candidates interested in working in the industry.


Are you ready to be a part of that journey?


As an ADAS Specialist, you will be responsible for the development and integration of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), ensuring seamless functionality across sensor fusion, control systems, and autonomous driving features. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance ADAS algorithms, real-time processing, and system validation, while ensuring compliance with industry standards such as ISO 26262, ASPICE, and SOTIF (ISO/PAS 21448). Your work will contribute to the advancement of L1–L3 autonomous driving, vehicle dynamics, and sensor calibration.


Engagement Details:

  • Length: 6 months contract with possible extension
  • Allocation: 100%, full-time
  • Start date: March or April
  • Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, or Danang
  • Freelancers accepted


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and integrate ADAS features, focusing on sensor fusion, real-time processing, and vehicle control systems.
  • Ensure compliance with ISO 26262, ASPICE, and SOTIF in ADAS development and validation.
  • Conduct Hardware-in-the-Loop (HiL), Software-in-the-Loop (SiL), and vehicle testing to validate system performance.
  • Support ADAS software and system integration using MATLAB/Simulink and model-based development (MBD).
  • Collaborate on DFMEA, functional safety analysis, and performance reporting to enhance system reliability.


Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Mechatronics, or Electrical Engineering.
  • Experience in ADAS feature development, sensor fusion, and control systems.
  • Strong knowledge of ADAS software architecture, sensor calibration, and vehicle dynamics.
  • Proficiency in CANoe, CANalyzer, Vector Tools, MATLAB/Simulink, and Teamcenter.
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams and solve complex challenges in ADAS technology and autonomous driving.


Next steps:

  • Press "Apply"
  • We will review your application
  • If qualified, you will be accepted into the network and can be considered for this and similar positions & projects

job_poster.title: Talent Acquisition + Employer Branding | BBA

job_description_formatted:
MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC

Vị trí: Giáo Viên Tiếng Anh Test Đầu Vào (OTE)

●   Giảng dạy trực tuyến 1:1 cho học sinh tiểu học và THCS qua Google Meet.

●   Sử dụng giáo trình công ty cung cấp, tạo hứng thú và điều chỉnh phù hợp với nhu cầu của học sinh.

●   Mỗi lớp học kéo dài 25 phút.

●   Giáo viên cần dạy ít nhất 4 ca/tối, 5 tối/tuần tương đương 8-10h/tuần


●  Viết đánh giá năng lực học sinh sau ca dạy và đề xuất lộ trình học tập.


Vị trí: Giáo Viên Tiếng Anh Online tại nhà (GTE)

●   Giảng dạy trực tuyến 1:5; 1:8 cho học sinh tiểu học và THCS qua phần mềm ClassIn

●   Sử dụng giáo trình công ty cung cấp, tạo hứng thú và điều chỉnh phù hợp với nhu cầu của học sinh.

●   Mỗi lớp học kéo dài 75 phút với các lớp ET7 và 30 phút với các lớp EC7 và         02 buổi học/tuần.

●   Giáo viên cần dạy đăng ký lịch dạy tối thiểu 03 ngày/tuần, dạy ít nhất 02 lớp/tuần vào các khung giờ 19:15, 20:00 và 20:45 và cam kết đi cùng học sinh đến hết chu kỳ khóa học (tối thiểu 2 tháng).


●  Viết nhận xét ngắn gọn về tình hình học tập của học sinh sau mỗi buổi học (có mẫu)


YÊU CẦU ỨNG VIÊN

Bằng cấp và kinh nghiệm:

●   Độ tuổi từ 19

●   Đã và đang học tại các trường Đại học top đầu hoặc có chứng chỉ Tiếng Anh thông dụng ( IELTS, TOEIC, VSTEP, TOEFL)

●   Có ít nhất 6 tháng kinh nghiệm dạy Tiếng Anh tại các trung tâm Tiếng Anh hoặc gia sư online tại nhà. 

 

 

Các yếu tố khác:

●   Ưu tiên ứng viên có giọng chuẩn Bắc và Nam

●   Phát âm Tiếng Anh chuẩn, Không ngọng, giọng dễ nghe

●   Tác phong nghiêm túc

●   Ngoại hình tươi tắn, ưa nhìn

●   Có laptop cá nhân

●  Có đường truyền mạng đạt tiêu chuẩn


CHÍNH SÁCH ĐÃI NGỘ

●   Thu nhập từ 90k/h

●  Được cung cấp sẵn slide bài giảng để giảng dạy cho học viên

●     Được training các kỹ năng cần thiết (kỹ năng sư phạm, giao tiếp).

●  Được tham dự cuộc họp chuyên môn định kỳ với các chuyên gia sư phạm để nâng cao kỹ năng giảng dạy

●     Có cơ chế thưởng định kỳ theo năng lực

job_description_formatted:
The Content Moderator is in charge of assisting the development of AI technologies in advertising and marketing through reviewing short-form written content.


Role Responsibilities:

  • Research, create and edit short-form written content (examples are short blog posts, emails, brief essays, story synopses, summaries, cover letters, etc.) while adhering to factual accuracy and style guidelines for voice and creativity
  • Analyze and evaluate short-form written content for factual accuracy and adherence to style guidelines


Required Experience, Skills & Competencies:

  • Excellent writing skills, as evidenced by writing samples, work history, and academic coursework
  • Professional writing experience preferred (copywriter, journalist, technical writer, editor, etc.)
  • Bachelor's degree and/or relevant experience, with certification or graduate degrees preferred in selected subject matter domains
  • Native English speaker
  • High level of creativity, logic and reasoning skills
  • Subject matter expertise in one or more domains or fields of study (popular culture, social sciences, STEM, and professional services)

Popular Culture: Beauty, Fitness, Pop Music, Entertainment, Sports, Current Events, Travel, etc.

Social Sciences: Fine Arts, History, Anthropology, Political Science, Sociology, Education, etc.

STEM+: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.

Professional Services: Healthcare, Law, Finance, Software Engineering, etc.

  • Able to work independently and with a low level of supervision
  • Attention to detail and strong communication skills
  • General expertise/understanding with logic, reasoning, instruct, and prompt/response evaluation.
  • Complex/nuanced understanding with multimodal prompt response generation and sentiment analysis/classification.

job_description_formatted:
A Data Pro is an award-winning media and business intelligence provider with a 25-year track record in servicing leading international companies and organizations. By combining our people’s expertise with innovative technologies, we make sense of the constant flow of information to generate actionable insights and offer creative solutions.


We are looking for Researcher with English plus Chinese to join our team on a full-time basis. This is a fully remote position with fixed working time - Monday-Friday from 8/9 am to 5/6 pm Bulgarian time.


Profile of the successful candidate:

- excellent command of written English /C1-C2 level/

- very good command of Chinese

- curious about tech trends in content and data management

- attention to detail and respect of deadlines

- interested in developing or has previous experience as a professional in the constantly growing industry of R&C information services

- looking for a place to learn and grow

- knowledge of any other language would be considered an advantage


Even if you don’t have previous experience, we provide guidance and extensive training, so that you can easily adapt and start your career growth with us.


Main responsibilities:

- Perform extensive research of companies and individuals according to specific criteria

- Analyze and filter the relevant information

- Write reports / summaries in English containing the selected information

- Develop as a professional in the field of R&C information services


What you get in return:

Career

- Bonus scheme according to performance

- Award winning training team to support your start and growth with us

- A career path that depends on your results and interests

- Exciting work environment within a young and energetic team

- Knowledge and practical experience in the constantly growing industry of media information services

- Working with international clients and projects

- Challenging project with direct impact on final outcome

- Working side by side with top professionals from the industry


Culture

- A non-corporate atmosphere with flexible processes and agile mindset

- Fully remote work mode

- Bring a friend referral program


Please apply with a CV in English.

Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

job_summary: At Cognita, we know every student is unique. We nurture their distinct personalities and strengths. We support them academically, socially, and emotionally, wherever they are in the world, wherever they‚Äôre starting from. And each and every one of our schools is unique too. We protect what‚Äôs special about them, while offering them rich knowledge, opportunities, and best practices. And they get to be part of something bigger. We open their classrooms to the collective wisdom of over 100 schools in 17 countries, ensuring every child gets an education that‚Äôs, quite literally, world class. It‚Äôs an individual approach that empowers every school, teacher and student to focus on what they do best. And thrive. About The Role The HR Assistant Manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and overseeing all training and development initiatives within the organization. This role also leads engagement programs, manages HRVN internal communications, and serves as the HR Business Partner (HRBP) for the AAVN school, ensuring alignment of HR strategies with the school‚Äôs goals and culture. Responsibilities The incumbent is expected to actively perform a full range of duties, including but not limited to: Training & Engagement Training Develop and implement an annual training plan that aligns with organizational goals, staff development needs, and insights from skill gap analyses. Plan and execute both internal and external training programs, managing the full cycle including budgeting, scheduling, vendor coordination, participant engagement, and logistics. Design and deliver learning programs, workshops, and development initiatives to build staff capabilities, working closely with department heads to ensure alignment with performance objectives and career progression pathways. Oversee day-to-day training operations, including venue setup, preparation of training materials, attendance tracking, and post-training evaluation and follow-up. Monitor and assess training effectiveness through feedback collection, knowledge assessments, and analysis of performance impact to guide continuous improvement. Control the training budget, track expenditures, and prepare monthly reports for submission to the HR Director, ensuring transparency and effective resource utilization. Manage and continuously enhance the internal learning management system, ensuring the system is user-friendly, and accessible; monitor usage, track learner progress, and support the system admin during the process of implementation. Engagement Develop and execute an annual engagement plan that supports employee well-being, team cohesion, and a positive organizational culture. Lead the planning and delivery of employee engagement initiatives such as wellness programs, recognition activities, surveys, and team-building events. Maintain and manage a detailed engagement calendar, ensuring alignment with key HR and organizational milestones and timely communication across teams. Collect and analyze engagement data (e.g., participation rates, feedback, survey results) to identify trends and recommend data-driven improvements to enhance employee experience. Control the engagement budget, track expenditures, and prepare monthly reports for submission to the HR Director, ensuring transparency and effective resource utilization. HRVN Communications Lead HR-related internal communications to ensure clear, consistent, and timely updates across all HR initiatives. Create and review HR communications in both English and Vietnamese, including newsletters, announcements, and internal campaigns. Support the creation of communication materials for training, engagement, and organizational updates aligned with the company‚Äôs branding and tone. HRBP for the School Serve as the dedicated HR Business Partner for the School, working closely with the school leadership team to align HR strategies with school goals and ensure a cohesive, supportive employee experience. Manage the full employee lifecycle at the school, including but not limited to onboarding, mobility, relocation, repatriation, visa and work permit processing, safeguarding, health insurance, banking support, and exit processes. Act as the primary HR contact for staff, ensuring effective communication of HR policies, procedures, and updates to enhance employee understanding and engagement. Provide timely and accurate support for HR planning and analysis, including workforce planning, headcount tracking, and coordination with Head of School and related stakeholders for staffing needs. Oversee safer recruitment compliance at the school by maintaining tracking systems, accurate reporting, and strong data management; act as a key HR gatekeeper for safer recruitment matters. Collaborate with stakeholders to support organizational design, including team restructuring and role alignment, ensuring HR involvement in change management processes. Mentor and develop team members by providing coaching, sharing knowledge, and fostering a collaborative team dynamic. Coordinate with the central HR function to ensure consistency and compliance with organization-wide HR policies, processes, and standards. Other Drive agile and innovative HR strategies across Vietnam by actively contributing to cross-functional HR projects and initiatives. Manage and update the organizational chart to reflect accurate reporting lines, team structures, and staffing changes; ensure alignment with OD efforts and workforce planning strategies. Lead and oversee the onboarding process to ensure a smooth, consistent, and engaging experience for all new hires, aligning with organizational culture and values. Support the continuous improvement of HRIS systems by reviewing and enhancing data quality, workflows, processes, and system configurations. Assist in the creation and refinement of relevant HR forms, reports, and tools to streamline operations and ensure compliance. Perform other duties as assigned by the HR Director to support HR operations and strategic priorities. Position Requirements Good understanding of working environment and culture of international schools; be familiar to work with expatriates and diverse culture Excellent communication skills, interpersonal and influencing skills Excellent English, both in writing and speaking Excellent Computer Literacy, especially database management Strong at People and Organizational Development Strong teamwork ethic Qualifications Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in HR related field or equivalent experience Minimum 3-year progressive experience in the relevant roles. Contacts All school stakeholders (teachers, staffs, etc.) Vendors, third parties Government authorities Regional/Global colleagues and management team Working Conditions Working Hours: 8:00 am ‚Äì 5:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Occasional evening and weekend work is to be expected. Annual Leave: 12 days per school year (pro-rated based on actual employment time) Additional Paid Leave: 10 days per school year (pro-rated based on actual employment time) Sick leave: 3 days (pro-rated based on actual employment time) Medical Benefits: Health Insurance, 24/7 accident insurance Pre-medical exam: Required Referee request: Required Background check: Required How To Apply Complete this applicationbefore the closing date. The Closing Date for Applications is: 10 August 2025. Cognita Schools are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff, volunteers and other third parties to share this commitment. Safer recruitment practice and pre-employment background checks will be undertaken before any appointment is confirmed. We believe having a diverse workforce makes us better, smarter and happier and so welcome applicants from all backgrounds, genders, and races. We have an unwavering commitment to being fair and equitable in our recruitment process. Early applications are encouraged, we reserve the right to interview and appoint prior to closing date for the right applicant. Applicants who have not heard from us by the closing date must assume that, on this occasion, their application has been unsuccessful. Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
At Cognita, we know every student is unique. We nurture their distinct personalities and strengths. We support them academically, socially, and emotionally, wherever they are in the world, wherever they’re starting from. And each and every one of our schools is unique too.

We protect what’s special about them, while offering them rich knowledge, opportunities, and best practices. And they get to be part of something bigger. We open their classrooms to the collective wisdom of over 100 schools in 17 countries, ensuring every child gets an education that’s, quite literally, world class.

It’s an individual approach that empowers every school, teacher and student to focus on what they do best. And thrive.

About The Role

The HR Assistant Manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and overseeing all training and development initiatives within the organization. This role also leads engagement programs, manages HRVN internal communications, and serves as the HR Business Partner (HRBP) for the AAVN school, ensuring alignment of HR strategies with the school’s goals and culture.

Responsibilities

The incumbent is expected to actively perform a full range of duties, including but not limited to:

  • Training & Engagement

Training

  • Develop and implement an annual training plan that aligns with organizational goals, staff development needs, and insights from skill gap analyses.
  • Plan and execute both internal and external training programs, managing the full cycle including budgeting, scheduling, vendor coordination, participant engagement, and logistics.
  • Design and deliver learning programs, workshops, and development initiatives to build staff capabilities, working closely with department heads to ensure alignment with performance objectives and career progression pathways.
  • Oversee day-to-day training operations, including venue setup, preparation of training materials, attendance tracking, and post-training evaluation and follow-up.
  • Monitor and assess training effectiveness through feedback collection, knowledge assessments, and analysis of performance impact to guide continuous improvement.
  • Control the training budget, track expenditures, and prepare monthly reports for submission to the HR Director, ensuring transparency and effective resource utilization.
  • Manage and continuously enhance the internal learning management system, ensuring the system is user-friendly, and accessible; monitor usage, track learner progress, and support the system admin during the process of implementation.

Engagement

  • Develop and execute an annual engagement plan that supports employee well-being, team cohesion, and a positive organizational culture.
  • Lead the planning and delivery of employee engagement initiatives such as wellness programs, recognition activities, surveys, and team-building events.
  • Maintain and manage a detailed engagement calendar, ensuring alignment with key HR and organizational milestones and timely communication across teams.
  • Collect and analyze engagement data (e.g., participation rates, feedback, survey results) to identify trends and recommend data-driven improvements to enhance employee experience.
  • Control the engagement budget, track expenditures, and prepare monthly reports for submission to the HR Director, ensuring transparency and effective resource utilization.
  • HRVN Communications
  • Lead HR-related internal communications to ensure clear, consistent, and timely updates across all HR initiatives.
  • Create and review HR communications in both English and Vietnamese, including newsletters, announcements, and internal campaigns.
  • Support the creation of communication materials for training, engagement, and organizational updates aligned with the company’s branding and tone.
  • HRBP for the School
  • Serve as the dedicated HR Business Partner for the School, working closely with the school leadership team to align HR strategies with school goals and ensure a cohesive, supportive employee experience.
  • Manage the full employee lifecycle at the school, including but not limited to onboarding, mobility, relocation, repatriation, visa and work permit processing, safeguarding, health insurance, banking support, and exit processes.
  • Act as the primary HR contact for staff, ensuring effective communication of HR policies, procedures, and updates to enhance employee understanding and engagement.
  • Provide timely and accurate support for HR planning and analysis, including workforce planning, headcount tracking, and coordination with Head of School and related stakeholders for staffing needs.
  • Oversee safer recruitment compliance at the school by maintaining tracking systems, accurate reporting, and strong data management; act as a key HR gatekeeper for safer recruitment matters.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to support organizational design, including team restructuring and role alignment, ensuring HR involvement in change management processes.
  • Mentor and develop team members by providing coaching, sharing knowledge, and fostering a collaborative team dynamic.
  • Coordinate with the central HR function to ensure consistency and compliance with organization-wide HR policies, processes, and standards.

Other

  • Drive agile and innovative HR strategies across Vietnam by actively contributing to cross-functional HR projects and initiatives.
  • Manage and update the organizational chart to reflect accurate reporting lines, team structures, and staffing changes; ensure alignment with OD efforts and workforce planning strategies.
  • Lead and oversee the onboarding process to ensure a smooth, consistent, and engaging experience for all new hires, aligning with organizational culture and values.
  • Support the continuous improvement of HRIS systems by reviewing and enhancing data quality, workflows, processes, and system configurations.
  • Assist in the creation and refinement of relevant HR forms, reports, and tools to streamline operations and ensure compliance.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the HR Director to support HR operations and strategic priorities.

Position Requirements

  • Good understanding of working environment and culture of international schools; be familiar to work with expatriates and diverse culture
  • Excellent communication skills, interpersonal and influencing skills
  • Excellent English, both in writing and speaking
  • Excellent Computer Literacy, especially database management
  • Strong at People and Organizational Development
  • Strong teamwork ethic

Qualifications

  • Bachelor/Master’s degree in HR related field or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 3-year progressive experience in the relevant roles.

Contacts

  • All school stakeholders (teachers, staffs, etc.)
  • Vendors, third parties
  • Government authorities
  • Regional/Global colleagues and management team

Working Conditions

  • Working Hours: 8:00 am – 5:00 pm, Monday to Friday. Occasional evening and weekend work is to be expected.
  • Annual Leave: 12 days per school year (pro-rated based on actual employment time)
  • Additional Paid Leave: 10 days per school year (pro-rated based on actual employment time)
  • Sick leave: 3 days (pro-rated based on actual employment time)
  • Medical Benefits: Health Insurance, 24/7 accident insurance
  • Pre-medical exam: Required
  • Referee request: Required
  • Background check: Required

How To Apply

Complete this applicationbefore the closing date. The Closing Date for Applications is: 10 August 2025.

Cognita Schools are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff, volunteers and other third parties to share this commitment. Safer recruitment practice and pre-employment background checks will be undertaken before any appointment is confirmed.

We believe having a diverse workforce makes us better, smarter and happier and so welcome applicants from all backgrounds, genders, and races. We have an unwavering commitment to being fair and equitable in our recruitment process.

Early applications are encouraged, we reserve the right to interview and appoint prior to closing date for the right applicant.

Applicants who have not heard from us by the closing date must assume that, on this occasion, their application has been unsuccessful.

job_description_formatted:
Job Description

Thiết kế & Phát triển chương trình huấn luyện

  • Thiết kế lộ trình huấn luyện Kênh Bancassurance theo khung năng lực dành cho từng đối tượng: Banker, IS, SM và RD
  • Thiết kế các chương trình huấn luyện kỹ năng theo lộ trình và theo nhu cầu của đối tác, lực lượng kinh doanh.
  • Phối hợp với bộ phận DTD nhận chuyển giao các chương trình theo quy định.
  • Phói hợp với Đói tác/ IT/ bộ phận liên quan thiết kế tài liệu đào tạo Elearning phù hợp với mô hình bán của từng Đối tác
  • Thiết kế các công cụ đo lường hiệu quả sau khóa học (bài test cuối khóa, phân tích KQ bán hàng của học viên sau đào tạo…)

Triển khai huấn luyện

  • Huấn luyện các khóa đào tạo cho đối tác ngân hàng về kiến thức nghiệp vụ & kỹ năng từ cơ bản đến nâng cao; đảm bảo đào tạo theo đúng lộ trình và đạt được mục tiêu đào tạo
  • Nội dung đào tạo, truyền tải đảm bảo có tính ứng dụng thực tiễn phù hợp với năng lực/ nhu cầu đào tạo của từng đối tượng học viên
  • Phối hợp với bộ phận Phát triển kinh doanh, thực hiện các chương trình đào tạo hỗ trợ theo nhu cầu của từng đối tác.

Phát triển năng lực BancaTrainer

  • Hỗ trợ phát triển năng lực chuyên môn của Banca Trainer
  • Chuyển giao các chương trình cho Banca Trainer, và cấp quản lý bán hàng (SM/TD/RD) kênh Bancassurance

Các công việc khác: Theo phân công của Tổng/Phó Tổng Giám đốc/ Giám đốc Kênh Bancassurance/ Trưởng phòng Đào tạo kênh Bancassurance

Qualifications

  • Tốt nghiệp Đại học các ngành Kinh tế, QTKD
  • Có ít nhất 5 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí tương đương.
  • Có kinh nghiệm đào tạo cho các Dự án Bancassurance (ưu tiên Dự án MB, TCB, Sacom…)
  • Kỹ năng Quản lý & tổ chức công việc tốt; Giao tiếp tốt; Duy trì mối quan hệ với đối tác ngân hàng và đội ngũ kinh doanh
  • Chịu áp lực công việc cường độ cao.
  • Thành thạo Word, Excel, và Powerpoint
  • Ngoại ngữ Tiếng Anh – giao tiếp thông thường

job_description_formatted:
VIETNAM, APLA

Who You’ll Work With

This role is a part of the Purchasing team helps Air Manufacturing and Innovation (AIR MI) win by leveraging our suppliers and our scale. Reporting directly to Manager, Materials Costing Procurement at in Beaverton, Oregon, you and will partner with our cross functional stakeholders to drive value and use facts to create leverage. The Purchasing team works with stakeholders across the manufacturing organization such as engineering, facilities, maintenance, and production, and partners closely to understand their buying strategy and needs.

Who We Are Looking For

We are seeking an experienced Buyer I to join our team in Dong Nai, Vietnam, and play a crucial role in our procurement and purchasing operations. You will have strong in-depth knowledge and experience in end-to-end purchasing processes from sourcing quality products and negotiating with suppliers to monitoring inventory levels and ensuring timely delivery. You will have experience with requisitions, purchase orders, supplier selection, supplier consolidation in a manufacturing environment, and will be able to navigate purchasing modules in a large ERP system. You will have strong communication skills and will be articulate in speaking and written communications. This role requires you to lead various stakeholders to drive consensus and to adhere to required purchasing policies. You will be able to take a complex situation and simplify to ensure understanding, communication, and solving issues.

Additionally, you will apply best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve and drive savings for products, processes or services. You will work independently, receiving minimal guidance, and will communicate articulately and coherently across all levels of staff, cross functionally. This includes communicating and advising the business on purchasing requirements, across facilities within Vietnam and also across the two plants in the United States. You will ensure all purchasing activities are conducted in compliance with company policies and legal requirements, and maintain accurate records of purchases, contracts, and related documents to facilitate audits and reviews.

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in purchasing, procurement, or supply chain management.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
  • Proficient communication skills in both written and spoken English are essential
  • Experience in managing relationship both internally and externally
  • Ability to predict, manage, and avoid supply risk
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to forecast demand, manage inventory, and prevent stockouts
  • Understanding of manufacturing techniques, logistical constraints, and legal issues is required
  • Familiarity with sourcing process and prior experience in manufacturing environment is preferred
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills are needed, both within Vietnam and cross functionally
  • Experience in business coursework is advantageous, along project management skills or experience are desirable
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity, demonstrate creative problem-solving skills, think quickly and articulate problems effectively
  • Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suite (Coupa, Aravo, PEGA)
  • Advanced skills in Excel are essential
  • Exceptional organizational and analytical skills, with attention to detail are necessary
  • Ability to work independently and make informed decisions under pressure is crucial

What You’ll Work On

  • You will drive purchasing operational excellence which includes leveraging preferred purchasing/transaction methods, payment methodology.
  • You will play an integral role in driving efficiency, managing supplier relationships, and supporting our commitment to delivering quality products to our stakeholders
  • You will perform purchasing transactions related to procurement operations (Purchase Order, requisitions, vendor master, supplier relationship management, invoice problem solving), source various goods and services, and support implementation and adherence to operational policies, processes and procedures.
  • You will collaborate with Air MI Purchasing team members to leverage best practices, tools, and to ensure process consistency across all locations. When appropriate, you will execute a competitive bidding process: Request for Quote, Proposal, Information (RFx), spend analysis, and perform contract reviews and negotiations for business terms
