job_description_formatted:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

The Communications team aims to empower and provide delightful communication experiences for our consumers and partners. The scope of our team is broad. We handle everything from ensuring our underlying comms delivery systems are stable and reliable, the internal tools for marketing & ops to craft campaigns, the intelligent optimization layers, and all of our two-way comms channels. It's a large and exciting scope that touches every part of Grab.

As a Platform team, we work horizontally across all teams to build for the future needs of Grab's ecosystem of services and partners. We also push for scalability and reusability to ensure our consumers and partners have a consistent and delightful experience.

Get to Know the Role

As a Lead Product Manager on the Comms team, you will drive the product vision for one of our problem space teams. You'll be at the forefront in building scalable platform solutions that extend across all our products, services, and markets.

Historically, our efforts were focused on providing reliable and cost-efficient communications channels, but we are starting to invest in multiple growth areas within this space. It's an exciting time to join the team, as most of the foundations have been laid for us to start experimenting with innovative ways of solving some of the biggest problems our consumers and partners face.

You will be an individual contributor with a large scope of responsibility, from shaping the strategy, to influencing cross-organizational stakeholders and building alliances with teams to support the execution of your vision.

This role is based onsite at Grab's office in Vietnam, and you'll be reporting to the Senior Product Management Leader - Communication and Marketing Technology Platforms.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

Product Vision And Strategy

  • Develop and drive the product vision and strategy for your problem space team, aligning it with the overall product vision and business objectives.
  • Create a roadmap that prioritizes and optimally sequences product features to enhance our communication offerings' reliability and user experience.
  • Propose and explore new features and technologies to maintain a competitive edge and continually improve our platform's value proposition.

Data-Driven Decisions

  • Leverage data analytics and insights to understand user behavior, gaps in current experience, and discover areas where Comms can enhance the experience for our consumers and partners
  • Use data to make informed decisions, optimize existing features, troubleshoot edge cases, and guide the development of new platform capabilities that enable functional teams to achieve their objectives.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Lead a problem space team together with cross-functional leaders from engineering, design, analytics, and business.
  • Foster a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing within the team and across the organization.
  • Effectively communicate product updates, roadmap, and performance to stakeholders and leadership, addressing their concerns and incorporating feedback into product iterations.
  • Establish strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, representing the voice of the product and fostering collaboration for mutual success.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

  • At least 5 years of experience in Product Management, ideally in roles focusing on communications, messaging, or social experiences in the tech industry.
  • Highly proficient in English, particularly in strategic communications with senior business & technical stakeholders.
  • Proven success in defining and implementing successful product strategies and roadmaps.
  • Demonstrated success in creating and managing products through:
  • Employment of design thinking in synthesizing requirements,
  • Inclusion of customer-centricity into every stage of the product life cycle,
  • Leading by influence of a large, culturally diverse, and distributed team,
  • Making data-driven decisions across the product lifecycle
  • Demonstrated success in managing products from concept to retirement.
  • Familiarity with SaaS or technology industry trends.
  • High degree of empathy for both peers, partners, and our end-users.
  • Passion for creating outstanding and delightful user experience

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

  • We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
  • With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
  • Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
  • We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
  • Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

job_description_formatted:
Job Information

Job Title

Biology Teacher - Part-Time (20H/week)

Job Description

Key Responsibility Areas


*Curriculum

To teach Biology lessons with regard to the Australian Curriculum Biology framework.

To teach SACE Biology subjects.

To prepare and submit programs each semester in line with school requirements.

To communicate teaching, learning and assessment activities and feedback to students using the school’s Learning Management System.

To develop programs which cater inclusively to all students, supporting those in need as well as those requiring extension.

To work with other teachers of Biology to ensure consistency of program and assessment across year levels.

* Assessment and Reporting

To assess and report on student achievement in line with the Australian Curriculum Biology Achievement Standard.

To maintain accurate and comprehensive records of student performance and achievement.

To use a variety of formative and summative assessment methods.

To provide relevant and meaningful feedback, regularly and promptly, to promote student learning.

To provide parents/ caregivers with meaningful reports on student achievement.

To participate in internal and external moderation processes.

* Teaching and Learning

To model exemplary teaching practice.

To use a range of teaching and learning strategies, including but not limited to, direct instruction – whole class and small group, class discussions, group work, independent learning, practical activities.

To conduct formal parent - teacher meetings in accordance with the school parent - teacher meeting arrangements and schedule.

To actively seek and be involved in opportunities for your own professional learning.

To participate in an annual appraisal process, which includes feedback from students.

* General

To contribute broadly to the activities offered by the School, including supporting and attending School community events and participating in promotional activities at the request of the site Principal.

To attend all staff meetings.

To undertake other duties as required.

To demonstrate a commitment to professional learning in relation to the requirements of this role.


* Safety and wellbeing

We care significantly for your safety. You must:

take reasonable care of, and cooperate with actions taken to protect, the health and safety of both yourself and others,

report all accidents, incidents and hazards as soon as is practicable and adhere to School policies.

Job Requirement

* Key selection criteria: Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Bachelor of Biology Education degree (or equivalent).

Valid teaching certification.

3-year experience teaching at high school, senior secondary school or university.

Ability to work in Vietnam.

Fluent English Speaker - language proficiency of IELTS 7.5 or equivalent.

Proficiency in use of technology for teaching, learning and assessment.

* Highly Desirable

Experience in teaching the Australian Curriculum and/or SACE or teaching in another Australian senior secondary program.

* Key selection criteria: Personal Attributes

Ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with staff, students and parents from diverse backgrounds.

A high degree of professional judgment and confidentiality.

Superior organizational ability with demonstrated self-motivation and initiative in goal setting, prioritizing work and managing multiple tasks.

Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to listen and communicate effectively across all areas and levels of a school community.

Well-developed problem-solving skills and proven experience in creating solutions.

Well-developed verbal and written communication skills when communicating in English.

* Remuneration

A competitive remuneration package will be offered to successful applicants in accordance with applicants’ qualifications and experience, including allowances.

Private health insurance.

Non-contact time for planning and marking.

* Conditions of employment

Applicants must be eligible to work in Vietnam.

Applicants must satisfy relevant pre-employment screening and agree to adhere to the School Child Protection Policy.

Applicants must be prepared to work flexible hours to service the School’s activities, which at times, may include evening or weekend work.

* How to apply

Applicants must include the following documents in their application:

Cover letter – maximum 1 page

CV / Resume – maximum 2 pages, containing professional references (one must be the most recent employer). Please ensure your CV clearly states the education qualification(s) you hold, and the issuing institution, e.g., Bachelor of Education (Biology), University of South Australia.

Copy of relevant qualifications and certificates – e.g., university degree, teaching license, IELTS report or other documents as relevant to the role for which you are applying.

job_description_formatted:
About Us

SharkNinja is a global product design and technology company, with a diversified portfolio of 5-star rated lifestyle solutions that positively impact people’s lives in homes around the world. Powered by two trusted, global brands, Shark and Ninja, the company has a proven track record of bringing disruptive innovation to market, and developing one consumer product after another has allowed SharkNinja to enter multiple product categories, driving significant growth and market share gains. Headquartered in Needham, Massachusetts with more than 3,600+ associates, the company’s products are sold at key retailers, online and offline, and through distributors around the world.

Overview

Responsible for best time, best cost and correct SEA PCBA factory for the PCBA delivery on small appliance product development. Provide electronics project management and coordination support in the SEA project life cycle which included but not limited for the coordination with in Pilot Buil, Engineering Build, and Mass Production.

LOCATION: Hochiminh (HCMC) in Vietnam

Here are some of the EXCITING things you’ll get to do:

  • To work with US/China/UK technical project management team to ensure the PCBA build successfully in SEA factories, includes but not limited of Vietnam, Thailand, and Indonisia, Mylasia.
  • Work closely with US TPM team for tracking and ensuring the correct PCBA source is used
  • Work closely with CN-TPM team to ensure the SEA launch in time
  • Joint the unit build in the unit factory and collect the PCBA topics
  • Worked with Unit Factory on PCBA issues collection and work with CN and US EE team for issue tracking
  • Searching and collect SEA local EE components potentially
  • Worked with local SN team to coordinate the PCBA topics, the team can be: NPI, Supply Chain, Quality team within SN
  • Trouble Shooting coordination on PCBA

Attributes & Skills

  • Experience:
  • 1-3 years working experience on electronics area (development or manufacturing,…)
  • 1-3 years on project coordination for the product development
  • Technical knowledge requirement
  • Basic knowledge on Electronics Design
  • Basoc knowledge of electronics component (MOS, TRIAC, relay, IR…) selection and verification.
  • Basic knowledge of design for manufacture and PCBA manufactures process.
  • Communication Skills
  • Good skills in reading, writing and oral English communication.
  • Good skills in technical writing, explain technical issue and solution clearly and focusing.
  • Good communicating skills to cooperate with different teams.

Education/Certifications/Affiliations

  • Bachelor degree in electronics engineering or automation, or other related majors.

Travel Requirements

  • Be flexible for domestic and international travel.

Our Culture

At SharkNinja, we don’t just raise the bar—we push past it every single day. Our Outrageously Extraordinary mindset drives us to tackle the impossible, push boundaries, and deliver results that others only dream of. If you thrive on breaking out of your swim lane, you’ll be right at home.

What We Offer

We offer competitive health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, employee stock purchase options, wellness programs, SharkNinja product discounts, and more. We empower your personal and professional growth with high impact Learning Programs featuring bold voices redefining what’s possible. When you join, you’re not just part of a company—you’re part of an outrageously extraordinary community. Together, we won’t just launch products—we’ll disrupt entire markets.

At SharkNinja, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are vital to our global success. Valuing each unique voice and blending all of our diverse skills strengthens SharkNinja’s innovation every day. We support ALL associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.

Learn More About Us

 Life At SharkNinja

Outrageously Extraordinary

For candidates based in China, please visit: https://sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/china/

For candidates based in Vietnam, please visit: https://www.sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/vietnam/

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other class protected by legislation, and local law. SharkNinja will consider reasonable accommodations consistent with legislation, and local law. job_title: Funded traineeship for young graduates at the EU Delegation to Vietnam - Development Cooperation Section
job_summary: PRINT Funded traineeship for young graduates at the EU Delegation to Vietnam - Development Cooperation Section 23.07.2025 Expired Teaser The deadline for submitting applications is 08/08/2025 by 17h00 (Vietnam time). Text Are you a young graduate interested in international relations? Are you curious to learn more about work of a diplomatic mission and how the EU Delegation represents EU interests and values in Vietnam? We Offer A traineeship of up to 6 months within the Development Cooperation Section of the EU Delegation to Vietnam, starting in October/ November 2025,. The Cooperation Section of the EU Delegation to Vietnam manages the bilateral development assistance provided by the EU to Vietnam. Main Tasks Contribute to the management of development projects covering various sectors at different stages in the project life cycle; Review and comment on proposals, reports, and other project-related documents; Draft briefings and speeches for the Head and Deputy Head of Cooperation and the Head of Delegation and report back on meetings and events; Assist in meeting and interactions with a variety of partners, including Government counterparts, EU Member States, implementing partners, private sector; Contribute to the analysis of developments in a variety of sectors; Contribute to the work of other sections in the Delegation as and when required We Look For Qualifications or special requirements: University degree in the fields of humanities, social sciences, politics, economy or environment/climate change with an international focus; Willingness and ability to quickly familiarise with the EU‚Äôs rules and regulations for development cooperation; Interest and ability to work in a multicultural environment; Perfect command of English; Proficiency in the use of IT applications How to apply? Candidates must apply to the e-mail address DELEGATION-VIETNAM-VACANCY@eeas.europa.eu and send the following documents: A detailed standard Europass curriculum vitae (CV) https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/ (CVs in other format will not be considered) a cover letter describing why you want to participate in a EU traineeship and an application form Please mention in the subject of your e-mail : Funded Traineeship - Development Cooperation Section Important information to read before applying Before applying you are requested to examine the dedicated website as well as the general eligibility criteria for a paid traineeship (Article 8 of the Decision ADMIN(2017)28 ‚Äì Paid traineeship). Each selected trainee will receive a monthly grant to cover living expenses. All costs related to travels, visa, insurance, accommodation must be borne by the trainee. Applications from non-eligible candidates will not be considered. After the evaluation of all applications, shortlisted candidates will be contacted and invited for an interview. Unsuccessful candidates will be notified by email. In case the selected candidates are not able to present the required documents, their application will be rejected. The traineeships can only be offered in compliance with the local legislation as well as the legislation of the country of origin. Citizens From EU Member States must provide proof that they will be covered against the risk of a pandemic and the costs of repatriation; must hold a relevant entrance visa and / or temporary residence permit where applicable, based on the traineeship agreement, the duration of the traineeship, and in compliance with the local legislation. Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
PRINT

Funded traineeship for young graduates at the EU Delegation to Vietnam - Development Cooperation Section

23.07.2025 Expired

Teaser

The deadline for submitting applications is 08/08/2025 by 17h00 (Vietnam time).

Text

Are you a young graduate interested in international relations? Are you curious to learn more about work of a diplomatic mission and how the EU Delegation represents EU interests and values in Vietnam?

We Offer

A traineeship of up to 6 months within the Development Cooperation Section of the EU Delegation to Vietnam, starting in October/ November 2025,.

The Cooperation Section of the EU Delegation to Vietnam manages the bilateral development assistance provided by the EU to Vietnam.

Main Tasks

  • Contribute to the management of development projects covering various sectors at different stages in the project life cycle;
  • Review and comment on proposals, reports, and other project-related documents;
  • Draft briefings and speeches for the Head and Deputy Head of Cooperation and the Head of Delegation and report back on meetings and events;
  • Assist in meeting and interactions with a variety of partners, including Government counterparts, EU Member States, implementing partners, private sector;
  • Contribute to the analysis of developments in a variety of sectors;
  • Contribute to the work of other sections in the Delegation as and when required

We Look For

Qualifications or special requirements:

  • University degree in the fields of humanities, social sciences, politics, economy or environment/climate change with an international focus;
  • Willingness and ability to quickly familiarise with the EU’s rules and regulations for development cooperation;
  • Interest and ability to work in a multicultural environment;
  • Perfect command of English;
  • Proficiency in the use of IT applications

How to apply?

Candidates must apply to the e-mail address DELEGATION-VIETNAM-VACANCY@eeas.europa.eu and send the following documents:

  • A detailed standard Europass curriculum vitae (CV) https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/ (CVs in other format will not be considered)
  • a cover letter describing why you want to participate in a EU traineeship
  • and an application form

Please mention in the subject of your e-mail: Funded Traineeship - Development Cooperation Section

Important information to read before applying

Before applying you are requested to examine the dedicated website as well as the general eligibility criteria for a paid traineeship (Article 8 of the Decision ADMIN(2017)28 – Paid traineeship).

Each selected trainee will receive a monthly grant to cover living expenses. All costs related to travels, visa, insurance, accommodation must be borne by the trainee.

Applications from non-eligible candidates will not be considered. After the evaluation of all applications, shortlisted candidates will be contacted and invited for an interview. Unsuccessful candidates will be notified by email. In case the selected candidates are not able to present the required documents, their application will be rejected.

The traineeships can only be offered in compliance with the local legislation as well as the legislation of the country of origin.

Citizens From EU Member States

  • must provide proof that they will be covered against the risk of a pandemic and the costs of repatriation;
  • must hold a relevant entrance visa and / or temporary residence permit where applicable, based on the traineeship agreement, the duration of the traineeship, and in compliance with the local legislation.

job_description_formatted:
This is a remote position.

About Sunbytes

Sunbytes is a leading Tech & Talent Solutions company known for innovative and scalable solutions. We focus on achieving goals for our partners and team members, delivering high-quality products and services, and fostering a supportive, challenging work environment. Our diverse team shares a common purpose, making Sunbytes a great place to work.

We offer comprehensive long-term partnerships, including recruitment, dedicated worldwide talents, and custom software development, tailored to meet client needs.

About The Role

Sunbytes is actively seeking a highly skilled [Remote] Backend Engineer (Node.js_Go) to work remotely with our Australian client in a distributed engineering team globally. You will have a chance to join an Australian SaaS company that specializes in sales funnel plug-in and optimization platform.

Responsibilities

As a Backend Engineer (Node.js_Go) , you will join their team of multinational engineers and collaborate directly with Australian tech leads. You will earn a competitive salary while working in a collaborative, high-trust engineering culture, with plenty of opportunities to work with cutting-edge frontend tech, all at the comfort of your own home. The ideal candidate will be responsible for:

  • Ship robust microservices in Node (TypeScript) and Go
  • Design API contracts (GraphQL, REST, WebSockets) and enforce schema discipline
  • Write automated tests (unit, integration, e2e) and maintain CI pipelines
  • Instrument code for metrics and tracing with dashboards and alerts
  • Troubleshoot production issues, lead root-cause analysis and remediation
  • Report actionable progress to the Technical Lead & Architect

Technical Skills

  • 6+ years building production backends in TypeScript/Node.js
  • Proficiency in Go (or strong willingness to ramp up quickly)
  • Deep knowledge of GraphQL and REST API design patterns
  • Familiarity with realtime protocols
  • Solid AWS experience deploying containerised workloads
  • Experience adding observability (metrics, tracing, logging) to distributed systems
  • Solid Git workflow knowledge (feature branches, PRs, code reviews)

Nice To Have

  • Terraform and GitOps workflows
  • Experience with Redis, Supabase, Postgres, SQLite, DynamoDB
  • Exposure to LLM/RAG/MCP pipelines
  • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM integrations
  • Advanced CI/CD (multi-stage builds, blue-green deployments)

Soft Skills

  • Self-motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Experience working in agile and remote environments

Benefits

  • Working full-time, completely remote
  • Total 20 days of annual leave (including 10 sick leave days)
  • Collaborative, high-trust engineering culture
  • Opportunities to work with cutting-edge frontend tech
  • Learning and development opportunities sponsored by the company (conference, workshop…)
  • Business casual work environment
  • A dynamic and international team, providing a great career journey
  • Working laptop provided

At Sunbytes, you’ll be part of a vibrant team dedicated to innovation and excellence. Your creativity and passion will make a real impact on the future of tech and talent in Vietnam.

Ready to take the next step in your career? Send your updated resume to cv-inbox@sunbytes.io . We can’t wait to meet you!

job_description_formatted:
Our client is a talent marketplace that connects top-tier remote software developers with companies looking to scale their engineering teams.


By leveraging an AI-driven platform, the client streamlines the hiring process, matching businesses with developers skilled in cloud technologies, data, AI, and software engineering.


Need to have qualifications:

  • 2+ years of proven success in high-volume B2B sales, consistently exceeding quotas.
  • 1+ year of experience using HubSpot, focusing on sales tools such as contact records, sequences, templates, and tasks.
  • 1+ year of leveraging LinkedIn Sales Navigator for prospect research and outreach.
  • Demonstrated ability to make 50+ daily cold calls to US-based prospects, converting them into meaningful conversations with decision-makers.
  • Strong communication skills, with experience interacting with C-suite executives.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with meticulous CRM documentation practices.
  • Availability to work 40 hours per week (9 hours daily, Mon-Fri, between 8 AM - 7 PM EST).


Nice to have:

  • Experience creating and sending prospecting videos, such as LinkedIn video DMs.
  • Background in sophisticated social selling strategies to turn cold outreach into warm opportunities.
  • A strong LinkedIn presence, including a portfolio showcasing successful relationship-building methodologies.


Other areas we’ll consider:

  • Comfort with high-volume cold calling, objection handling, and following structured scripts to qualify leads and engage decision-makers.
  • Familiarity with managing a large number of open opportunities within a structured sales pipeline.
  • Strong soft skills, including influence, adaptability, and the ability to refine sales approaches based on feedback.


Responsibilities:

  • Conduct 50+ outbound cold calls daily to engage decision-makers and generate qualified leads.
  • Build and maintain a powerful LinkedIn presence through strategic comments, connections, InMail, and DMs.
  • Manage a pipeline of 150+ opportunities weekly, nurturing prospects through the sales process.
  • Consistently book 3-5 qualified appointments per week through methodical prospecting and outreach.
  • Develop creative, professional pathways to connect with hard-to-reach prospects.
  • Execute structured touch plans, maintaining consistent follow-up to drive conversions.
  • Maintain pristine data hygiene across contact records, tasks, and sequence steps within HubSpot.
  • Continuously improve sales techniques through feedback and collaboration with senior team members.

job_description_formatted:
By applying to this position, your application is automatically considered for a range of Marketing roles we have at STEAM for Vietnam. If we believe there's a fit, our team will reach out to learn more about your background and discuss relevant opportunities.

This is an unpaid, volunteer opportunity.


About Us

STEAM for Vietnam Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization committed to delivering free, world-class STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics) education to Vietnamese students. Our global volunteer team includes passionate professionals and students from around the world who believe in the power of education to change lives.


Role Overview

We’re looking for a creative, detail-oriented, and passionate Content Lead to help shape the voice and narrative of STEAM for Vietnam across all channels. From press releases to taglines, from email campaigns to program promotions—you will be at the heart of how we tell our story to the world.

This role is ideal for someone who loves storytelling, understands brand tone, and can manage content production from strategy to execution.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and lead a content strategy that communicates our mission, programs, and impact across digital platforms.
  • Craft compelling content including—but not limited to—taglines, email marketing, press releases, landing page copy, and campaign messages.
  • Work with the design, event, and social media teams to ensure content is on-brand and aligned across platforms.
  • Build and manage a small team of writers and contributors, and mentor junior team members.
  • Maintain a clear, consistent voice across all content while adapting tone and style for various formats and audiences.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with other departments to support campaigns, events, and partnerships.


Required Qualifications

Experience

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in content marketing, copywriting, journalism, or a related field.
  • At least 1 year of experience in a leadership or team management role.

Skills

  • Excellent writing and editing skills in both English and Vietnamese (preferred).
  • Strong understanding of branding, storytelling, and content planning.
  • Ability to translate complex ideas into simple, engaging messages.
  • Organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple deadlines.
  • Bonus: experience working with email platforms (Mailchimp, etc.), PR/media writing, or SEO.


Why Join Us?

  • Play a leading role in shaping the voice of one of Vietnam’s most innovative education nonprofits.
  • Work with an international team of passionate, mission-driven professionals.
  • Build your leadership portfolio and creative writing skills in real-world campaigns.
  • Flexible hours, fully remote, and lots of learning opportunities.

job_summary: About Us At Bjak, we are on a mission to provide access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance platform in Southeast Asia, helping millions find the best value and highest coverage insurance policies through our platform, Bjak.com. We invest in cutting-edge technologies, including Custom APIs, trading systems, and data science, to simplify financial services that were previously complex and inaccessible. Our expertise in navigating regulatory challenges has enabled us to develop some of the most innovative financial products, such as the first investment-linked life and health insurance platform with instant agent support. If you enjoy building cutting-edge platforms and ecosystems to drive AI innovations and provide equal access to financial services, we‚Äôd love to speak with you! We are looking for an AI Engineer based in Vietnam , working fully remote while collaborating with our Malaysia team . Key Responsibilities Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define AI project objectives, requirements, and timelines. Design, develop, and implement AI models, algorithms, and applications to solve complex business challenges. Oversee the end-to-end AI model lifecycle, including data collection, preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment. Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, incorporating best practices into projects. Drive data-driven decision-making through advanced analytics and visualization techniques. Ensure the security, scalability, and efficiency of AI solutions. Lead research efforts to explore and integrate cutting-edge AI techniques. Requirements Bachelor's, Master‚Äôs, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field. Must be based in Vietnam and open to working remotely while collaborating with our Malaysia team. Proven experience as an AI Engineer, Principal Engineer, or Data Scientist, with a track record of leading successful AI projects. Proficiency in AI and ML frameworks and programming languages (e.g., Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn). Strong expertise in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation. Experience in deploying and optimizing AI models in a production environment. Excellent problem-solving, analytical thinking, and debugging skills. Strong leadership, communication, and team management abilities. Passion for staying at the forefront of AI and machine learning advancements. Benefits Fully remote working arrangement based in Vietnam Exciting projects in a fast-moving, innovative environment Attractive remuneration and performance incentives Strong learning and career growth opportunities International work environment and flat organization Competitive salary Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
About Us

At Bjak, we are on a mission to provide access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance platform in Southeast Asia, helping millions find the best value and highest coverage insurance policies through our platform, Bjak.com.

We invest in cutting-edge technologies, including Custom APIs, trading systems, and data science, to simplify financial services that were previously complex and inaccessible. Our expertise in navigating regulatory challenges has enabled us to develop some of the most innovative financial products, such as the first investment-linked life and health insurance platform with instant agent support.

If you enjoy building cutting-edge platforms and ecosystems to drive AI innovations and provide equal access to financial services, we’d love to speak with you!

We are looking for an AI Engineer based in Vietnam, working fully remote while collaborating with our Malaysia team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define AI project objectives, requirements, and timelines.
  • Design, develop, and implement AI models, algorithms, and applications to solve complex business challenges.
  • Oversee the end-to-end AI model lifecycle, including data collection, preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment.
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, incorporating best practices into projects.
  • Drive data-driven decision-making through advanced analytics and visualization techniques.
  • Ensure the security, scalability, and efficiency of AI solutions.
  • Lead research efforts to explore and integrate cutting-edge AI techniques.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's, Master’s, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Must be based in Vietnam and open to working remotely while collaborating with our Malaysia team.
  • Proven experience as an AI Engineer, Principal Engineer, or Data Scientist, with a track record of leading successful AI projects.
  • Proficiency in AI and ML frameworks and programming languages (e.g., Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
  • Strong expertise in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
  • Experience in deploying and optimizing AI models in a production environment.
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical thinking, and debugging skills.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and team management abilities.
  • Passion for staying at the forefront of AI and machine learning advancements.

Benefits

  • Fully remote working arrangement based in Vietnam
  • Exciting projects in a fast-moving, innovative environment
  • Attractive remuneration and performance incentives
  • Strong learning and career growth opportunities
  • International work environment and flat organization
  • Competitive salary

job_description_formatted:
Kinobi is a Singapore-based company dedicated to transforming higher education by helping universities go beyond just academics. We focus on holistic student success, ensuring that students are well-prepared for their careers. We're looking for individuals who share our vision and want to make a meaningful impact in education.


Our purpose is to:

  • Empower institutions to guide their beneficiaries toward meaningful employment opportunities
  • Demonstrate to the world that a global B2B SaaS enterprise can be successfully built from Southeast Asia


About the Role:

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Kinobi, you will play a crucial role in developing our core platform and shaping the future of our products. You will be responsible for creating scalable, maintainable, and high-quality code while contributing to the overall development roadmap.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Support the development and eventually take ownership of the application development roadmap, including technical research, prioritization, and action planning.
  • Develop core modules with a clean and scalable architecture.
  • Drive the launch and development of new platform features (details to be shared upon joining).
  • Write clean, testable, and maintainable code that adheres to Kinobi's standards and best practices.
  • Design meaningful analytics to monitor internal metrics and track strategic performance across products, regions, and teams.
  • Research and develop user-friendly UI for both mobile and web platforms.


Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years of experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer.
  • Proficiency in Node.js, Express.js, and UI frameworks like Vue.js, React.js, or similar, with at least 3 years of hands-on experience.
  • Strong experience with MongoDB or similar databases.
  • Solid understanding of software development phases such as compile, build, test, publish, and deploy, particularly for web applications.
  • Comfortable working with Git for version control.
  • Ability to manage tasks effectively, from simple to complex, while leading workloads and managing expectations.
  • Enjoy working on tasks that may have low technical complexity but require high contextual understanding and maturity.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Proficient in documentation.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Previous experience in a fast-paced VUCA environment, such as startups.
  • Experience working as a freelancer on technical projects, with a strong understanding of user needs.
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


Additional Information:

  • All interviews and communication will be conducted in English.
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Essentials provides a simple, fast way for Salesforce developers to select and deploy Salesforce metadata between orgs. The premium edition, called Essentials+, adds version control to provide small development teams with the ability to detect merge conflicts, roll back changes, and a record for audit purposes. Strong understanding of object-oriented design patterns. Fast learner with an interest to solve challenging problems at scale. 2+ years of software engineering experience at innovative and fast-paced organizations. job_description_formatted:
About Copado

Copado is the #1 DevOps Platform for Salesforce and the Cloud. We harness the power of native CI/CD and Robotic Testing to drive digital transformation for 1,000+ of the most innovative brands on the planet — from Coca-Cola to eBay to Volkswagen. Our low-code platform unites non-technical admins and pro-code developers on the same system and empowers enterprises to scale end-to-end software delivery across multi-cloud environments.

The impact on your business? 20X faster releases, 94% fewer production bugs and 46% more Salesforce ROI. The impact on your team? No more late nights, weekend war rooms or stressful release days.

Brief Summary Of Role

This role will be an individual contributor to be part of the development squad for Copado’s Essential’s DevOps application for the Salesforce platform. Copado Essentials has a rapidly growing global user base of over 10,000 enthusiastic users. We like to say that Salesforce DevOps starts with Copado Essentials. Essentials provides a simple, fast way for Salesforce developers to select and deploy Salesforce metadata between orgs. The premium edition, called Essentials+, adds version control to provide small development teams with the ability to detect merge conflicts, roll back changes, and a record for audit purposes.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Design & engineer elegant, yet scalable DevOps solutions that delight our users.
  • Bring an “AI first” mindset to product development and product features.
  • Ensure quality assurance by setting standards for unit tests, security tests and automated UI tests.
  • Support and maintain Essentials software releases and AWS infrastructure. Work with the development team to ensure system reliability & performance.
  • Partner with the Product team to align on features, build plan and product roadmap.

We Are Looking For Someone With

  • Passionate about software engineering craftsmanship.
  • Demonstrated ability to write secured, modular, clean and well tested code.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented design patterns.
  • Fast learner with an interest to solve challenging problems at scale.
  • 2+ years of software engineering experience at innovative and fast-paced organizations.
  • Fluency in Java and the related ecosystem.
  • Salesforce experience is a plus.
  • Experience with modern Javascript framework (ie. Angular, React) is a plus.
  • Experience using and developing AI solutions is a plus.
  • Experience with building scalable web-based Saas products is a plus.
  • Experience with AWS infrastructure and scaling operations is a plus.
  • Open source contribution is a plus.
  • Proficient in both verbal and written English communication skills

Disclaimer: Copado is Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Copado does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Copado will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Copado.

job_description_formatted:
Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Prepare daily sales and KPI reports for the business unit.
  • Prepare monthly financial statements for group and affiliated companies.
  • In charge of all monthly/quarterly/yearly accounting reports for all entities of the group, including assisting in preparation of group financial consolidation reports, tax filing documents, cashflow management report, bank and crypto reconciliation report.
  • Bank transfer operations.
  • Liaise with the company's accounting firm to provide information necessary for the preparation of annual accounts and statutory books of accounts.
  • Petty cash management and staff billing management.
  • Assist with back office operation, including but not limited to research on regulatory requirements, licenses, and legal matters related to the business, company incorporation and legal support.


Skills & Requirements:

  • Knowledge of key accounting activities and terms, able to read financial statements.
  • Digital literacy, ablto to use general spreadsheet functions like IF function, Vlookup, etc.
  • Business level Japanese language proficiency to communicate with Japanese speaking accounting firm and finance team in Japan (non-English speaking).


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with bookkeeping
  • Experience with accounting for multiple entities
  • Experience with back office operations, including admin, compliance
  • Preferably located in Singapore.

job_description_formatted:
KeyTiger, a US-based e-commerce business in the home décor/interior design industry, is seeking highly-motivated and competent individuals to join our remote team. If you have high attention-to-detail, possess excellent English communication skills, and are interested in a full time work from home / online position, apply now!


Position: Business Analyst (20+ POSITIONS OPEN)

Work Schedule: 4AM-12PM Hanoi Time, Tue-Sat

Salary: $500 to $1,300* monthly


Benefits include:

- Holidays: Paid US Public Holidays

- Paid Time Off: 11 accrued personal days off per year

- Growth: Bonus and salary increase depending on performance


Primary Responsibilities

1. Supply chain and vendor support

2. Full product definition, inventory and price analysis

3. Creating purchase orders

4. Bookkeeping (quarterly reports, sales tax)

5. Digital advertising


Requirements

1. Excellent spoken and written English skills

2. Stable, high-speed internet connection

3. Willingness to be trained and work with us long-term (must have no other job obligations)

4. Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel – IMPORTANT: Only proceed if you have advanced knowledge in Excel and are used to dealing with a LARGE set of data in a highly detailed manner. Just knowing SUM or IF formulas and pivot tables will not be enough. This position is most suited for candidates who have used Excel for multiple years and know the true depths of how complicated Excel is. Knowledge of VBA is an advantage.


*Published salary is for starting only. Multiple salary increases within a year are possible in order to match an employee's skill level.


INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO APPLY


Email the requirements below to recruiting@keytiger.com:

1. The most recent copy of your resume (as a file attachment)

2. Your complete name and phone number

3. Your Skype ID


Note: Use the job title as the subject of your email, e.g. "Business Analyst".


IMPORTANT (You must reply to the email): You will receive an autoreply with a few questions immediately after sending your email application. If you don't get an autoreply within 1-2 minutes, check your spam/junk folder or message us at fb.com/KeyTigerRecruitmentPage.


Tell your friends about this job opening for a chance to receive a REFERRAL BONUS of $300! For more information, go to fb.com/KeyTigerRecruitmentPage/posts/3664062487153323.

job_description_formatted:
STADA Pymepharco chính thức trở thành thành viên và là thành viên duy nhất tại Việt Nam của STADA vào năm 2021.

Là một trong những nhà sản xuất dược phẩm hàng đầu tại Việt Nam, STADA Pymepharco cam kết cung cấp thuốc chất lượng quốc tế với giá cả phải chăng.

  • 2 nhà máy sản xuất đạt tiêu chuẩn EU-GMP tại Tuy Hòa, Phú Yên, với năng lực sản xuất hàng năm gần 3 tỷ đơn vị.
  • 1500++ nhân viên trên toàn quốc
  • Tại Việt Nam, STADA Pymepharco sở hữu danh mục thuốc gần 400 sản phẩm, bao gồm gần 250 sản phẩm Thuốc kê đơn và 150 Sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe - trong đó khoảng 80 sản phẩm được đánh giá tương đương sinh học so với thuốc phát minh.
  • 12.000++ khách hàng trên toàn quốc, bao gồm bệnh viện, nhà thuốc và các cơ sở kinh doanh dược khác.

Là một đối tác tin cậy trong chăm sóc sức khỏe cộng đồng, chúng tôi hướng tới cung cấp các sản phẩm "Tiêu chuẩn Đức" tại Việt Nam và vươn ra thế giới. STADA Pymepharco kế thừa Sứ mệnh và Tầm nhìn của Tập đoàn STADA là “Chăm sóc sức khỏe cộng đồng như một đối tác tin cậy” và “Trở thành đối tác được lựa chọn trong lĩnh vực thuốc Generics và chăm sóc sức khỏe, đồng thời liên tục phát triển vượt trội so với ngành về mặt tăng trưởng và lợi nhuận”.

Các giá trị cốt lõi của Tập đoàn STADA về Chính trực, Tinh thần doanh nhân, Nhanh nhạy, và One STADA là kim chỉ nam cho mọi hành động và quyết định của mọi nhân viên STADA Pymepharco.

Sales Reps / Nhân viên kinh doanh - Toàn quốc

| Việt Nam (VN) | Toàn Thời Gian |

Khu vực tuyển dụng: Toàn quốc

Mô tả công việc:

  • Triển khai kế hoạch bán hàng để phát triển doanh số
  • Quản lý và thu hồi công nợ
  • Phối hợp với Quản lý kinh doanh trong việc tìm kiếm khai thác bán hàng, mở rộng mạng lưới bán hàng cũng như xử lý và giải quyết các vấn đề thắc mắc của khách hàng
  • Báo cáo công việc theo quy định

Yêu cầu công việc:

  • Ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm bán hàng, kinh nghiệm tại các công ty MNCs
  • Có khả năng giao tiếp và thuyết phục tốt
  • Chịu khó, nhanh nhạy
  • Biết sử dụng các phần mềm ứng dụng (word, excel, ...)
  • Trình độ: tốt nghiệp Trung cấp/Đại học Dược, Đại học/Cao đẳng kinh tế

Quyền lợi của bạn:

  • Mức lương cơ bản: 9 - 12 triệu + Phụ cấp + thưởng doanh số
  • Mức đóng bảo hiểm full lương và đóng từ điểm nhận việc
  • 15 ngày phép năm (đối với nhân viên chính thức)
  • Bảo hiểm sức khỏe Bảo Việt cho nhân viên và người thân

#PW

Bạn đang tìm kiếm những thử thách mới nơi bạn có thể tạo ra sự khác biệt cho Sức khỏe của mọi người? Chúng tôi đang tìm kiếm những ứng viên với kiến thức chuyên môn và tinh thần doanh nhân để trải nghiệm môi trường làm việc hợp tác trên phạm vi toàn cầu. Chúng tôi rất vui được làm quen với bạn. Vui lòng sử dụng cổng thông tin việc làm trực tuyến của chúng tôi để gửi đơn ứng tuyển của bạn: https://jobs.stada.com

job_summary: Senior Lead Product Manager Salary: $2500 - $3500 NET Full Time - Working remotely 5 days per week/ 8 hours per day Job Description: We are looking for a Senior Lead Product Manager at Azasend to lead the Product Manager team, shape product strategy, and ensure successful execution. This role requires strong leadership, decisive decision-making, and cross-functional collaboration to deliver impactful, customer-focused solutions. You will oversee the entire product management function within the company. Responsibilities: Product Ideation and Initialization: Conceptualize, assess, and develop innovative product ideas aligned with the company's mission. Define the product's scope, objectives, and key deliverables to align with strategic goals. Oversee roadmaps, timelines, and budgets to ensure efficient and timely delivery of the product. Continuously track product performance, identifying and addressing potential risks proactively. Skilled in UX/UI, helping design easy-to-use and visually appealing interfaces for a great user experience. Business Understanding: Understand users and markets. Leverage data to propose informed solutions and strategies for product development and improvement. Ability to make data-driven decisions at every stage. Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and marketing. Communicate product progress and updates clearly to all stakeholders. Team Coordination: Lead and motivate Product Manager team to achieve KPI. Assign tasks, track progress, and ensure accountability within the PM team. Facilitate team meetings to discuss product updates and resolve challenges. Serve as the primary decision-maker in the company's product development process, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Support and training PM team members when needed. Qualifications: 6+ years of experience in product management. Expertise in various product management methodologies and software development lifecycles. Ability to manage multiple products concurrently. Proven ability to oversee and manage complex product/account portfolios. Experience leading technical teams and delivering complex products. Strong leadership, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment and efficiently handle multiple priorities. Preferred (but not required): PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile certification. To apply: Please send your CV to hr+seniorpm@azasend.com with the Subject Line ‚Äú[Senior Lead Product Manager]" Process: Round 1: Screening CV Round 2: Technical Test Round 3: Panel Interview Show more Show less

job_description_formatted:
Senior Lead Product Manager

Salary: $2500 - $3500 NET

Full Time - Working remotely

5 days per week/ 8 hours per day


Job Description:  

We are looking for a Senior Lead Product Manager at Azasend to lead the Product Manager team, shape product strategy, and ensure successful execution. This role requires strong leadership, decisive decision-making, and cross-functional collaboration to deliver impactful, customer-focused solutions. You will oversee the entire product management function within the company.


Responsibilities:

Product Ideation and Initialization:

  • Conceptualize, assess, and develop innovative product ideas aligned with the company's mission.
  • Define the product's scope, objectives, and key deliverables to align with strategic goals.
  • Oversee roadmaps, timelines, and budgets to ensure efficient and timely delivery of the product.
  • Continuously track product performance, identifying and addressing potential risks proactively.
  • Skilled in UX/UI, helping design easy-to-use and visually appealing interfaces for a great user experience.

Business Understanding:

  • Understand users and markets. 
  • Leverage data to propose informed solutions and strategies for product development and improvement. 
  • Ability to make data-driven decisions at every stage.

Stakeholder Management:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and marketing.
  • Communicate product progress and updates clearly to all stakeholders.

Team Coordination:

  • Lead and motivate Product Manager team to achieve KPI.
  • Assign tasks, track progress, and ensure accountability within the PM team.
  • Facilitate team meetings to discuss product updates and resolve challenges.
  • Serve as the primary decision-maker in the company's product development process, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
  • Support and training PM team members when needed.


Qualifications:

  • 6+ years of experience in product management.
  • Expertise in various product management methodologies and software development lifecycles.
  • Ability to manage multiple products concurrently.
  • Proven ability to oversee and manage complex product/account portfolios.
  • Experience leading technical teams and delivering complex products.
  • Strong leadership, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment and efficiently handle multiple priorities.
  • Preferred (but not required): PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile certification.


To apply: Please send your CV to hr+seniorpm@azasend.com with the Subject Line “[Senior Lead Product Manager]"


Process:

Round 1: Screening CV

Round 2: Technical Test

Round 3: Panel Interview

job_summary: Join us at OORT , a trailblazer in the decentralized AI era, offering a trustless infrastructure built for the future of AI. Powered by the Olympus protocol, OORT provides enterprises and individuals with a suite of decentralized AI products and solutions focused on three core areas: OORT Storage, OORT DataHub (B2C, B2B), and OORT Compute (coming soon). OORT has raised $10 million from prominent investors to date, including Taisu Venture, Red Beard Venture, Sanctor Capital, and has received grants from Microsoft and Google. If you're passionate about tech, blockchain, and innovation, check out our open roles The Role The Role As Web3 & AI Product Growth Manager , you will be at the forefront of growing, engaging, and retaining our global Web3 user base. This role blends strategy with execution ‚Äî from designing high-impact operational plans to working cross-functionally across product, marketing, and engineering to bring them to life. What You‚Äôll Do Lead Web3 Product Operations Develop and execute operational strategies across all lifecycle stages ‚Äî pre-launch, launch, and post-launch ‚Äî aimed at growing and retaining a global Web3 user base. Build User Engagement Systems Design and manage user operations systems with segmentation strategies to boost in-app activity, engagement, and retention. Stay Ahead of Industry Trends Track Web3 market dynamics, emerging trends, and competitor activities; identify opportunities to launch timely campaigns and product enhancements. Own Operational Metrics & Insights Define KPIs and performance metrics, analyze data for insights, and optimize strategies through iterative experimentation. Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Community teams to align operations with product vision and user needs. Ideal Profile What We‚Äôre Looking For Experience: 3+ years in product operations, growth, or similar roles with ownership from strategy to execution ‚Äî ideally in Web3, tech, or SaaS. Web3 Fluency: Deep understanding and genuine interest in the Web3 and AI space; experience in contributing to or scaling Web3 projects is a big plus. User-Centric: Skilled in identifying and meeting user needs; experienced in designing and running user operations strategies in decentralized ecosystems. Data-Driven: Able to define and track key metrics, uncover actionable insights, and continuously refine operational tactics. Nice to Have Experience working in early-stage or high-growth startups Familiarity with blockchain protocols, DAOs, NFTs, DeFi, or similar domains Strong project management and stakeholder alignment skills Why Join Us? Work on cutting-edge products in Web3 and AI Join a fast-growing, remote-first team with a global vision Opportunity to shape the future of decentralized tech Competitive compensation and token incentives What's on Offer? Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Flexible working options Attractive salary & benefits Show more Show less

job_description_formatted:
Join us at OORT, a trailblazer in the decentralized AI era, offering a trustless infrastructure built for the future of AI. Powered by the Olympus protocol, OORT provides enterprises and individuals with a suite of decentralized AI products and solutions focused on three core areas: OORT Storage, OORT DataHub (B2C, B2B), and OORT Compute (coming soon). OORT has raised $10 million from prominent investors to date, including Taisu Venture, Red Beard Venture, Sanctor Capital, and has received grants from Microsoft and Google. If you're passionate about tech, blockchain, and innovation, check out our open roles

The Role

The Role

As Web3 & AI Product Growth Manager, you will be at the forefront of growing, engaging, and retaining our global Web3 user base. This role blends strategy with execution — from designing high-impact operational plans to working cross-functionally across product, marketing, and engineering to bring them to life.

What You’ll Do

Lead Web3 Product Operations

  • Develop and execute operational strategies across all lifecycle stages — pre-launch, launch, and post-launch — aimed at growing and retaining a global Web3 user base.

Build User Engagement Systems

  • Design and manage user operations systems with segmentation strategies to boost in-app activity, engagement, and retention.

Stay Ahead of Industry Trends

  • Track Web3 market dynamics, emerging trends, and competitor activities; identify opportunities to launch timely campaigns and product enhancements.

Own Operational Metrics & Insights

  • Define KPIs and performance metrics, analyze data for insights, and optimize strategies through iterative experimentation.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Community teams to align operations with product vision and user needs.

Ideal Profile

What We’re Looking For

Experience: 3+ years in product operations, growth, or similar roles with ownership from strategy to execution — ideally in Web3, tech, or SaaS.

Web3 Fluency: Deep understanding and genuine interest in the Web3 and AI space; experience in contributing to or scaling Web3 projects is a big plus.

User-Centric: Skilled in identifying and meeting user needs; experienced in designing and running user operations strategies in decentralized ecosystems.

Data-Driven: Able to define and track key metrics, uncover actionable insights, and continuously refine operational tactics.

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in early-stage or high-growth startups
  • Familiarity with blockchain protocols, DAOs, NFTs, DeFi, or similar domains
  • Strong project management and stakeholder alignment skills

Why Join Us?

  • Work on cutting-edge products in Web3 and AI
  • Join a fast-growing, remote-first team with a global vision
  • Opportunity to shape the future of decentralized tech
  • Competitive compensation and token incentives

What's on Offer?

  • Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
  • Flexible working options
  • Attractive salary & benefits

job_description_formatted:
Summary

Location: Ha Noi Hybrid

Novartis is unable to offer relocation support for this role: please only apply if this location is accessible for you.

About The Role:

The MSL is responsible for scientifically engaging, collaborating and aligning with a broad range of external stakeholders to co-create value, address identified patient needs and ultimately change the practice of medicine for better patient access and outcomes. They leverage the right evidence at the right time during their engagements and identify insights and opportunities that impact and inform the Integrated Product Strategy (IPS), Integrated Evidence Generation Plans, launch excellence roadmap, Patient Journey and medical strategies. MSLs also contribute to innovative partnerships and implement relevant disease area strategies. They will act as a strategic scientific partner and collaborate with other Field matrix colleagues (e.g. Value/Market Access, HEOR, clinical research colleagues) to ensure Novartis can support healthcare systems strengthening & improve patient access and outcomes.

This position will report to Field Medical Excellence Lead.

About The Role

  • Be a strategic internal partner, gather and leverage insights for an impactful contribution to Pa-tient Journey mapping, launch excellence roadmap, integrated evidence generation plans, inte-grated product strategy and subsequently the medical strategy.
  • Utilize knowledge of assigned therapeutic area and Novartis compounds to serve as the Medi-cal, Clinical and Scientific expert to field matrix colleagues
  • Identify data gaps, data generation opportunities (including RWE and implementation science, precision medicine), and key unmet needs and opportunities to help improve patient access and outcomes
  • Ensure appropriate identification and mapping of external stakeholders, aligned to the medical strategy, and in collaboration with other Novartis colleagues. Able to create personalized, flexible engagement strategies and plans, leveraging multiple channels and tailored content to meet the changing needs of external stakeholders
  • Personalize and expand external stakeholder engagement beyond Healthcare Professionals. Support and contribute to innovative partnership models for shared ownership in transforming clinical practice
  • Apply foundational impactful Scientific Engagement principles in stakeholder interactions in alignment with medical strategy and portfolio/pipeline prioritization.
  • Communicate the right evidence to the right stakeholder at the right time, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions
  • Respond to unsolicited requests for information from stakeholders by sharing appropriate data regarding marketed and pipeline compounds in a timely, compliant, and stakeholder-focused manner.
  • Adopt and leverage digital channels for a broader, effective, personalized reach and impact, in addition to leading high level impactful scientific events, exchanges and medical education

Essential Requirements:

  • Pharmacist, Masters, or other post-graduate degree in health/life sciences. Doctoral degree preferred (PharmD, PhD, MD)
  • Fluent oral and written English & Local Language.
  • Experience in a medical function (2-3 years preferred) in specialty therapeutic area.
  • Capable of self-directed learning and having a growth mindset
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and influencing skills, with the ability to communicate effectively to a variety of audiences.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

job_summary: Moose Toys exists to make kids super happy. For this revolutionary brand happiness lies at the heart of everything we do. With trailblazing toy design, development and manufacturing, no wonder our toys consistently scoop the most longed-for awards. Sprinkling some Moose magic across categories including action figures, collectibles, craft, dolls, games, plush, preschool, vehicles and youth electronics, we've earned our stripes as one of the most creative companies in the industry. As an energetic bunch, we're always on the move, developing groundbreaking content, entertainment and worldwide licensing deals to boot. This family-run business is proudly built on unshakeable ethical foundations. Our passion for making kids superhappy stretches far beyond our WOW-worthy toys. The Moose Happy Kids Foundation creates moments of happiness and laughter for the children around the world who need it most. We've had a BIG impact on little people, making 3.5 million kids smile so far‚Ä¶ and counting. Australia might be our Moose family home, but with a 500-strong team dotted across the world, we're committed to sharing our signature superhappy revolution far and wide! Visit www.moosetoys.com for more information on our amazing brands and people. Reports To: Illustration Manager Direct Reports: Nil Role Objectives Working directly with MBO Creative Services teams and you will provide digital Art and Photoshop retouching in the following areas: Reworking and retouching of Product and Packaging Photography to best represent the product for marketing purposes. Compositing illustration for Product Branding requirements (Packaging and Marketing assets). Key capabilities Applying Expertise and Technology Has functional, practical, and technical knowledge of Image composition and Adobe Photoshop retouching. Takes ownership of processes and functions and applies this expertise accordingly. Shares this expertise and knowledge with others. In addition, has: Advanced experience using Adobe Photoshop with Pen Tablet Control (Wacom or Intuios). Strong organisational skills within Photoshop allowing others to easily work within your files for collaborative purpose. Ability to build and effectively use custom brushes for various material rendering techniques ie; hair or fur. Sound English verbal and written skills. Good time management skills and self-motivation. Versatile illustration skills including digital sketching. Advanced understanding of light and colour theory. A knowledge of 3D applications and ability to render is an advantage but not necessary. Creating and Innovating Open to new ideas and experiences; Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity; Thinks broadly and strategically; Shows fresh, insightful thinking by producing a range of creative solutions and approaches to problems. Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations Sets high standards for quality and monitors and maintains quality and productivity; Creates a culture of discipline by consistently setting high standards for quality and quantity at all times; Monitors and maintains quality and productivity; Uses economic, financial, market and industry data to understand and improve business results Relating and Networking Creates win-win partnerships by building effective relationships with customers, the team and cross functionally; collaborates and elates well to people at all levels; manages conflict promptly and effectively and builds trust by connecting, understanding differences, and empathising with others. Qualifications Have at least 2-3 years of experience in a similar role; and Relevant tertiary qualification in Fine Art, illustration or similar Work hours: 8.30am-5.30pm, Monday to Friday (Hydrid working applied) Responsibilities: Work closely with Digital Artists, Retouchers and Photographers in MBO Creative Service to edit / manipulate existing photography that: Demonstrate the product in its best light removing damage or blemishes through transportation. Ensure image is accurate to original product for colour. Adjust any aspect that may have changed from photographed sample to final product. Describe the function of a product through impactful illustration for marketing purposes. Creating finishing effects ie smoke or lighting functions of a product when in play mode. Under guidance of MBO Creative Service team, work with Global Senior Graphic Designers and Art Directors use and manipulate product photography and or CAD renders to create final illustrative renders that: Show product and its features with impact. Ensure image represents the brand look and feel as directed by Art Directors. Are accurate to the final product. Work well with space and layout provided by the brand team. Print ready for packaging and suitable for online marketing and eCom usage. Core Values We're a family, who is Outrageously playful, with Wild imagination. We're a family We demonstrate kindness as part of the Moose family - treating others the way we want to be treated. We're all about welcoming your wacky, weird and wonderful self at work! Moosies pride themselves on taking personal responsibility for their actions and outcomes, always acting ethically, professionally, sustainably and with a smile. We know there is no 'I' in TEAM and are committed to hitting team goals way out of the park. We've got each other's backs - we support each other with no politics or personal agendas. Outrageously playful All Moosies use play to stimulate thinking and innovation - applying learnings across all initiatives. We think outside the toy box to keep things super FUN. We consistently give 100% to put the punch in our products and services. We keep our energy up so there's a great buzz around the place all the time - helping to foster great ideas and ensuring strong productivity. Wild imagination We're prepared to share the kooky and the creative in brainstorming sessions, to bring the best Moose to market. Moosies put heart and soul into innovating and delivering the best toys ever with the future of our planet and communities in mind. We elicit infectious enthusiasm, are non-judgemental, value diversity of thinking and the benefits this brings, and are open to all WOW ideas. We keep on trend and across new technologies and sustainable approaches so we can bring this knowledge to the playroom. Contacts : VNO staff, MBO staff, Global Design teams. Show more Show less

Visit www.moosetoys.com for more information on our amazing brands and people.

Reports To: Illustration Manager

Direct Reports: Nil

Role Objectives

Working directly with MBO Creative Services teams and you will provide digital Art and Photoshop retouching in the following areas:

  • Reworking and retouching of Product and Packaging Photography to best represent the product for marketing purposes.
  • Compositing illustration for Product Branding requirements (Packaging and Marketing assets).

    Key capabilities

    Applying Expertise and Technology
    Has functional, practical, and technical knowledge of Image composition and Adobe Photoshop retouching. Takes ownership of processes and functions and applies this expertise accordingly. Shares this expertise and knowledge with others. In addition, has:
  • Advanced experience using Adobe Photoshop with Pen Tablet Control (Wacom or Intuios).
  • Strong organisational skills within Photoshop allowing others to easily work within your files for collaborative purpose.
  • Ability to build and effectively use custom brushes for various material rendering techniques ie; hair or fur.
  • Sound English verbal and written skills.
  • Good time management skills and self-motivation.
  • Versatile illustration skills including digital sketching.
  • Advanced understanding of light and colour theory.
  • A knowledge of 3D applications and ability to render is an advantage but not necessary.

    Creating and Innovating
    Open to new ideas and experiences; Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity; Thinks broadly and strategically; Shows fresh, insightful thinking by producing a range of creative solutions and approaches to problems.
    Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations
    Sets high standards for quality and monitors and maintains quality and productivity; Creates a culture of discipline by consistently setting high standards for quality and quantity at all times; Monitors and maintains quality and productivity; Uses economic, financial, market and industry data to understand and improve business results
    Relating and Networking
    Creates win-win partnerships by building effective relationships with customers, the team and cross functionally; collaborates and elates well to people at all levels; manages conflict promptly and effectively and builds trust by connecting, understanding differences, and empathising with others.

    Qualifications
  • Have at least 2-3 years of experience in a similar role; and
  • Relevant tertiary qualification in Fine Art, illustration or similar


    Work hours: 8.30am-5.30pm, Monday to Friday (Hydrid working applied)

    Responsibilities:
    Work closely with Digital Artists, Retouchers and Photographers in MBO Creative Service to edit / manipulate existing photography that:
  • Demonstrate the product in its best light removing damage or blemishes through transportation.
  • Ensure image is accurate to original product for colour.
  • Adjust any aspect that may have changed from photographed sample to final product.
  • Describe the function of a product through impactful illustration for marketing purposes.
  • Creating finishing effects ie smoke or lighting functions of a product when in play mode.
    Under guidance of MBO Creative Service team, work with Global Senior Graphic Designers and Art Directors use and manipulate product photography and or CAD renders to create final illustrative renders that:
  • Show product and its features with impact.
  • Ensure image represents the brand look and feel as directed by Art Directors.
  • Are accurate to the final product.
  • Work well with space and layout provided by the brand team.
  • Print ready for packaging and suitable for online marketing and eCom usage.


    Core Values We're a family, who is Outrageously playful, with Wild imagination.
     We're a family

  • Moosies pride themselves on taking personal responsibility for their actions and outcomes, always acting ethically, professionally, sustainably and with a smile.

    Outrageously playful

  • We think outside the toy box to keep things super FUN.
  • We consistently give 100% to put the punch in our products and services.
  • We keep our energy up so there's a great buzz around the place all the time - helping to foster great ideas and ensuring strong productivity.
    Wild imagination
  • We're prepared to share the kooky and the creative in brainstorming sessions, to bring the best Moose to market.
  • Moosies put heart and soul into innovating and delivering the best toys ever with the future of our planet and communities in mind.
  • We elicit infectious enthusiasm, are non-judgemental, value diversity of thinking and the benefits this brings, and are open to all WOW ideas.
