job_description_formatted:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

The Product Operations Team sits at the intersection of strategy, execution, and scale, being the connective tissue between product, business, and on-the-ground teams. We accelerate product outcomes by building and allowing the people, systems and tools to grow product sustainably across the region.

We work with team members to ensure that product solutions are innovative, operationally practical and locally relevant. Our scope spans the entire product lifecycle—from go-to-market planning and feature rollouts to performance monitoring and continuous feedback loops. Whether it's Mobility, Deliveries or Safety, our mission is to lead product excellence and operational readiness at scale.

Get to Know the Role

Reporting to the Head of Product Operations, the Product Operations Manager will help optimize our product development lifecycle, ensure efficient operations, and lead agreement between product, business, and other teams. We're looking for an operational expert who is execution-driven in the Product Operations space.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

  • You will ensure product teams operate with clarity, agreement, and velocity by codifying workflows and promoting best practices.
  • You will design and implement efficient, sustainable product development processes and tooling.
  • You will collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Country Operations teams to enhance product, process, and tool improvements.
  • You will identify scalable opportunities to leverage AI for operational improvements and product expansion
  • You will lead the continuous improvement agenda by gathering feedback, identifying friction points, testing solutions, and increasing adoption across product teams
  • You will utilize AI and automation models to enhance workflow and improve the quality of outputs, insights, and deliverables
  • You will define and lead the program rollout strategy for multiple products, ensuring operational rigor throughout the product lifecycle from brainstorming to launch and beyond.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

  • 5 years of experience in product operations, program/product management, or a related operational role in the tech environment.
  • Have experience applying qualitative sense-making with quantitative, data-driven insights, ensuring that all decisions are grounded in analysis and practical understanding using SQL, BI tools
  • Experience designing and implementing scalable operational systems and processes (bonus: experience leading complex projects from start to finish)
  • Have experience working with product management tools (e.g., Jira) and collaboration platforms (e.g., Slack).
  • Communication skills in working with and influencing multiple team members and management.
  • Proactive problem solver with experience breaking down ambiguous issues into component parts to develop solutions.

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

  • We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
  • With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
  • Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
  • We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
  • Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that provides equal opportunity for Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. We consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, race, religion, age, gender, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

job_summary: Who We Are Employment Hero is on a mission to make employment easier and more valuable for everyone. Our Employment Operating System brings hiring, HR, payroll and benefits into an all-in-one solution. Since our inception in 2014, we've scaled to a $2 billion valuation and gained a presence in 6 countries globally - Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, the UK and Canada. We now service over 300,000 businesses and more than 2 million employees. The EH Way At Employment Hero, we're proud of our unique DNA, which we call The EH Way. We are Mission First - everything we do (from what we work on, to how we allocate capital and where we focus) is driven by our Mission We are Remote First - we champion a remote environment with a preference for asynchronous communication and a high degree of autonomy We are AI First - we are committed to using AI to accelerate our mission; AI is not just a tool, it's a fundamental part of how we operate, innovate, and scale We are Apolitical - we do not take a position on political or social topics, unless it relates to our Mission We Live by Our Values - we role model our values 100% of the time We Expect High Performance - we set a high standard and we're not satisfied with being average This role As one of our Senior Full-Stack Engineers, you'll be accountable for building and deploying the innovative features that change our customers' lives every day. From our trailblazing AI hiring tool to our fully automated payroll solution, every component of our Employment Operating System is carefully designed to disrupt the employment industry for the better, improving the lives of business owners and entrepreneurs everywhere. Our world-class Product and Engineering teams delivered almost 1,000 new features last year. As one of our Senior Engineers, you'll play a vital role in the continued acceleration of our product strategy This will include Driving your squad to develop critical features for our customers. We primarily develop our applications using Ruby. If you're not familiar with Ruby, no worries‚Äîwe offer training to ensure you're equipped with the necessary skills Collaborating closely with our global team of designers, product managers and UX specialists to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions Writing automated tests for your production codes Developing and maintaining key components of web applications Conducting testing and code reviews for both yourself and your colleagues Mentoring the Junior Engineers within your squad Who You Are To thrive at Employment Hero, you'll need to embody The EH Way - operating with focus, agility, and an obsession with impact. For this role, you'll also bring You are a highly skilled, senior-level Full-Stack Software Development Engineer (our Senior Engineers typically have 6+ years of experience, but we prioritize technical expertise over years of experience) In previous roles, you've focused on Server-side and RESTful API Development & Integration You're proficient in at least one OOP language (e.g., Python, Java, PHP, etc.). We'll upskill you in Ruby when you join You have proven experience developing, maintaining, and deploying full-stack web applications You are proficient in ReactJS (or a similar modern Frontend framework) and have experience building scalable, maintainable UI components You have a strong understanding of best practice software engineering processes, testing, and Agile methodology You are a team player, always putting colleagues ahead of yourself, with a highly adaptable and versatile approach to work You have good verbal and written English skills You're passionate about learning, sharing knowledge, and mentoring teammates What We Can Offer At Employment Hero, we don't just talk about a better way to work - we live it. Joining Employment Hero means You will work remotely, with the flexibility to own your time and impact You will access cutting-edge tools to amplify your work, knowledge and outputs You'll surround yourself with ambitious, outcome-driven colleagues who challenge you to do the best work of your life You'll own ESOP (employee share options) in one of the world's fastest-growing tech companies You'll also have access to a wide range of benefits that includes - a very generous paternity leave policy, subsidised egg freezing (so you can make the choice that's right for you, on your terms), a WFH office expense budget, and outstanding learning & development opportunities At Employment Hero, we are committed to safeguarding the privacy of your application data. job_description_formatted:
Who We Are

Employment Hero is on a mission to make employment easier and more valuable for everyone. Our Employment Operating System brings hiring, HR, payroll and benefits into an all-in-one solution.

Since our inception in 2014, we've scaled to a $2 billion valuation and gained a presence in 6 countries globally - Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, the UK and Canada. We now service over 300,000 businesses and more than 2 million employees.

The EH Way

At Employment Hero, we're proud of our unique DNA, which we call The EH Way.

  • We are Mission First - everything we do (from what we work on, to how we allocate capital and where we focus) is driven by our Mission
  • We are Remote First - we champion a remote environment with a preference for asynchronous communication and a high degree of autonomy
  • We are AI First - we are committed to using AI to accelerate our mission; AI is not just a tool, it's a fundamental part of how we operate, innovate, and scale
  • We are Apolitical - we do not take a position on political or social topics, unless it relates to our Mission
  • We Live by Our Values - we role model our values 100% of the time
  • We Expect High Performance - we set a high standard and we're not satisfied with being average


This role

As one of our Senior Full-Stack Engineers, you'll be accountable for building and deploying the innovative features that change our customers' lives every day. From our trailblazing AI hiring tool to our fully automated payroll solution, every component of our Employment Operating System is carefully designed to disrupt the employment industry for the better, improving the lives of business owners and entrepreneurs everywhere.

Our world-class Product and Engineering teams delivered almost 1,000 new features last year. As one of our Senior Engineers, you'll play a vital role in the continued acceleration of our product strategy

This will include

  • Driving your squad to develop critical features for our customers. We primarily develop our applications using Ruby. If you're not familiar with Ruby, no worries—we offer training to ensure you're equipped with the necessary skills
  • Collaborating closely with our global team of designers, product managers and UX specialists to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions
  • Writing automated tests for your production codes
  • Developing and maintaining key components of web applications
  • Conducting testing and code reviews for both yourself and your colleagues
  • Mentoring the Junior Engineers within your squad


Who You Are

To thrive at Employment Hero, you'll need to embody The EH Way - operating with focus, agility, and an obsession with impact. For this role, you'll also bring

  • You are a highly skilled, senior-level Full-Stack Software Development Engineer (our Senior Engineers typically have 6+ years of experience, but we prioritize technical expertise over years of experience)
  • In previous roles, you've focused on Server-side and RESTful API Development & Integration
  • You're proficient in at least one OOP language (e.g., Python, Java, PHP, etc.). We'll upskill you in Ruby when you join
  • You have proven experience developing, maintaining, and deploying full-stack web applications
  • You are proficient in ReactJS (or a similar modern Frontend framework) and have experience building scalable, maintainable UI components
  • You have a strong understanding of best practice software engineering processes, testing, and Agile methodology
  • You are a team player, always putting colleagues ahead of yourself, with a highly adaptable and versatile approach to work
  • You have good verbal and written English skills
  • You're passionate about learning, sharing knowledge, and mentoring teammates


What We Can Offer

At Employment Hero, we don't just talk about a better way to work - we live it. Joining Employment Hero means

  • You will work remotely, with the flexibility to own your time and impact
  • You will access cutting-edge tools to amplify your work, knowledge and outputs
  • You'll surround yourself with ambitious, outcome-driven colleagues who challenge you to do the best work of your life
  • You'll own ESOP (employee share options) in one of the world's fastest-growing tech companies
  • You'll also have access to a wide range of benefits that includes - a very generous paternity leave policy, subsidised egg freezing (so you can make the choice that's right for you, on your terms), a WFH office expense budget, and outstanding learning & development opportunities


At Employment Hero, we are committed to safeguarding the privacy of your application data. To understand how we do so, you can read our Applicant Privacy Policy here

Employment Hero celebrates diverse perspectives and experiences, we invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.

job_summary: JOB OVERVIEW We are /looking for 03 SOC Analyst to join SAS - Cyber Security Assurance Service Teams. As a provider of cybersecurity services, SAS focuses on three key areas: Application Security ‚Äì including consulting and assessment services to ensure the security of applications; Security Engineering ‚Äì offering consulting, design, and development of security systems, with a strong focus on cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure; Managed Security Services ‚Äì delivering outsourced solutions for the operation, monitoring, threat detection, and incident response in information security. At SAS, we not only deliver high-quality solutions but also create a dynamic and growth-oriented working environment: Opportunities to learn and develop through training programs, certifications, and real project experience Financial support of up to $2,000 per year for at least two professional certificates Work exclusively with international clients from the EU, US, Japan, Korea, Singapore , and more Opportunities for onsite assignments abroad , both short-term and long-term. RESPONSIBILITIES Proficient use of popular cloud services (especially security services) in AWS or Azure, including IAM, encryption, firewalls, security groups, monitoring tools, and other security-related services. Conduct cloud security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and compliance gaps, ensuring adherence to industry standards such as CIS Benchmarks, NIST, or ISO 27001. Implement security controls to protect cloud infrastructure across AWS and Azure, following approved security designs and architecture. Deploy cloud resources using Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or Azure Resource Manager templates. Automate security processes and integrate security tools into CI/CD pipelines to ensure secure development and deployment workflows. Experience working with Linux, Docker, and Kubernetes (K8s) to secure containerized applications and orchestrated environments. Possess basic to proficient coding skills, with experience working in Python for automation, scripting, or security testing. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design secure systems and ensure cloud security best practices are implemented. REQUIREMENTS Basic Qualification Graduates with a major in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, Cybersecurity (or equivalent fields) Min 4 exps in Security/ Cloud Consultant Strong written and oral presentation and communication skills. Desire to be the technical representative for FPT in front of partners and customers. Familiarity with current security technologies including one or more of the following: Next-Generation Anti-virus, EDR, SOAR, SIEM, particularly Splunk and/or MS Sentinel, firewalls, and other core security products. Some hands-on experience with one or more of the following: Azure, AWS, M365 suite of solutions. Provide product and service demonstrations. job_description_formatted:
JOB OVERVIEW

We are /looking for 03 SOC Analyst to join SAS - Cyber Security Assurance Service Teams. As a provider of cybersecurity services, SAS focuses on three key areas:

  1. Application Security – including consulting and assessment services to ensure the security of applications;
  2. Security Engineering – offering consulting, design, and development of security systems, with a strong focus on cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure;
  3. Managed Security Services – delivering outsourced solutions for the operation, monitoring, threat detection, and incident response in information security.


At SAS, we not only deliver high-quality solutions but also create a dynamic and growth-oriented working environment:

  • Opportunities to learn and develop through training programs, certifications, and real project experience
  • Financial support of up to $2,000 per year for at least two professional certificates
  • Work exclusively with international clients from the EU, US, Japan, Korea, Singapore, and more
  • Opportunities for onsite assignments abroad, both short-term and long-term.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Proficient use of popular cloud services (especially security services) in AWS or Azure, including IAM, encryption, firewalls, security groups, monitoring tools, and other security-related services.
  • Conduct cloud security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and compliance gaps, ensuring adherence to industry standards such as CIS Benchmarks, NIST, or ISO 27001.
  • Implement security controls to protect cloud infrastructure across AWS and Azure, following approved security designs and architecture.
  • Deploy cloud resources using Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or Azure Resource Manager templates.
  • Automate security processes and integrate security tools into CI/CD pipelines to ensure secure development and deployment workflows.
  • Experience working with Linux, Docker, and Kubernetes (K8s) to secure containerized applications and orchestrated environments.
  • Possess basic to proficient coding skills, with experience working in Python for automation, scripting, or security testing.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design secure systems and ensure cloud security best practices are implemented.


REQUIREMENTS

Basic Qualification

  • Graduates with a major in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, Cybersecurity (or equivalent fields)
  • Min 4 exps in Security/ Cloud Consultant
  • Strong written and oral presentation and communication skills.
  • Desire to be the technical representative for FPT in front of partners and customers.
  • Familiarity with current security technologies including one or more of the following: Next-Generation Anti-virus, EDR, SOAR, SIEM, particularly Splunk and/or MS Sentinel, firewalls, and other core security products.
  • Some hands-on experience with one or more of the following: Azure, AWS, M365 suite of solutions.
  • Provide product and service demonstrations.
  • Ability to work independently or as an active member of a team
  • A pleasant attitude, eagerness to learn and keep up with new technologies.
  • 𝐅𝐮𝐥𝐥-𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐨𝐜𝐜𝐚𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐕𝐢𝐞𝐭𝐧𝐚𝐦 (𝟏–𝟐 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡𝐬)


Nice to have

  • Preference for candidates with certifications: CEH, Security+
  • Cloud Security (Azure/AWS) certificate is nice to have and will make you stand-out


WHAT COMPANY OFFERS

  • Salary range: 50,000 – 60,000 USD/year
  • Performance-based bonuses up to 1–3 months' salary
  • FPT Care insurance plan tailored for FPT employees
  • Attractive annual summer vacation allowance
  • Sponsored training courses for personal growth and up to 100% coverage for certification costs
  • Global and inclusive workplace with monthly cross-cultural events
  • International exposure and career growth across global locations
  • Work-life balance benefits with a flexible leave policy and annual health check-ups to support employee well-being

job_poster.title: UniUni- Director of Asia Pacific Back Office

job_description_formatted:
Who Are We?

UniUni is an international leader in last-mile logistics, delivering tens of millions of parcels annually across Canada and rapidly expanding in the United States. Founded in 2019, UniUni’s tech-driven innovation and crowdsourcing delivery model offer fast, economical, and reliable services to local, domestic, and international e-commerce clients.


我们是谁？

UniUni是尾程派送物流领域公司，每年在加拿大境内递送上千万件包裹，并正在美国市场快速扩张。公司成立于2019年，凭借技术驱动的创新模式和众包配送解决方案，为本地、国内及国际电商客户提供快捷、经济且可靠的物流服务。


What Do We Offer?

At UniUni, we provide exciting opportunities for our employees to grow and achieve their career goals. We value both lateral moves and vertical promotions, believing that every role should help develop your skills, broaden your experience, and build a fulfilling career. If you are ready to join UniUni’s dynamic team—working hard while enjoying the process—we invite you to apply and become part of our success story.


我们提供什么？

在UniUni，我们为员工提供激动人心的职业发展机会，既重视横向的业务拓展也关注纵向的职位晋升。我们坚信每个岗位都应该成为您提升专业技能、积累行业经验、成就职业理想的成长平台。如果您渴望加入这个充满活力的团队，在高效工作中收获成就感，欢迎申请加入我们！


Scope & Impact:

  • Develop and maintain new regional clients, establish and nurture strong customer relationships, manage the entire sales process from sales to payment collection, and achieve annual, quarterly, and monthly marketing targets.
  • Familiarize with company product modules, collaborate with the pricing department to formulate sales prices based on client needs and product costs, and integrate/implement tailored solutions.
  • Proactively collect and provide market insights to assist the team in deepening understanding of new regional markets.
  • Achieve personal and regional sales plans, deeply engage with industry-leading clients to drive business model innovation, establish benchmarks, and build the company’s service reputation and brand.


职位范围及影响

  • 开放并维护新区域客户，建立和维护良好的客情关系，完成销售到回款整个销售流程的管理，达成公司年度、季度和月度营销指标。
  • 熟悉公司各产品模块，结合公司各产品成本，根据客户需求，与报价部门共同制定销售卖价，整合并输出落地推进解决方案。
  • 积极有效地收集并反馈市场信息，协助团队加深对新区域市场的了解。
  • 完成个人及区域销售计划，对行业头部客户进行深挖，实现业务模式创新及订立标杆，建立公司服务口碑和品牌。


Requirements:

  • 3+ years of sales experience in international express companies/international freight forwarding/export cross-border e-commerce logistics. All football fans and professionals will be both users and creators. Football on the company is also an outlet for those who seek creative and commercial interests. Responsibilities As a Senior iOS Developer, you will play a critical role in achieving our goal of creating a best-in-class mobile app experience: the future of fan engagement and experience. Creating scalable frameworks and solutions. This is a hands-on position requiring technical planning and strategy, architectural decision making and code review. Successful candidates will have worked closely with product managers, designers, and other non-engineering stakeholders in the past. Your close internal collaboration will provide you with numerous opportunities, visibility, and a promising career as an engineer. The job will involve both ensuring that we are consistently providing a great experience to our users and designing and implementing the future of user-friendly spectator sports experiences. Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢ Conduct profiling to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance, while ensuring that performance metrics are set up and monitored. Collaborate with UI/UX designers, product managers, and engineers to solve challenging usability issues. Adhering to design principles and best practices in order to create intuitive and engaging user interfaces that provide a positive user experience. Optimize our codebase to improve performance, security and scalability, and ensure that the application is running smoothly and efficiently. Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices to streamline the development and deployment process. Write and run automated tests to validate functionality and identify problems early in the development process. Requirements Must-Have Requirements: 5+ years of experience with iOS software development. Strong understanding of iOS best practices to debug and improve performance, reliability and efficiency. Experience working in CI/CD pipelines. Bonus Requirements: Proficiency in Swift or Objective-C and knowledge of various iOS SDKs (UIKit, AppKit, etc.) Experience with implementing software architecture and design patterns such as MVVM, MVC, etc. Familiarity with RESTful APIs and ReactiveX Programming. Familiarity with AWS frameworks and deployments. Benefits Paid-leave up to 18 days/year. Working time: 8h30-18h, 5 days a week. lunchtime 1 hour. job_description_formatted:
About our client

The company architecture is to allow immediacy of creation, sharing of and collaboration on content, experience and playing. All football fans and professionals will be both users and creators. Football on the company is also an outlet for those who seek creative and commercial interests.

Responsibilities

As a Senior iOS Developer, you will play a critical role in achieving our goal of creating a best-in-class mobile app experience: the future of fan engagement and experience. Creating scalable frameworks and solutions.

This is a hands-on position requiring technical planning and strategy, architectural decision making and code review. Successful candidates will have worked closely with product managers, designers, and other non-engineering stakeholders in the past. Your close internal collaboration will provide you with numerous opportunities, visibility, and a promising career as an engineer.

The job will involve both ensuring that we are consistently providing a great experience to our users and designing and implementing the future of user-friendly spectator sports experiences. Responsibilities: • Conduct profiling to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance, while ensuring that performance metrics are set up and monitored.

  • Collaborate with UI/UX designers, product managers, and engineers to solve challenging usability issues.
  • Adhering to design principles and best practices in order to create intuitive and engaging user interfaces that provide a positive user experience.
  • Optimize our codebase to improve performance, security and scalability, and ensure that the application is running smoothly and efficiently.
  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices to streamline the development and deployment process.
  • Write and run automated tests to validate functionality and identify problems early in the development process.

Requirements

Must-Have Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience with iOS software development.
  • Strong understanding of iOS best practices to debug and improve performance, reliability and efficiency.
  • Experience working in CI/CD pipelines.

Bonus Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Swift or Objective-C and knowledge of various iOS SDKs (UIKit, AppKit, etc.)
  • Experience with implementing software architecture and design patterns such as MVVM, MVC, etc.
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs and ReactiveX Programming.
  • Familiarity with AWS frameworks and deployments.

Benefits

  • Paid-leave up to 18 days/year.
  • Working time: 8h30-18h, 5 days a week. lunchtime 1 hour.
  • Autonomy and resources as necessary to get things done.
  • Progressive company culture, focusing on result, growth, and human development.
  • Improve English.
  • Quarterly check-ins, yearly appraisals.

Other Information

  • Training: Onboarding training will be provided to ensure a good understanding of the current product and features.
  • Equipment: A computer will be provided after probation

Interview Process

Round 1: Inspius Screening

  • English Test (15-20 minutes)
  • Home Assignment

Round 2: Interview with Singapore Employer

  • Interview with HR
  • Interview with Hiring Manager

job_description_formatted:
Company Overview:

MACOM designs and manufactures semiconductor products for Data Center, Telecommunication and Industrial and Defense applications. Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM has design centers and sales offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia. MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard.

MACOM has more than 70 years of application expertise with multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. Click here to view our facilities. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business.

MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.

Supply Chain Planner

Works under the direction and guidance of the Planning Manager and is responsible for all planning and scheduling of manufactured and/or subcontracted parts utilizing SAP ERP system. Provides support to production as required in the form of direction to Production Schedulers and Material Handlers concerning daily production flow. Familiar with a variety of the organizational concepts, practices, and procedures, as well as, a complete understanding of material planning and control.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities

  • Execute MPS by converting planned MRP orders to purchase orders for contract manufacturers (CM), component suppliers or production orders to internal manufacturing resources.
  • Review & confirm new orders and bookings daily.
  • Manages supplier delivery schedules to ensure they meet production & backlog requirements. May include supplier visits.
  • Generate and maintain accurate Customer OTD (on time delivery).
  • Manages orders backlog to ensure on-time customer deliveries.
  • Supply chain partner to programs teams in the delivery of complex programs orders.
  • Maintain master data – planning.

Key Competencies Required

  • Experience with planning and procurement in the semiconductor manufacturing industry.
  • Strong planning and organisational skills.
  • Strong Analytical skills.
  • Effective communication skills.
  • Ability to work within a team environment.
  • Ability to work on own initiative.
  • Thorough working knowledge of MRP (inputs, logic and outputs) within SAP ERP system.
  • Detail-oriented, ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks with strict deadlines.
  • Good customer service/phone skills and flexibility for handling a wide range of activities.
  • Is flexible and able to react to changes as needed.
  • Take initiative and seek additional training or direction as needed.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years’ experience in Procurement for finished goods products
  • Semiconductor background strongly preferred
  • Professional experience with SAP
  • Deep understanding of Excel
  • Bachelor’s Degree preferred
  • APICS certification strongly preferred

job_description_formatted:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in SalesForce, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Define data scope, structure, and taxonomy: Accounts, Contacts, Opportunities, Documents, Attachments, and relationships between them;
  • Ensure logical and business consistency of data: realistic personas, multi-page/multi-format documents, typical scenarios across Sales, Finance, HR, Legal, Marketing, etc;
  • Advise on platform-specific nuances, including historical data, table relationships, and edge cases that may affect agent/model learning;
  • Prepare, transform, and upload synthetic datasets to the platform, ensuring all entities, attachments, and metadata work correctly;
  • Troubleshoot technical issues during data preparation and loading (attachments not uploading, versioning, API quirks, etc.);
  • Optionally, automate data generation, transformation, and validation using scripts or ETL processes

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's Degree in any field.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience working with Salesforce
  • You have advanced level of English (C1 or higher)
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $15/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
  • Collaborate in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience to enhance your portfolio.
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate

job_summary: Who are we? Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success. At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like: Brief Call : Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you! Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities! Case study : Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc. As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience. We look forward to meeting you! Job Description ABOUT THE JOB Integrate software components and deliver stable builds for project releases with proper documentation Apply and maintain software configuration changes such as project-specific settings and integration scripts Manage code branches, labels, and release versions across multiple projects Maintain and adapt build systems, ensuring reliable compilation and packaging Create and optimize CI pipelines using Jenkins and scripting languages like Python or Shell Collaborate with global teams to support and enhance software integration and DevOps workflows. About You Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related technical fields 3 years of experience in devops, with version control systems such as Git, Gerrit, ClearCase, or similar tools Familiarity with CI/CD tools ‚Äì ideally Jenkins ‚Äì and scripting using Python or Shell Comfortable working in Linux environments, with basic knowledge of compilation (Make, CMake, GCC) Exposure to Docker, and package management tools (RPM, Debian) Willingness to work across time zones and collaborate with international teams Experience in embedded software projects or C++ programming is a big plus Proficient in English, both written and verbal Familiarity with integration server management or cross-compilation workflows. WHY AMARIS? Competitive salary and 13th-month salary 14+ annual leaves per year Premium healthcare insurance, starting from your probation period Project reviews and yearly performance appraisals Annual company trips Teambuilding activities: Team lunch/dinner, events, and celebrations, sports clubs (football, yoga, badminton, etc.) International team with flexible working time + hybrid working Tailor-made career path Technical workshops and training courses Mobility: Opportunities to be on-site abroad in our offices in over 60+ countries Equal Opportunity Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics. Show more Show less

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

ABOUT THE JOB


  • Integrate software components and deliver stable builds for project releases with proper documentation
  • Apply and maintain software configuration changes such as project-specific settings and integration scripts
  • Manage code branches, labels, and release versions across multiple projects
  • Maintain and adapt build systems, ensuring reliable compilation and packaging
  • Create and optimize CI pipelines using Jenkins and scripting languages like Python or Shell
  • Collaborate with global teams to support and enhance software integration and DevOps workflows.


About You


  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related technical fields
  • 3 years of experience in devops, with version control systems such as Git, Gerrit, ClearCase, or similar tools
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools – ideally Jenkins – and scripting using Python or Shell
  • Comfortable working in Linux environments, with basic knowledge of compilation (Make, CMake, GCC)
  • Exposure to Docker, and package management tools (RPM, Debian)
  • Willingness to work across time zones and collaborate with international teams
  • Experience in embedded software projects or C++ programming is a big plus
  • Proficient in English, both written and verbal
  • Familiarity with integration server management or cross-compilation workflows.


WHY AMARIS?


  • Competitive salary and 13th-month salary
  • 14+ annual leaves per year
  • Premium healthcare insurance, starting from your probation period
  • Project reviews and yearly performance appraisals
  • Annual company trips
  • Teambuilding activities: Team lunch/dinner, events, and celebrations, sports clubs (football, yoga, badminton, etc.)
  • International team with flexible working time + hybrid working
  • Tailor-made career path
  • Technical workshops and training courses
  • Mobility: Opportunities to be on-site abroad in our offices in over 60+ countries


Equal Opportunity

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

job_description_formatted:
About Us

We are building the first AI-powered operating system for short-term rental businesses — a platform designed to put entire rental operations on autopilot. From guest communications to dynamic pricing, cleaning automation, upsells, and reporting, our mission is to create the most powerful tool in the industry and set the standard for how operators scale their businesses.

We’re looking for a Growth Hacker who is ready to help us achieve this mission and establish ourselves as the biggest player in the space.

Role Overview

As a Growth Hacker, you will own the end-to-end growth engine of our AI platform. Your mission is to drive adoption, experiment with acquisition channels, and design scalable strategies that fuel rapid expansion across global operators.

You’ll combine creativity with data-driven execution to deliver exponential growth and position our product as the category leader worldwide.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead Generation & Campaigns
    • Build, enrich, and activate high-quality lead lists.
    • Run outbound campaigns (email, LinkedIn, targeted ads).
  • Funnels & Landing Pages
    • Design and optimize conversion-focused funnels.
    • Build landing pages and experiment with CTAs, headlines, and flows.
  • Acquisition Growth
    • Run and scale paid campaigns on Meta, Google, and LinkedIn.
    • Grow thought leadership on LinkedIn and in STR communities.
    • Explore SEO, webinars, and content-led growth strategies.
  • Conversion & Onboarding
    • Optimize demo, free trial, and referral funnels.
    • Improve onboarding experience to maximize activation and retention.
  • Analytics & Iteration
    • Track funnel KPIs (CAC, LTV, conversion rates).
    • Run experiments, kill what doesn’t work, and scale what does.
Requirements

  • 1–5 years in growth, performance marketing, or SaaS marketing.
  • Hands-on experience with outreach tools, ad platforms, and automation workflows.
  • Strong track record of running experiments that led to measurable growth.
  • Data-driven, resourceful, and thrives in fast-moving environments.
  • Bonus: background in SaaS, marketplaces, or hospitality tech.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + performance-based upside.
  • Opportunity to lead growth for the first AI-powered tool transforming short-term rentals.
  • Work directly with the founder/CEO and senior team on global expansion.
  • Fast-paced startup environment with freedom to experiment and execute.
  • The chance to make your mark by helping us become the largest player in the industry.
  • Get compensated with shares in the company after 6 months

You should not apply if:

  • You are looking for a corporate 9 to 5 job
  • You are political and enjoy gossiping and talking about people behind their backs.
  • You are looking for a stable and slow dead-end job
  • You do not aim to be one of the best in the world at what you do

job_description_formatted:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
  • Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
  • CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
  • Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
  • Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
  • Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
  • Example Tasks

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Facilitate the Project Leaders understanding of all aspects of the awarded project so they can confidently present the project strategy to the client and the internal stakeholders. job_description_formatted:
At Emerald Clinical Trials, we are a global, full-service Contract Research Organization (CRO) with a rich heritage in the Asia-Pacific region. We are dedicated to advancing clinical research through scientific expertise and operational excellence, supporting biopharmaceutical, medical device, and diagnostic customers across all trial phases, from registration to post-marketing.

Our therapeutic expertise spans renal, cardiometabolic, and oncology—areas where we make a significant impact on improving global health.

At the heart of our success is our ability to combine global reach with local knowledge. Our on-the-ground teams work closely with local communities, building trust and ensuring diverse, representative patient recruitment. By prioritizing people, we deliver better engagement, more accurate data, and faster results—bringing therapies to patients in need.

About the Role

The Therapeutic Franchise Head (TFH) will serve as an operational expert in the relevant area of therapeutic expertise and is responsible for the development of strategies to support new business proposals for Emerald Clinical and the holistic sale to delivery of contracted work in clinical trials within their therapeutic area of expertise.

Key accountabilities

Operational strategy

Accountable for the creation and optimization of innovative and compelling delivery strategies and solutions for Early and Late Phase, multi-service, multi-region studies or programs, that leverage EC's expertise in the relevant therapeutic area as well as operational capabilities:

  • Work with relevant experts to differentiate Emerald Clinical from its competitors in assigned area
  • Actively support long-term business growth through collaboration with Emerald Clinical Functional Area Heads and other stakeholders
  • Actively support long-term business growth through collaboration with external Centres of Excellence and other external stakeholders including current and potential partners
  • Responsible for creating effective delivery strategies and solutions for all projects in assigned area of operational expertise including addressing the specific needs and challenges of each project and customer
  • Responsible for engaging and coordinating Operations Area Lead team members to align with the global operational strategy in the specified therapeutic area.
  • Develop relevant training materials and a library of resources (as needed) to support project leads, both regionally and globally, in their project deliverables

New business

In partnership with Emerald Clinical Business Development, Medical Services, Proposals, Operations, and other functions, responsible for award of business to achieve identified new business targets in the relevant therapeutic area:

  • Collaborate with Business Development to evaluate and manage new opportunities from receipt through pricing and proposal development, and to award decision. This may include, but is not limited to, standalone programs and projects, requests for information (RFI), capabilities, early engagement, and partnering discussions
  • Actively support Business Development in the preparation for and conduct of customer facing meetings. This includes and is not limited to; training and preparation of the assigned project team; provision of specific content; ensuring all content effectively conveys project strategy and critical win themes.
  • Develop and review project budgets (service fees and pass-through costs) aligned with the requested project strategy, and with the contribution margin targets and pricing strategy agreed with Sales, EC leadership, and other stakeholders
  • Attend and present at customer meetings including bid defence and partnership meetings, as required
  • Coordinate with Business Development to complete follow-up actions identified at bid defences and other customer/ partnership meetings

Project delivery

Act as Emerald Clinical project champion for awarded projects within the relevant therapeutic area. Through this role, work with Operations Project Delivery Leaders to enable the assigned project delivery team to understand and implement the project strategy that was sold, and to evaluate and recommend effective adjustments to strategy when any trends or triggers associated with progress indicate this is required:

  • Guide and mentor assigned Project Leads through comprehensive handover of awarded project. Facilitate the Project Leaders understanding of all aspects of the awarded project so they can confidently present the project strategy to the client and the internal stakeholders.
  • Define and communicate the project team profile and organizational structure that will enable operational managers to identify and assign team members that can meet the customer’s needs and successfully secure the project award
  • Continue to guide and mentor project leads throughout the project lifecycle including adjustments to delivery strategy when project or program progress, trends, and milestones indicate intervention required
  • Function as an escalation point and governance contact for awarded projects within the therapeutic area

About You

  • Tertiary qualifications in a related science or health care discipline
  • Minimum of 10 years global clinical research experience, including proven track record in hands on operational project delivery and/or drug development experience
  • Minimum of 5 years global business development experience, ideally in a hands-on capacity but otherwise to show direct involvement in associated processes e.g. RFP, BDMs, client leadership and relationship management
  • Expert experience in one or more operational areas and ability to understand and implement projects within assigned area of expertise
  • Up to date knowledge and access to information that supports effectiveness as a Operational Strategy lead including understanding Emerald Clinical’s services, and product offerings, status and trends in assigned area(s), innovations and advances in clinical trial methodology, and business intelligence.
  • Demonstrated ability to understand customer needs, have difficult conversations with internal/external stakeholders and customers, negotiate solutions and understand impacts on the overall offering.
  • Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, including good command of English language (both written and spoken).
  • Strong leadership skills, ability to work with minimal supervision, and lead a virtual team in a matrix organization.
  • Strong business acumen including confidence with financial considerations, excellent negotiation and influencing skills, and comfortable working in both sales and operational environments.

Why Join Us?

At our core, Emerald Clinical Trials is committed to transforming clinical research by putting people first—both patients and our employees. By joining our team, you’ll be part of a global network of passionate professionals working together to deliver better research and outcomes for millions worldwide.

Here’s what makes us stand out:

• Purpose-Driven Work: You’ll contribute to clinical trials that genuinely improve lives, with a focus on therapies in renal, cardiometabolic, and oncology.

• Global Reach, Local Expertise: Our teams connect with local communities, building trust and meaningful engagement for every trial.

• Collaboration and Innovation: Work in a culture that values diverse perspectives and creative solutions to solve global health challenges.

What We Offer

We understand that great work happens when people feel valued and supported. That’s why we provide:

• Competitive Compensation: A tailored salary and benefits package to reflect your skills and experience.

• Flexibility: Enjoy hybrid or remote working arrangements, depending on your location and role.

• Career Growth: Access to a wealth of learning opportunities and a global network of scientific leaders to help you grow and develop in your role.

• Employee Wellbeing: Participate in programs and initiatives designed to promote work-life balance, health, and team connection, including global engagement surveys, recognition programs, and team-building events.

• Global Opportunities: Be part of a company with international reach, offering you exposure to diverse projects and clients.


Interested? Apply now and help us achieve our mission to improve the health of millions worldwide.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified candidates.

  • Strategic thinker, proactive, able to manage teams and drive business growth.
  • Good English communication skills.

Benefits:

  • Career growth opportunities and expanding industry networks.
  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
  • Dynamic and professional work environment..

job_description_formatted:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Mathematics, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Generate prompts that challenge AI.
  • Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers.
  • Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Master's Degree or PhD in Mathematics and 3 years of professional experience.
  • You have a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics and 6+ years of professional experience.
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

job_description_formatted:
Our Client is a real-time blockchain. We are looking for a motivated and experienced Web3 Marketing Event Manager to join their dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and managing both online and offline events that enhance the brand presence and engage with the community within the industry

In This Role, You Will

  • Event Planning and Execution: Plan, organize, and execute high-quality events, including webinars, conferences, meetups, and community events. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define event goals, themes, and target audiences.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain relationships with industry partners, sponsors, and speakers. Manage communications with attendees, ensuring a seamless experience from registration to post-event follow-up.
  • Marketing Strategy: Develop and implement marketing strategies to promote events across various channels, including social media, email marketing, and community platforms. Analyze event performance metrics to refine future strategies and enhance attendee engagement.
  • Budget Management: Manage event budgets, ensuring all activities are cost-effective and within financial limits. Negotiate contracts with vendors, venues, and suppliers.
  • Content Creation: Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling content for event promotion and materials. Facilitate the production of event-related content, including presentations, promotional materials, and post-event reports.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You Have

  • Minimum 2+ years of experience in event management, specifically within the Web3 space.
  • Proven track record of successfully organizing both huge offline and online events.
  • Strong understanding of Web3 technologies and the broader blockchain ecosystem.
  • Experience in managing external stakeholders e.g vendors, suppliers etc.
  • Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage diverse audiences.
  • Basic knowledge of digital marketing and social media tools.

job_description_formatted:
Who We Are


Employment Hero is on a mission to make employment easier and more valuable for everyone. Our Employment Operating System brings hiring, HR, payroll and benefits into an all-in-one solution.


Since our inception in 2014, we've scaled to a $2 billion valuation and gained a presence in 6 countries globally - Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, the UK and Canada. We now service over 300,000 businesses and more than 2 million employees.


This role


As one of our Senior Frontend Engineers, you'll be accountable for building and deploying the innovative features that change our customers' lives every day. From our trailblazing AI hiring tool to our fully automated payroll solution, every component of our Employment Operating System is carefully designed to disrupt the employment industry for the better, improving the lives of business owners and entrepreneurs everywhere.


Our world-class Product and Engineering teams delivered almost 1,000 new features last year. As one of our Senior Engineers, you'll play a vital role in the continued acceleration of our product strategy.


Responsibilities


  • Driving your squad to develop critical features for our customers
  • Collaborating closely with our global team of designers, product managers and UX specialists to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions
  • Writing automated tests for your production codes
  • Developing and maintaining key components of web applications
  • Conducting testing and code reviews for both yourself and your colleagues
  • Mentoring the Junior Engineers within your squad


Requirements


To thrive at Employment Hero, you'll need to embody The EH Way - operating with focus, agility, and an obsession with impact. For this role, you'll also bring


  • Over 6 years of experience in Frontend Software Development
  • Experience in CI/CD, web application performance tuning, ReactJS/Redux applications. In deep in fundamental understanding of Javascript/Typescript, ReactJS/Redux, Building tool such as Webpack, Rollup, ViteJS
  • Strong English communication skills (both verbal & written)
  • Demonstrated experience implementing, maintaining and deploying full-stack web technologies
  • Strong understanding of standard Software Engineering processes, Testing, and Agile methodology
  • A team player that always puts colleagues ahead of yourself and has a highly adaptable and versatile approach to work
  • You are passionate about learning and sharing your knowledge, and not afraid to challenge your peers, but also welcome being challenged
  • We have a number of positions open which would suit many skills and experiences, including being open to candidates who are willing to learn our technical stack
  • Experience in translating design wireframes into functioning UI components


What We Can Offer

  • A generous budget for your home office.
  • Cutting-edge tools and technology.
  • 20 days Annual Leave, plus VN Public Holidays.
  • Allowance for your professional development plan & English learning courses.
  • Premium Healthcare Insurance Program for you and your loved ones, plus full gross salary paid social insurance.
  • Sports club funded by Employment Hero.
  • Monthly get-together event in the office for team bonding and budget for lunch for day-in-office.
  • Reward and recognition programs - because great work should be recognised and rewarded.
  • Employee Share Option Program: be an owner of Employment Hero.
  • Annual Global Gathering - so far we’ve been to Thailand, Vietnam, Bali and are excited to meet in Dubai in 2025.


The EH Way


At Employment Hero, we're proud of our unique DNA, which we call The EH Way.


  • We are Mission First - everything we do (from what we work on, to how we allocate capital and where we focus) is driven by our Mission
  • We are Remote First - we champion a remote environment with a preference for asynchronous communication and a high degree of autonomy
  • We are AI First - we are committed to using AI to accelerate our mission; AI is not just a tool, it's a fundamental part of how we operate, innovate, and scale
  • We are Apolitical - we do not take a position on political or social topics, unless it relates to our Mission
  • We Live by Our Values - we role model our values 100% of the time
  • We Expect High Performance - we set a high standard and we're not satisfied with being average

job_summary: General Purpose JOB DESCRIPTION The Product Engineer is responsible for introduction of new products and processes into mass production, manage test process, improve production yield, throughput, supplier quality, in process quality and outgoing quality control To support HID product i.e. Keyboard, Mouse, Headsets, and DIY product i.e. PSU, Cables, fan and future products made in Vietnam Position Summary, Responsibilities And Expectations Drives DVT to MP phase for new product introductions at subcontracted partners Reports and drives supplier quality, in-process quality and outgoing quality issues in a timely matter Drives manufacturing improvements through inline defects, repair and RMA returns Work closely with R&D mechanical team, US PE, China PE, and Quality teams to ensure the new product is easy to manufacture Ensure factory capacity (equipment, material and workforce) is in place to meet Corsair demand and resolve issue in a timely manner. Ensures resources are in place to react to low yield events in real time once in MP phase Further improve the production efficiency by reducing the cycle time New ODM supplier and component supplier audit and training. Essential Skills And Experience Degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, Quality Assurance or equivalent Understand of HID or DIY products is a plus Product Engineering or Quality experience at least three years Excellent English verbal and Written skills, verbal Chinese is a plus. About Us CORSAIR (NASDAQ:CRSR), founded in 1994, is a leading global developer and manufacturer of high-performance gaming and streaming gear. With 21 different product lines, CORSAIR offers a complete range of products that help digital athletes perform at their peak and enable streaming creators to produce studio-quality content for their fans. CORSAIR has built a passionate base of loyal customers due to its gamer- and creator-centric design philosophy, commitment to high performance, and professional quality. The company has received more than 4,000 product awards and has a footprint that reaches customers in more than 75 countries. CORSAIR also includes subsidiary brands Elgato, which provides premium studio equipment and accessories for content creators, SCUF Gaming, which builds custom-designed controllers for competitive gamers, and ORIGIN PC, a builder of custom gaming and workstation desktop PCs and laptops. job_description_formatted:
General Purpose

 JOB DESCRIPTION

  • The Product Engineer is responsible for introduction of new products and processes into mass production, manage test process, improve production yield, throughput, supplier quality, in process quality and outgoing quality control
  • To support HID product i.e. Keyboard, Mouse, Headsets, and DIY product i.e. PSU, Cables, fan and future products made in Vietnam

Position Summary, Responsibilities And Expectations

  • Drives DVT to MP phase for new product introductions at subcontracted partners
  • Reports and drives supplier quality, in-process quality and outgoing quality issues in a timely matter
  • Drives manufacturing improvements through inline defects, repair and RMA returns
  • Work closely with R&D mechanical team, US PE, China PE, and Quality teams to ensure the new product is easy to manufacture
  • Ensure factory capacity (equipment, material and workforce) is in place to meet Corsair demand and resolve issue in a timely manner.
  • Ensures resources are in place to react to low yield events in real time once in MP phase
  • Further improve the production efficiency by reducing the cycle time
  • New ODM supplier and component supplier audit and training.

Essential Skills And Experience

  • Degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, Quality Assurance or equivalent
  • Understand of HID or DIY products is a plus
  • Product Engineering or Quality experience at least three years
  • Excellent English verbal and Written skills, verbal Chinese is a plus.

About Us

CORSAIR (NASDAQ:CRSR), founded in 1994, is a leading global developer and manufacturer of high-performance gaming and streaming gear. With 21 different product lines, CORSAIR offers a complete range of products that help digital athletes perform at their peak and enable streaming creators to produce studio-quality content for their fans. CORSAIR has built a passionate base of loyal customers due to its gamer- and creator-centric design philosophy, commitment to high performance, and professional quality.

The company has received more than 4,000 product awards and has a footprint that reaches customers in more than 75 countries. CORSAIR also includes subsidiary brands Elgato, which provides premium studio equipment and accessories for content creators, SCUF Gaming, which builds custom-designed controllers for competitive gamers, and ORIGIN PC, a builder of custom gaming and workstation desktop PCs and laptops.

job_description_formatted:
An international igaming company with locations worldwide is seeking a Kubernetes Specialist to join their Azure Team. The role involves migrating systems to AKS while maintaining best practices in networking, cluster design, automation, and security. You'll collaborate closely with development teams.


The role is offered on a fully remote basis, available to candidates in the Philippines or Vietnam, working in the EST (USA) time zone.


Salary up to $2300/month.


Role and Responsibilities

  • Design and execute migrations to AKS
  • Optimize Kubernetes environments for performance, scalability, and security
  • Manage multi-cluster, multi-region deployments with strong networking configurations
  • Develop automation scripts, custom controllers, and operators
  • Implement service mesh solutions to enhance microservices networking and security
  • Ensure compliance with Azure Kubernetes practices
  • Implement network policies, security controls, and strategies
  • Guide development teams on Kubernetes YAML files, Kustomize overlays, and Helm charts


Education, Skills and Experience

  • Certifications in CKA, CKAD, and AZ-305; CKS and AZ-104 are a plus
  • 5+ years of experience with Kubernetes and containerized environments
  • Fluent in English (C1+ level, both written and spoken)
  • Strong expertise in AKS cluster design
  • Experience with blue/green deployments, node pool strategies, and workload optimization
  • Proficient in Helm, Terraform, Kustomize, and scripting (Python, PowerShell, or Bash)
  • Experience with CI/CD and Azure networking
  • Proven experience with AKS (GitOps and ArgoCD) is essential
  • Willingness to work in EST (USA) timezone


About the Role

  • Fully remote (Philippines or Vietnam)
  • Contract -you invoice the company (1-year renewable)
  • 15 days of paid leave per year
  • Laptop provided by the company


Interview Process:

  • 1-hour assessment with a 3-day deadline
  • Interview with HR Manager and Hiring Manager
  • Written references will be required


A full job description will be provided to selected candidates. Please apply with your CV in English.


*JobMatchingPartner Limited is a recruitment agency licenced in Malta, EU. We act on behalf of numerous clients based in Malta and elsewhere. JobMatchingPartner does not share your personal details with any third party without your written consent.

job_description_formatted:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.


We are looking for a bilingual professional to join our team and teach AI chatbots. You will have conversations in both Vietnamese and English with chatbots in order to measure their progress, as well as write novel conversations in order to teach them what to say.


Benefits:

  • This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
  • You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
  • You can work on your own schedule
  • Projects are paid hourly, starting at $20+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work


Responsibilities (both in Vietnamese and English):

  • Come up with diverse conversations over a range of topics
  • Write high-quality answers when given specific prompts
  • Compare the performance of different AI models
  • Research and fact-check AI responses


Qualifications:

  • Fluent in Vietnamese + English
  • A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
  • Excellent writing and grammar skills
  • Strong research and fact-checking skills to ensure accuracy and originality


Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

job_summary: TheSoul Publishing is an award-winning digital studio that produces entertaining, positive and original content for a global audience and distributes it through social media channels as well as streaming platforms. We're a fast-moving, creative and international company: with a global team of 2000+ talents, 40+ projects in 20 languages and 2 billion subscribers worldwide, we don't take our foot off the gas and continue to grow further. We are seeking a motivated and talented SMM Creatives-Maker to join our dynamic Russian Editorial team at ADME . This position focuses on creating engaging social media content by researching trending topics, crafting posts, overseeing design production, analyzing content performance, optimizing for engagement, and collaborating with the SMM team to boost reach and effectiveness across channels. Responsibilities: Research trending topics for social media content creation. Craft concise, engaging posts that align with the company‚Äôs tone and style. Submit clear Photoshop requests for card and story designs, specifying layout, imagery, and color. Ensure designs reflect brand aesthetics for visual consistency. Oversee content production from creation to final delivery. Collaborate with the SMM team for timely content delivery. Review and analyze content performance, identifying top-performing creatives. Use performance insights to optimize content for better clicks/clickability. Stay updated on content creation trends and industry best practices. Implement improvements to enhance content quality and effectiveness. Participate in content testing to optimize performance. Provide feedback on experiments for continuous content optimization. Support content promotion and distribution across all channels. Collaborate with teams to boost content reach and engagement. Requirements: Quick to acquire new skills and adapt to evolving trends and technologies in social media. Expert in platforms, algorithms, and tools, focusing on engagement and virality. Skilled at spotting emerging trends and incorporating them into content strategies. Proven track record of creating and analyzing viral content, with results showcased through test assignments and probation period. Able to analyze metrics and adjust strategies for optimal content performance. Fluent in Russian (B2 or higher) and English (B2 or higher) for effective communication and content creation. What we offer: A competitive salary (discussed individually with the successful candidate); Remote full-time work with a chance to be a part of a team from any place you like; Growth and development: internal academy with 800+ internal courses and materials, internal knowledge sharing, constant feedback from your manager, no limits on launching new initiatives; A tech-savvy approach and carefully structured processes: no red tape, transparent task management, asynchronous communication (with fewer meetings and more thoughtful written communication); Creative vibes of the cool international team of TheSoul Publishing, a company whose unique ecosystem is friendly to any new ideas! We appreciate your interest in our job vacancies and the company. Your CV will be reviewed carefully by our team, and if we are ready to move forward with your application, one of our recruiters will contact you and explain the subsequent steps. TheSoul Publishing is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We celebrate diversity and we do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We care for the privacy of our candidates and all the data you provide to us is maintained, protected, and confidential. Show more Show less
