TheSoul Publishing is an award-winning digital studio that produces entertaining, positive and original content for a global audience and distributes it through social media channels as well as streaming platforms. We're a fast-moving, creative and international company: with a global team of 2000+ talents, 40+ projects in 20 languages and 2 billion subscribers worldwide, we don't take our foot off the gas and continue to grow further.


We are seeking a motivated and talented SMM Creatives-Maker to join our dynamic Russian Editorial team at ADME. This position focuses on creating engaging social media content by researching trending topics, crafting posts, overseeing design production, analyzing content performance, optimizing for engagement, and collaborating with the SMM team to boost reach and effectiveness across channels.


Responsibilities:

  • Research trending topics for social media content creation.
  • Craft concise, engaging posts that align with the company’s tone and style.
  • Submit clear Photoshop requests for card and story designs, specifying layout, imagery, and color.
  • Ensure designs reflect brand aesthetics for visual consistency.
  • Oversee content production from creation to final delivery.
  • Collaborate with the SMM team for timely content delivery.
  • Review and analyze content performance, identifying top-performing creatives.
  • Use performance insights to optimize content for better clicks/clickability.
  • Stay updated on content creation trends and industry best practices.
  • Implement improvements to enhance content quality and effectiveness.
  • Participate in content testing to optimize performance.
  • Provide feedback on experiments for continuous content optimization.
  • Support content promotion and distribution across all channels.
  • Collaborate with teams to boost content reach and engagement.


Requirements:

  • Quick to acquire new skills and adapt to evolving trends and technologies in social media.
  • Expert in platforms, algorithms, and tools, focusing on engagement and virality.
  • Skilled at spotting emerging trends and incorporating them into content strategies.
  • Proven track record of creating and analyzing viral content, with results showcased through test assignments and probation period.
  • Able to analyze metrics and adjust strategies for optimal content performance.
  • Fluent in Russian (B2 or higher) and English (B2 or higher) for effective communication and content creation.


What we offer:

  • A competitive salary (discussed individually with the successful candidate);
  • Remote full-time work with a chance to be a part of a team from any place you like;
  • Growth and development: internal academy with 800+ internal courses and materials, internal knowledge sharing, constant feedback from your manager, no limits on launching new initiatives;
  • A tech-savvy approach and carefully structured processes: no red tape, transparent task management, asynchronous communication (with fewer meetings and more thoughtful written communication);
  • Creative vibes of the cool international team of TheSoul Publishing, a company whose unique ecosystem is friendly to any new ideas!


We appreciate your interest in our job vacancies and the company. Your CV will be reviewed carefully by our team, and if we are ready to move forward with your application, one of our recruiters will contact you and explain the subsequent steps.


TheSoul Publishing is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We celebrate diversity and we do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We care for the privacy of our candidates and all the data you provide to us is maintained, protected, and confidential.

job_poster.name: JunYuan ***
job_poster.title: CEO & Co-founder at Homebase (YC W‚Äô21) & Flowmingo AI

job_description_formatted:
🚀 About Flowmingo

Flowmingo is reimagining how companies hire.


We’re an AI-powered interview platform helping fast-growing teams identify top talent faster and more fairly. Backed by Y Combinator and trusted by modern recruiters, Flowmingo has helped reduce time-to-hire and hiring costs by up to 89%.


The best part? Flowmingo is FREE to adopt, making it easy for companies to try and implement. Our revenue comes from optional premium features that enhance control and customization—designed for organizations that want more structure or precision in their hiring process. This makes the product both accessible and valuable to a wide range of companies.


💼 About the Role

As a Content Partner, you’ll act as a voice and storyteller for Flowmingo. You’ll help introduce the platform to your audience through content—whether it’s LinkedIn posts, blog articles, short videos, or other creative formats—and earn competitive commissions when your content drives successful client referrals.


This is a referral-based role with no fixed hours. Whether you’re a content creator, marketing consultant, HR blogger, or someone with an engaged professional audience, this role offers flexibility and high-impact potential.


🎯 What You’ll Do

  • Share Flowmingo through authentic content on your preferred channels
  • Create posts, articles, or videos that explain how Flowmingo helps hiring teams
  • Inspire your audience to explore the platform and sign up
  • Provide feedback and ideas to improve Flowmingo’s messaging and reach
  • Work independently and earn based on the impact of your referrals


🤝 Who This Is For

  • Content creators, marketers, and professionals with an engaged audience
  • People who enjoy making and sharing content that helps others discover useful tools
  • Clear communicators who can simplify complex ideas into engaging content
  • Self-starters who want flexible, high-reward opportunities


💰 Compensation & Benefits

🟢 Work anytime, anywhere

🟢 High-performance = high reward


This is a commission partner role. Your earnings are based on how many successful client referrals you generate.

  • Transparent, performance-based payout structure
  • Commission increases with volume and consistency
  • Full visibility into your referral impact and client status


✅ How to Join

To get started, please apply using this link. If we see a good fit, we’ll send you a short AI interview to learn more about your style and communication approach.

📌 Before applying, take a few minutes to browse Flowmingo’s website so you can understand our product and value.


If you’re excited to represent a product that sells itself—and want a flexible role where your content creates real impact—join us in shaping the future of hiring.

job_summary: Job Description Objectives of this role The Growth Marketing Manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and managing all digital marketing activities for Chubb Life and its partners. They will develop and implement growth strategies to achieve revenue goals, analyze consumer behaviors and trends, and optimize digital campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, stay updated on social media trends, and possess superior project management skills. Responsibilities Drive Conversion: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define campaign strategy and calendar to drive customer acquisition targets Own media planning activities to drive paid and unpaid media strategies to drive increased conversion Guide paid efforts across channels, optimizing growth objectives in line with marketing spend. Own Marketing Operational Processes: Define, document and roll out guidelines and processes for Strategic Marketing Fund disbursement, use and reconciliation. Create clear R&R across Chubb and digital partner teams to ensure seamless day to day operations. Develop and monitor campaign budgets to ensure efficient allocation of resources. Drive a test and learn approach leveraging data and behavioral insights to continuously optimize campaigns and conversion Leverage data driven insights and collaborate with data analytics function Prepare comprehensive reports and analytics on overall campaign performance, including ROI and KPIs, and provide actionable recommendations. Drive innovation: Research and propose innovative digital marketing campaigns and strategies to stay ahead of industry trends. KPIS: Sales: APE, Year 1 Persistency Digital Marketing: Website/ App traffic, conversion rates, customer acquisition cost (CAC), social media engagement, relevant digital platforms engagement and performance metrics. Qualifications Minimum of 8 years of experience in user acquisition and performance marketing, with a proven track record of successfully driving revenue growth leveraging paid media campaigns. Expertise in Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Retargeting, Affiliate, CRO, and SEO, with a strong understanding of best practices and industry trends. Up-to-date knowledge of mobile performance marketing, trends, and best practices, understanding the unique opportunities and challenges associated with mobile user acquisition and engagement. Understanding of website analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, to track and measure marketing campaign performance, customer behavior, and conversion metrics. In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms and current digital trends, staying updated on emerging technologies and techniques to implement innovative growth strategies. Proficient in utilizing social media platforms for marketing purposes and leveraging them to drive sales. Possess an analytical mind with a strong passion for data measurement and insights generation, leveraging data-driven decision making for continuous optimization and improvement. Commercial oriented mindset, ability to connect marketing strategy effectiveness across the sales funnel, specifically in the Insurance or Financial Services context. Strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail and the ability to derive actionable insights from data analysis to optimize campaigns and improve performance across digital channels. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional departments, including Product, Services, and Sales, to align growth strategies and achieve revenue objectives. Strong project management and leadership skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead successful growth campaigns from conception to execution, managing timelines, budgets, and resources effectively. Exceptional written, oral, and organizational abilities, with the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and succinctly. Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field, providing a solid foundation in marketing principles and strategies. Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
Job Description

Objectives of this role

The Growth Marketing Manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and managing all digital marketing activities for Chubb Life and its partners. They will develop and implement growth strategies to achieve revenue goals, analyze consumer behaviors and trends, and optimize digital campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, stay updated on social media trends, and possess superior project management skills.

Responsibilities

  • Drive Conversion:
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define campaign strategy and calendar to drive customer acquisition targets
  • Own media planning activities to drive paid and unpaid media strategies to drive increased conversion
  • Guide paid efforts across channels, optimizing growth objectives in line with marketing spend.
  • Own Marketing Operational Processes:
  • Define, document and roll out guidelines and processes for Strategic Marketing Fund disbursement, use and reconciliation.
  • Create clear R&R across Chubb and digital partner teams to ensure seamless day to day operations.
  • Develop and monitor campaign budgets to ensure efficient allocation of resources.
  • Drive a test and learn approach leveraging data and behavioral insights to continuously optimize campaigns and conversion
  • Leverage data driven insights and collaborate with data analytics function
  • Prepare comprehensive reports and analytics on overall campaign performance, including ROI and KPIs, and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Drive innovation:
  • Research and propose innovative digital marketing campaigns and strategies to stay ahead of industry trends.
  • KPIS:
  • Sales: APE, Year 1 Persistency
  • Digital Marketing: Website/ App traffic, conversion rates, customer acquisition cost (CAC), social media engagement, relevant digital platforms engagement and performance metrics.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 8 years of experience in user acquisition and performance marketing, with a proven track record of successfully driving revenue growth leveraging paid media campaigns.
  • Expertise in Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Retargeting, Affiliate, CRO, and SEO, with a strong understanding of best practices and industry trends.
  • Up-to-date knowledge of mobile performance marketing, trends, and best practices, understanding the unique opportunities and challenges associated with mobile user acquisition and engagement.
  • Understanding of website analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, to track and measure marketing campaign performance, customer behavior, and conversion metrics.
  • In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms and current digital trends, staying updated on emerging technologies and techniques to implement innovative growth strategies.
  • Proficient in utilizing social media platforms for marketing purposes and leveraging them to drive sales.
  • Possess an analytical mind with a strong passion for data measurement and insights generation, leveraging data-driven decision making for continuous optimization and improvement.
  • Commercial oriented mindset, ability to connect marketing strategy effectiveness across the sales funnel, specifically in the Insurance or Financial Services context.
  • Strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail and the ability to derive actionable insights from data analysis to optimize campaigns and improve performance across digital channels.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional departments, including Product, Services, and Sales, to align growth strategies and achieve revenue objectives.
  • Strong project management and leadership skills, with a demonstrated ability to lead successful growth campaigns from conception to execution, managing timelines, budgets, and resources effectively.
  • Exceptional written, oral, and organizational abilities, with the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and succinctly.
  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field, providing a solid foundation in marketing principles and strategies.

job_description_formatted:
About NetApp

NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.

If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. We embrace diversity and openness because it's in our DNA. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.

"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization."-George Kurian, CEO

Job Summary

NetApp is looking for a Commercial Account Manager to join our exceptional sales team in Vietam. We are looking for a motivated sales person to understand and sell NetApp's full Product, cloud and professional services portfolio to new and existing NetApp customers across top commercial accounts, as well as maintaining positive on-going relationships to meet evolving customer needs. Working in conjunction with channel partners, your overall focus areas will be in prospecting, developing business, responding to RFP's, developing proposals for presentation to customers, and selling Products and Services. You will be supported by Cross-functional teams from NetApp's Marketing, Systems Engineering and Product Development functions to attain and exceed sales performance goals. You will utilize your excellent relationship building, negotiating, and strong technical skills to be successful in this role.

Job Requirements

The essential responsibilities of the Commercial Account Manager are to work directly with NetApp’s partners and their customers to capture sales opportunities and to work effectively across functions with other NetApp employees. Specific areas of responsibility that you will be responsible for include:

  • Use relationship management techniques to develop selling opportunities within existing customer accounts (Hanoi); penetrate new divisions and organizations within assigned accounts; develop new selling relationships within assigned partner accounts.
  • Schedule and attend sales call appointments with customers. Other NetApp sales team members may also participate in the sales call to help qualify the opportunity.
  • Determining if customer has a valid need for NetApp products and services.
  • Utilizing a consultative approach, discuss business issues with customer and develop a formal quote, a written sales proposal, or a formal sales presentation addressing their business needs.
  • Respond to RFP’s and follow up with customer.
  • Develop an account management plan to sell to customer based on their business need.
  • Build and strengthen your business relationship with customers within existing accounts. Ensure that their needs are being met.
  • Recommend marketing strategies.
  • Provide status information to your Manager including forecast/pipeline information.
  • Provide, or facilitate training opportunities for your accounts.


Education

  • 5 to 8 years of overall IT Infrastructure industry experience, with data storage experience is preferred and a strong understanding of its’ sales cycle, know-hows in managing the Commercial segment business.
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.
  • Strong understanding of both Direct Sales and through Channel/Partner Eco-system in Vietnam, with preferential experience working with Telco and Government clients
  • Ability to work collaboratively with employees within department and across functions.


At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.

Did you know...

Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they're 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.

Why NetApp?

We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better - but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.

We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off each year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive benefits, including health care, life and accident plans, emotional support resources for you and your family, legal services, and financial savings programs to help you plan for your future. We support professional and personal growth through educational assistance and provide access to various discounts and perks to enhance your overall quality of life.

If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

Company Description

The Pullman Saigon Centre is a modern and premium hotel located in District 1, the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. With easy access to major attractions, shopping districts, and cultural sites, it serves as an ideal base for exploring the vibrant city. Known for its contemporary design and upscale amenities, the hotel caters to both business and leisure travelers.

Job Description

  • Report directly to Director of Food & Beverage
  • All food and beverage outlets, storage and provision areas are under the responsibility of the Assistant Food & Beverage Manager
  • Behaves and acts in an exemplary fashion, embodying the brand mindset
  • Conveys the hotel’s image and atmosphere by providing a warm and friendly welcome, being available and frequently visible in the hotel
  • Maximize business opportunities, up sell and cost reduction, without compromising standards
  • Support Heartists to improve their skills and provides the tools required for career development
  • Manages, motivates and organizes personnel in order to improve the quality and the creativity of F&B Department
  • Makes suggestions for service, food and F&B promotion improvement
  • Takes part in the F&B hotel strategy with implementation of all marketing plan
  • Improves department’s results by increasing sales, improving the management of points of sale in the restaurants, bars, and 24 hour room service

Qualifications

  • Degree in Hotel Management, or Business Management with Hospitality Certificate.
  • At least 01 - 02 years’ in experience as Assistant F&B Manager in hotel environment
  • Experience in Accor Group is an advantage
  • Languages: fluent in the national language, English and a 3rd language would be a plus

job_description_formatted:
The Business Development cum Sales Executive will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, developing relationships with potential and existing clients, and driving sales growth. This role combines strategic business development activities with day-to-day sales execution, including lead generation, client engagement, quote preparation, and tender support.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Development:

Identify and pursue new business opportunities to expand the company’s customer base.

Conduct market research to understand customer needs, industry trends, and potential areas of growth.

Develop and implement effective sales strategies aligned with business objectives.

Build and nurture long-term relationships with key clients and stakeholders.

Represent the company at networking events, trade shows, and industry conferences.

Sales Execution:

Generate leads through cold calling, networking, and other outreach methods.

Convert leads into successful sales opportunities.

Negotiate and close business deals in line with company policies and pricing guidelines.

Maintain regular contact with existing clients to ensure satisfaction and identify upselling opportunities.

Provide prompt and efficient support to clients, ensuring high levels of customer service.

Reporting and Analysis:

Track and report on sales performance against targets and KPIs.

Prepare regular reports for senior management on sales activities and market feedback.

Monitor competitor activities and market trends to inform strategic decisions.

Prepare sales forecasts based on market intelligence and pipeline analysis.

Administrative & Support:

Assist senior team members in the preparation of quotes and tender documentation.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities in CRM or other tools.

job_description_formatted:
NVIDIA has been transforming computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s a unique legacy of innovation that’s fueled by great technology—and amazing people.

Today, we’re tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. An era in which our GPU acts as the brains of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can understand the world. Doing what’s never been done before takes vision, innovation, and the world’s best talent. As an NVIDIAN, you’ll be immersed in a diverse, supportive environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work. Come join the team and see how you can make a lasting impact on the world.

We are looking for a Solutions Architect with experience in large scale cloud native application development and experience with AI applications.

A Solution Architect is the first line of technical expertise between NVIDIA and our customers, as well as our partners. Your duties will vary from solutions design and development, industry and marketing speaking engagements, training delivery, troubleshooting, project coordination, customer relationship management and more. In this role you will provide support for customers in the South East Asia region.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Identify new opportunities for NVIDIA technology and solutions, by optimally communicating and positioning the product portfolio and analysing customer requirements. Independently lead technical sales activities in collaboration with the extended team.
  • Support customers in packaging custom microservices and workflows and develop cloud native Agentic AI leveraging NVIDIA’s NIMs microservices and Blueprints.
  • Work with NVIDIA's rich portfolio of tools such as Dynamo, AI-Q, NIMs, Blueprints, Triton Inference Server, GPU and Network Operators, Run:AI, Lepton, NVCF, Base Command Manager and our many use case and industry specific SDKs (I.e. NeMo)
  • Advise on distributed cloud native inferencing, including load balancing and network requirements. Services performance and availability optimisations to meet requirements and SLAs.
  • Provide customer feedback to internal engineering and product management teams to improve and refine existing products – and develop new ones !
  • Closely collaborate with internal teams (professional services, product development, enterprise support) and ecosystem partners (ISVs, Solution Integrators) to deliver solutions to our customers.
  • Setup and run demos, proof of concepts and benchmarks as required.
  • Deliver technical training and workshops to customers and partners. Present at industry and marketing events.

What We Need To See

  • A passion for customer success and innovative AI solutions.
  • Someone motivated, able to work independently, proactively with minimal direction.
  • 5+ years of experience with cloud native applications development and packaging
  • BSc or Master in Computer Science, Engineering or related subjects.
  • Experience with MLOps CI/CD pipelines and related tools.
  • Deep understanding of Kubernetes, Cloud native networking, Ingress controllers and load balancers for HTTP and gRPC.
  • Understanding of methodologies for application and workflows performance tuning.
  • Outstanding communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and love to work as part of a team.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time to support customer in South East Asia and beyond.
  • Native or Professional language proficiency in English.

Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd

  • Hands-on experience with production deployments of Triton Inference Server on Kubernetes.
  • Exposure to RAG and vector databases.
  • CKA or CKAD certifications or equivalents.
  • Professional fluency in one of these languages: Mandarin.

Widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers, NVIDIA offers highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package. As you plan your future, see what we can offer to you and your family www.nvidiabenefits.com/

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. job_summary: What is Ansible Health? Ansible Health unites physicians, nurses, respiratory therapists, and tech experts from Columbia, Johns Hopkins, Google, Amazon, and other top institutions to revolutionize care for chronic disease patients. We combine elite clinical expertise with cutting-edge technology to deliver personalized, efficient care at scale. Our team's groundbreaking research, published in leading journals like Nature and PLOS, demonstrates our commitment to innovation. Backed by Bessemer, First Round Capital, AlleyCorp, Breyer Capital, and Inflect Capital, we're a Series A startup partnering with leading healthcare systems nationwide. Our mission is to genuinely improve patient outcomes, not just optimize metrics. If you're passionate about transforming healthcare through technology, join our diverse team in making a real impact. The Job at a Glance Most of our patients are older adults located in the USA. These calls involve guiding patients through using their Android tablet and verifying it in the backend through Samsung Knox, ensuring that RPM devices are connected and transmitting accurate data, and assisting them in joining their appointments through our tablet via Zoom. Occasionally, patients may require additional help during their time in our program. In some instances, verifying data through Azure (Device Analytics and CosmosDB) may be necessary. Furthermore, you will provide technical support to our clinical team, and ensure they are prepared for their virtual appointments. They may also require assistance using Athenahealth, such as modifying visits and checking in/out. You will handle general general technical support duties, which demand a solid understanding of our tech stack and products (i.e., Android Tablet, Zoom meetings and phone, Google Workspace). You should be capable of providing basic troubleshooting steps and assistance to remove obstacles for clinicians/support staff in their work, and are expected to be able to have on-call availability for urgent situations where patient care is affected. Collaborating closely with our Engineering Team is also an essential aspect of your role to effectively escalate issues requiring broader coordination and resolution. GitLab and Azure DevOps are the primary ticketing systems used for filing issues and requests. Continuous follow-ups and monitoring are expected until the issue is resolved end-to-end. In addition, you are expected to be able to present and take notes on meetings about issues encountered in Tech. The ideal candidate should be comfortable navigating ambiguity due to the ever-evolving nature of our startup. To excel in this role, excellent problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills are essential. A Healthcare IT Support Specialist is expected to: Maintain a reliable, high-speed internet connection Handle Tech Support requests filed by clinicians or patients from end to end Manage and organize various project tools (e.g., GitLab, AzureDevOps, spreadsheets, bug trackers, documents) Conduct Tech Calls for non-tech-savvy patients (mainly older adults) in the USA Guide patients through Android tablet usage and confirm settings through Samsung Knox Work with RPM devices to ensure they are connected and transmitting accurate data Collaborate with Engineering Team and Program Managers to escalate and resolve issues Assist clinicians and company support staff with technical issues Run queries and check analytics using Azure‚Äôs CosmosDB or Device Analytics Become extremely familiar with our proprietary app, tablets, RPM devices, and backend systems. Support clinical team with equipment setup and checking applied security policies Present and take notes on Technical meetings, specifically on issues encountered and plans to resolve them. Qualifications And Experience Prior experience in a customer support role, such as Technical Support Specialist or Support Engineer Expertise in Android Tablets, Samsung Knox Suite, and Knox Manage Proficiency in managing Zoom Meetings and Zoom Phone Familiarity with medical devices (e.g., Blood Pressure monitor, Pulse Oximeter) Knowledge of Athenahealth preferred Experience using issue tracking software and remote support tools (e.g., Gitlab, Azure DevOps) is a plus Understanding of technology systems, particularly Google Workspace Positive, enthusiastic attitude and excellent English language skills (C2 level) Skilled in technical debugging techniques (e.g., analyzing metrics and logs on Azure) Strong written and verbal communication, problem-solving skills, and detail-oriented Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively Healthcare setting experience advantageous Type of Role Full-time: 40 hours a week (Monday - Friday; 12pm - 8pm EST) Benefits: Flexible PTO and HMO coverage. Level: Mid-Career, 3-5 years relevant work experience Location: Remote Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
What is Ansible Health?

Ansible Health unites physicians, nurses, respiratory therapists, and tech experts from Columbia, Johns Hopkins, Google, Amazon, and other top institutions to revolutionize care for chronic disease patients. We combine elite clinical expertise with cutting-edge technology to deliver personalized, efficient care at scale. Our team's groundbreaking research, published in leading journals like Nature and PLOS, demonstrates our commitment to innovation. Backed by Bessemer, First Round Capital, AlleyCorp, Breyer Capital, and Inflect Capital, we're a Series A startup partnering with leading healthcare systems nationwide. Our mission is to genuinely improve patient outcomes, not just optimize metrics. If you're passionate about transforming healthcare through technology, join our diverse team in making a real impact.

The Job at a Glance

Most of our patients are older adults located in the USA. These calls involve guiding patients through using their Android tablet and verifying it in the backend through Samsung Knox, ensuring that RPM devices are connected and transmitting accurate data, and assisting them in joining their appointments through our tablet via Zoom. Occasionally, patients may require additional help during their time in our program. In some instances, verifying data through Azure (Device Analytics and CosmosDB) may be necessary.

Furthermore, you will provide technical support to our clinical team, and ensure they are prepared for their virtual appointments. They may also require assistance using Athenahealth, such as modifying visits and checking in/out. You will handle general general technical support duties, which demand a solid understanding of our tech stack and products (i.e., Android Tablet, Zoom meetings and phone, Google Workspace). You should be capable of providing basic troubleshooting steps and assistance to remove obstacles for clinicians/support staff in their work, and are expected to be able to have on-call availability for urgent situations where patient care is affected.

Collaborating closely with our Engineering Team is also an essential aspect of your role to effectively escalate issues requiring broader coordination and resolution. GitLab and Azure DevOps are the primary ticketing systems used for filing issues and requests. Continuous follow-ups and monitoring are expected until the issue is resolved end-to-end. In addition, you are expected to be able to present and take notes on meetings about issues encountered in Tech.

The ideal candidate should be comfortable navigating ambiguity due to the ever-evolving nature of our startup. To excel in this role, excellent problem-solving, communication, and organizational skills are essential.

A Healthcare IT Support Specialist is expected to:

  • Maintain a reliable, high-speed internet connection
  • Handle Tech Support requests filed by clinicians or patients from end to end
  • Manage and organize various project tools (e.g., GitLab, AzureDevOps, spreadsheets, bug trackers, documents)
  • Conduct Tech Calls for non-tech-savvy patients (mainly older adults) in the USA
  • Guide patients through Android tablet usage and confirm settings through Samsung Knox
  • Work with RPM devices to ensure they are connected and transmitting accurate data
  • Collaborate with Engineering Team and Program Managers to escalate and resolve issues
  • Assist clinicians and company support staff with technical issues
  • Run queries and check analytics using Azure’s CosmosDB or Device Analytics
  • Become extremely familiar with our proprietary app, tablets, RPM devices, and backend systems.
  • Support clinical team with equipment setup and checking applied security policies
  • Present and take notes on Technical meetings, specifically on issues encountered and plans to resolve them.

Qualifications And Experience

  • Prior experience in a customer support role, such as Technical Support Specialist or Support Engineer
  • Expertise in Android Tablets, Samsung Knox Suite, and Knox Manage
  • Proficiency in managing Zoom Meetings and Zoom Phone
  • Familiarity with medical devices (e.g., Blood Pressure monitor, Pulse Oximeter)
  • Knowledge of Athenahealth preferred
  • Experience using issue tracking software and remote support tools (e.g., Gitlab, Azure DevOps) is a plus
  • Understanding of technology systems, particularly Google Workspace
  • Positive, enthusiastic attitude and excellent English language skills (C2 level)
  • Skilled in technical debugging techniques (e.g., analyzing metrics and logs on Azure)
  • Strong written and verbal communication, problem-solving skills, and detail-oriented
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively
  • Healthcare setting experience advantageous

Type of Role

  • Full-time: 40 hours a week (Monday - Friday; 12pm - 8pm EST)
  • Benefits: Flexible PTO and HMO coverage.
  • Level: Mid-Career, 3-5 years relevant work experience
  • Location: Remote

job_summary: Company Description The Pullman Vung Tau Hotel features 356 rooms with contemporary designs inspired by the creative and vibrant coastal city life, offering guests a "bleisure" experience ‚Äî a perfect balance between work and leisure. Our conference and event center spans over 2,321 square meters, comprising 2 grand ballrooms and 4 meeting rooms equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, accommodating up to 1200 guests. Guests can also meet, entertain, or relax while enjoying distinct and enticing culinary experiences at Riviera Restaurant with an international √† la carte menu, Corniche Ultra Lounge serving Tapas or experiencing delightful beverages at the Lobby Bar or Poolside Bar. The Fit Lounge is open 24/7, and the outdoor pool bathed in natural light, complemented by Pullman's unique amenities such as the Welcomer service, Signature Pullman bedding, Connectivity Lounge, and Co-Meeting criteria, ensuring a satisfying stay for all guests. Job Description GENERAL MISSION Is the image representative, is the builder, preserving and developing the reputation and brand of the Investor and the Hotel Management Group. The receptionists will be enthusiastic and co-efficient to serve all guests approaching the Front Desk with a professional, warm and positive attitude. You will be a key factor in the check-in and check-out process, which occurs at the Front Desk, and will be available to help the guest in any of their request. The receptionist rotates 24 hours a day. The receptionist report directly to the Front Desk Supervisor. job_description_formatted:
Company Description

The Pullman Vung Tau Hotel features 356 rooms with contemporary designs inspired by the creative and vibrant coastal city life, offering guests a "bleisure" experience — a perfect balance between work and leisure. Our conference and event center spans over 2,321 square meters, comprising 2 grand ballrooms and 4 meeting rooms equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, accommodating up to 1200 guests. Guests can also meet, entertain, or relax while enjoying distinct and enticing culinary experiences at Riviera Restaurant with an international à la carte menu, Corniche Ultra Lounge serving Tapas or experiencing delightful beverages at the Lobby Bar or Poolside Bar. The Fit Lounge is open 24/7, and the outdoor pool bathed in natural light, complemented by Pullman's unique amenities such as the Welcomer service, Signature Pullman bedding, Connectivity Lounge, and Co-Meeting criteria, ensuring a satisfying stay for all guests.

Job Description

GENERAL MISSION

  • Is the image representative, is the builder, preserving and developing the reputation and brand of the Investor and the Hotel Management Group.
  • The receptionists will be enthusiastic and co-efficient to serve all guests approaching the Front Desk with a professional, warm and positive attitude. You will be a key factor in the check-in and check-out process, which occurs at the Front Desk, and will be available to help the guest in any of their request.
  • The receptionist rotates 24 hours a day.
  • The receptionist report directly to the Front Desk Supervisor.

Technical Responsibilities

  • The receptionists will be the first person that guests will approach for any service or assistance. The greetings and attitudes of the Front Desk will influence a lot on guest’s perception about our hotel overall.
  • Being at the service of the guest, the first task of the Receptionist is to be available at any time for a guest and to take extra care of him by an automatic greeting with smile, warm & positive attitude. The guest will feel they are welcomed at any time. The guest will be always the first priority for a Receptionist.

Main Responsibilities

  • Greeting /Attitude: In any circumstances, the receptionist will be smiley, willing to help the guest, will ensure a warm greeting to any guest arriving from 3 meters of the Front Desk and will keep permanently a positive attitude.
  • Follow–up: The receptionist will act quickly and efficiently, following the instructions received from her/ his supervisor.
  • Organization: He/she will ensure that his/ her sections is perfectly tidy at any time, the accessories & stationary used for the operations are refilled as often as required and the circuits of operations are followed strictly.
  • Communication: He/she will be attentive on all information received during the different briefing such as the Daily FD Supervisor briefing. During his/her shift. He/she will report quickly any problems or questions to his/her supervisor. The Receptionist will read the FD logbook at the beginning of shift, follow up and keep it updated during his/ her shift.
  • Immigration records: The receptionist will ensure to collect all immigration details for all guests who checked in during his/her shift.
  • Clubs bookings & VIP: The Receptionist will be attentive that each VIP guest arriving at the Front Desk is processed quickly. To communicate with the Guest Relation Officer/Butler efficiently to ensure that they have time to prepare the Check-in.
  • Movements in the space: The receptionist will standby at the Front Desk and will leave this place only with prior authorization of the FD Supervisor and for a valid reason (lunch, dinner).
  • Guest requests follow up: The Receptionist will be ready to help the guest in any of his request and will guide him to the right person when it is required. The receptionist will ensure at any time that no guest is waiting for too long to have somebody available at the Front Desk: To get a room or waiting for the Duty Manager.
  • Handover: End of each shift, the receptionist will clear his/her station totally and do a full and detailed handover to the following shift. He/she will check detaily that his/her cashier report is correct with all backup attached.
  • Selling/ Upselling: The receptionist has selling role. He/she has to ensure that all the payment received are accurate with the rate given and he/she has to increase the hotel revenue by trying to the upsell the guest who are checking in a tactful manner and in line with the upselling procedures.
  • Privacy: The receptionist will be attentive to respect the privacy/ confidentiality of the information, or guest names available. He/she will ensure not to transmit any guest name, or guest history information.
  • Security: the receptionist has to know his/her duties & responsibilities in the eventuality of fire.
  • To ensure that all the standards and procedures established at the Pullman Vungtau are reached successfully and sustainably.
  • To be responsible for adhering to Pullman Vung tau staff rules and regulations as detailed in the Pullman Vungtau staff handbook.

Additional Information

Your Skills & Experiences

  • Diploma in Hotel Management, Receptionist or related field
  • Minimum experience required : 1 to 2 years
  • Fluent in English communication.

job_summary: A logistics service provider is seeking a Sales Director to spearhead its ambitious growth in Ho Chi Minh. This is an exceptional opportunity for you to shape the future of a new subsidiary, starting from the ground up and driving business expansion across Vietnam's thriving logistics sector. You will have the unique chance to build and nurture your own team, develop innovative sales strategies, and establish a strong market presence. With supportive connections to a major manufacturing plant, you will benefit from valuable resources while enjoying the autonomy to create non-reliant revenue streams that ensure long-term success. If you are passionate about logistics, eager to make a tangible impact, and ready to take on a pivotal role in a collaborative and inclusive environment, this position offers the perfect platform for your next career move. Play a key role in launching and growing a new logistics subsidiary in Vietnam, with full responsibility for team creation and business development. Enjoy the support of an established manufacturing partner while having the freedom to innovate and drive independent sales initiatives for sustainable growth. Benefit from flexible working opportunities, ongoing training, and a supportive leadership team committed to your professional development and well-being. What you'll do: As a Director, you will play an instrumental role in launching a new subsidiary in Ho Chi Minh. Your day-to-day responsibilities will revolve around building a talented team from scratch, setting clear objectives for revenue generation, and developing effective sales strategies tailored to both sea and air freight markets. You will be empowered to leverage support from an established manufacturing partner while also focusing on creating independent revenue streams that drive sustainable business growth. Success in this role requires you to foster strong client relationships, stay attuned to market developments, negotiate advantageous contracts, and ensure regulatory compliance at every step. By championing collaboration and nurturing talent within your team, you will help lay the foundation for long-term success in one of Vietnam's most exciting sectors. What you bring: You will bring significant expertise gained from previous roles in sales management within logistics or freight forwarding environments. Your background should include hands-on involvement with both sea and air freight operations as well as experience launching or expanding subsidiaries in fast-growing markets. You will be adept at building cohesive teams who thrive on collaboration and mutual support. Your interpersonal strengths will enable you to connect authentically with clients while your analytical mindset ensures informed decision-making based on real-time market insights. A commitment to inclusivity is essential; you understand how nurturing diverse perspectives leads to stronger outcomes for everyone involved. Your communication style is clear yet empathetic-enabling you not only to negotiate successfully but also inspire those around you toward shared goals. What sets this company apart: This organisation stands out as a forward-thinking leader within the logistics sector-committed not only to commercial excellence but also to creating meaningful opportunities for personal growth. Employees enjoy access to flexible working arrangements designed around their needs alongside generous training programmes that encourage lifelong learning. The leadership team is renowned for its supportive approach: they prioritise open dialogue, value every contribution regardless of seniority or background, and actively invest in employee well-being. As part of this company's journey into Vietnam's vibrant market landscape, you will find yourself surrounded by knowledgeable colleagues who are passionate about sharing their expertise while working together towards common goals. The company's inclusive ethos ensures that everyone has a voice-and that your achievements are recognised as part of something bigger than any one individual can accomplish alone. What's next: If you are ready to take on this rewarding challenge-where your vision can shape the future of logistics in Vietnam-this is your moment! Apply today by clicking on the link below; join a collaborative team where your contributions truly matter. Due to the high volume of applications we are experiencing, our team will only be in touch with you if your application is shortlisted. Show more Show less

job_description_formatted:
🚀 About Flowmingo

Flowmingo is reimagining how companies hire.


We’re an AI-powered interview platform helping fast-growing teams identify top talent faster and more fairly. Backed by Y Combinator and trusted by modern recruiters, Flowmingo has helped reduce time-to-hire and hiring costs by up to 89%.


The best part? Flowmingo is FREE to adopt, making it easy for companies to try and implement. Our revenue comes from optional premium features that enhance control and customization—designed for organizations that want more structure or precision in their hiring process. This makes the product both accessible and valuable to a wide range of companies.


💼 About the Role

As a Content Partner, you’ll act as a voice and storyteller for Flowmingo. You’ll help introduce the platform to your audience through content—whether it’s LinkedIn posts, blog articles, short videos, or other creative formats—and earn competitive commissions when your content drives successful client referrals.


This is a referral-based role with no fixed hours. Whether you’re a content creator, marketing consultant, HR blogger, or someone with an engaged professional audience, this role offers flexibility and high-impact potential.


🎯 What You’ll Do

  • Share Flowmingo through authentic content on your preferred channels
  • Create posts, articles, or videos that explain how Flowmingo helps hiring teams
  • Inspire your audience to explore the platform and sign up
  • Provide feedback and ideas to improve Flowmingo’s messaging and reach
  • Work independently and earn based on the impact of your referrals


🤝 Who This Is For

  • Content creators, marketers, and professionals with an engaged audience
  • People who enjoy making and sharing content that helps others discover useful tools
  • Clear communicators who can simplify complex ideas into engaging content
  • Self-starters who want flexible, high-reward opportunities


💰 Compensation & Benefits

🟢 Work anytime, anywhere

🟢 High-performance = high reward


This is a commission partner role. Your earnings are based on how many successful client referrals you generate.

  • Transparent, performance-based payout structure
  • Commission increases with volume and consistency
  • Full visibility into your referral impact and client status


✅ How to Join

To get started, please apply using this link. If we see a good fit, we’ll send you a short AI interview to learn more about your style and communication approach.

📌 Before applying, take a few minutes to browse Flowmingo’s website so you can understand our product and value.


If you’re excited to represent a product that sells itself—and want a flexible role where your content creates real impact—join us in shaping the future of hiring.

job_summary: FULL-STACK JS DEVELOPER ‚Äì AI-NATIVE Company: itworks.asia‚Äôs Client Salary Range: 50-70M gross YOE: 5+ English: B2/ C1 Working hours: Monday to Friday Working Location: Remote Working type: Remote Contract Type: Fulltime Remote (Social Insurance: Yes) As a Fullstack AI-Native Engineer , you‚Äôll drive the creation of scalable, AI-powered solutions to revolutionize our tech landscape, enhancing efficiency, innovation, and user satisfaction. Collaborating with data scientists, product managers, designers, and DevOps teams, you‚Äôll build robust systems with seamless AI integration, setting new standards for reliability and excellence. We are looking for a high-quality, architecture-minded engineer who combines strong technical fundamentals with the smart use of AI tools, a focus on system reliability, and a deeply collaborative mindset. They take ownership of code quality and system stability, always striving to level up both their own work and their team‚Äôs performance. KEY OUTCOMES: Deliver High-Quality Code: Consistently submit well-documented, maintainable code with high test coverage (>80%) through PRs, following team standards and best practices. Apply Strong Fundamentals: Design and build features applying solid software architecture (e.g., SOLID, clean architecture), efficient database design, and API best practices. Leverage AI Tools Effectively: Use AI coding assistants to speed up development (e.g., boilerplate, test writing, debugging) without sacrificing code quality. Share effective prompts and techniques Contribute to System Stability: Maintain production rollback rates below 2% by enforcing thorough testing, leveraging CI/CD, and following DevOps best practices. Engage in Collaborative Development: Actively join code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and respond positively to feedback to boost team velocity and knowledge sharing. REQUIREMENTS Experience : 5+ years as a Fullstack Engineer, AI Specialist, or similar, with a strong track record of deploying scalable, AI-integrated applications. Frontend & Backend Skills: Proficient in VueJS/React and NodeJS (TypeScript) , with experience building modular, reusable, and resilient microservices. Database & Architecture: Skilled in MongoDB/Supabase, REST/RPC, and designing systems aligned with Clean/Hexagonal architecture, SOLID principles, ACID compliance, and idempotency. job_description_formatted:
FULL-STACK JS DEVELOPER – AI-NATIVE


  • Company: itworks.asia’s Client
  • Salary Range: 50-70M gross
  • YOE: 5+
  • English: B2/ C1
  • Working hours: Monday to Friday
  • Working Location: Remote
  • Working type: Remote
  • Contract Type: Fulltime Remote (Social Insurance: Yes) 



As a Fullstack AI-Native Engineer, you’ll drive the creation of scalable, AI-powered solutions to revolutionize our tech landscape, enhancing efficiency, innovation, and user satisfaction. Collaborating with data scientists, product managers, designers, and DevOps teams, you’ll build robust systems with seamless AI integration, setting new standards for reliability and excellence. 

We are looking for a high-quality, architecture-minded engineer who combines strong technical fundamentals with the smart use of AI tools, a focus on system reliability, and a deeply collaborative mindset. They take ownership of code quality and system stability, always striving to level up both their own work and their team’s performance.


KEY OUTCOMES:

  • Deliver High-Quality Code: Consistently submit well-documented, maintainable code with high test coverage (>80%) through PRs, following team standards and best practices.
  • Apply Strong Fundamentals: Design and build features applying solid software architecture (e.g., SOLID, clean architecture), efficient database design, and API best practices.
  • Leverage AI Tools Effectively: Use AI coding assistants to speed up development (e.g., boilerplate, test writing, debugging) without sacrificing code quality. Share effective prompts and techniques
  • Contribute to System Stability: Maintain production rollback rates below 2% by enforcing thorough testing, leveraging CI/CD, and following DevOps best practices.
  • Engage in Collaborative Development: Actively join code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and respond positively to feedback to boost team velocity and knowledge sharing.


REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience: 5+ years as a Fullstack Engineer, AI Specialist, or similar, with a strong track record of deploying scalable, AI-integrated applications.
  • Frontend & Backend Skills: Proficient in VueJS/React and NodeJS (TypeScript), with experience building modular, reusable, and resilient microservices.
  • Database & Architecture: Skilled in MongoDB/Supabase, REST/RPC, and designing systems aligned with Clean/Hexagonal architecture, SOLID principles, ACID compliance, and idempotency.
  • AI Expertise: Experienced in AI ecosystems like LangChain and LlamaIndex, with hands-on skills in prompt engineering, RAG, and curiosity about specialized hardware like Groq.
  • Quality Commitment: Dedicated to high testing standards, secure coding, and detailed documentation for AI pipelines to ensure reliable performance.
  • Communication: Strong communicator, adept at collaborating with Agile teams and connecting product, UX, data science, and engineering to drive AI initiatives.
  • Cloud & DevOps: Knowledgeable in AWS/GCP, serverless/PaaS solutions, and Kubernetes deployments, with a focus on MLOps and AI model lifecycle best practices.
  • Versatility: Comfortable working independently or collaboratively, pushing projects from concept to production while inspiring your team.

BENEFITS

  • A remote working environment that allows you to work from anywhere in the world
  • Full-time insurance follow VN Labor laws
  • Work equipment support.
  • Annual bonus, performance-based bonus.
  • Monthly compensation package to help you work and live better, remotely!
  • Fully support for exams to get Certification and skills improvement training.
  • Receive 22 paid leaves on your 5th years. We encourage you to take one month off work.
  • A competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement with monthly coaching.
  • A dynamic and innovative team that values creativity and collaboration.


WORKING TIME: From Monday to Friday (8 hours/ day – VN time) - Sing client


THE HIRING PROCESS

  • R1: Live code + technical interview
  • R2: Meet client

Take Home Assessment (Estimated time: 2 hours)

Case study interview (~90 minutes)

Career Deep Dive/Behavioral fit interview (~60 minutes)

  • R3: meet Founder + Offer

job_summary: RBW Consulting are partnered with a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing next-generation, programmed T cell therapies for the treatment of cancer. Using a broad suite of proprietary and modular T cell programming technologies, the company is engineering precisely targeted, controlled and highly active T cell therapies that are designed to better recognise cancer cells, break down their defence mechanisms and eliminate these cells. They have a pipeline of product candidates in development for the treatment of haematological malignancies and solid tumours. The Senior Manager - Tissue Operations is accountable for managing onboarding and on-going performance of Apheresis and Treatment Centres used for Clinical Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T-cell Therapies. This role will serve as the technical operations single point of contact for Apheresis and Treatment Centres located within the designated region and may require management of contract employees. This role is remotely based to service designated regions. Regional travel up to 75% of time may be required. Key Responsibilities Develop and foster relationships with Apheresis, Cell Lab and Treatment Centre Staff for assigned region. Work with Clinical and Commercial CAR-T teams to establish the apheresis collection footprint to support the clinical trial site plans for assigned region. Coordinate with internal teams and collection site staff to ensure all collection site onboarding activities are successfully completed and sites are prepared to perform collections within the required timelines. Communicate collection site on-boarding status to Clinical teams and develop and execute mitigation plans for any delayed timelines. Perform technical site assessments and train collection center staff on collection requirements and attend site audits as required Provide Quality Systems support by participating in deviation activities and impact/investigation assessments for cell collection centers. Work with Quality Assurance and other internal business partners to monitor and assess vendor performance and capacity after site launch. Manage rollout of process changes to assigned sites. Collect VOC (voice of customer) and VOB (voice of business) feedback used for continuous operations improvement Collect and enter data into electronic data management systems Represent the department on cross-functional project teams, as requested. Comply with applicable SOP‚Äôs and regulations. Demonstrated skills and competencies: E ‚Äì Essential P ‚Äì Preferred Experience Experience in Apheresis Operations Management, QA Operations, GMP production, GTP or other relevant operational areas (E) Breadth of experience in regulated (GxP) environment, understanding of HTA (either hospital or pharmaceutical/biopharmaceutical company) (E) Experience working in Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs (P) Experience working with critical raw material suppliers or contract manufacturing organizations (E) Experience in an operational role for supplier qualification and management of external Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs. (P) Has successfully worked in a team-based environment. (E) Experience in delivering process improvements, ideally in processes for qualification, training, and management of external cell procurement (Apheresis) suppliers. (E) Experience managing contracts with external apheresis providers. (P) Prior customer facing role in pharmaceutical/biotech industry (P) Qualifications Undergraduate degree in related science or nursing (E) Advanced degree in related science or nursing (P) Be fluent in English and Vietnamese (E) Skills/Specialist knowledge Ability to rapidly solve problems and deal with organizational complexity Ability to prioritize and complete work with sense of urgency based on criticality Medical, scientific and clinical knowledge Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards High attention to detail skills High organization skills with ability to multi-task several tasks in parallel Customer-centricity ‚Äî Consider the impacts of decisions on the customer (treatment centre), striving to ensure that process changes improve and do not impede customer service when possible, while ensuring compliance with regulations Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills to communicate effectively across all levels within the organization and multiple cultures Please apply here and Harry Henson will be in touch to discuss your application further. job_description_formatted:
General Purpose

 JOB DESCRIPTION

Test and Validation for Elgato Products involving manual and automated testing. The primary duty is to ensure that products perform their proposed functions in a satisfactory manner. For complex products, such as cameras, capture, microphones and lights, test engineers may specialize in specific tasks, e.g. automated testing.

The testing method depends on the product under test.

Position Summary, Responsibilities, And Expectations

  • Expectations:
    • Able to complete testing and file results with minimal oversight.
    • Solid knowledge of PCs, Consoles, Smart devices
    • Able to trouble shoot across multiple platforms, Windows, MacOS, Android, iOS.
    • Python skills for test automation
    • English Level B2 or better
  • Responsible for:
    • Complete QA testing for SW and FW of Elgato products
    • Compiling reports on findings and testing data gathered
    • Record testing data and analyze results, and file all issues and concerns in bug tracking SW
    • Providing recommendations and advice to relevant stakeholders
    • Define and refine testcases
    • Automate tests where possible and necessary
Essential Skills And Experience

  • Graduate from Automation, Informatics, Tele-communication or similar!
  • Experience in testing or automation is a plus!
  • Proficient in Python
  • Ability to communicate in English, written and spoken (intermediate level min. A2)
  • Self-starter with minimal need for oversight
  • Independent thinker able to follow instruction.
  • Teamwork is a must.

About Us

CORSAIR (NASDAQ:CRSR), founded in 1994, is a leading global developer and manufacturer of high-performance gaming and streaming gear. With 21 different product lines, CORSAIR offers a complete range of products that help digital athletes perform at their peak and enable streaming creators to produce studio-quality content for their fans. CORSAIR has built a passionate base of loyal customers due to its gamer- and creator-centric design philosophy, commitment to high performance, and professional quality.

The company has received more than 4,000 product awards and has a footprint that reaches customers in more than 75 countries. CORSAIR also includes subsidiary brands Elgato, which provides premium studio equipment and accessories for content creators, SCUF Gaming, which builds custom-designed controllers for competitive gamers, ORIGIN PC, a builder of custom gaming and workstation desktop PCs and laptops, Drop, a community-driven company that designs and curates enthusiast keyboards and peripherals, and Fanatec, a leading manufacturer of high-end sim racing hardware.

job_summary: JOB OVERVIEW Scope of Work: 70% on Back End Developer, 30% on Devops (Terraform) Working time: Remote Full time, Asia Time Zone Only open for local candidate. Ability to clearly explain algorithms, code logic, and thought processes verbally and in written format. Work Approach Capable of balancing quick proof-of-concept work with structured refactoring for long-term sustainability and reduced technical debt. CI/CD Tools: Github Actions, linter setup. job_description_formatted:
JOB OVERVIEW


  1. Scope of Work: 70% on Back End Developer, 30% on Devops (Terraform)
  2. Working time: Remote Full time, Asia Time Zone
  3. Only open for local candidate.


ABOUT THE COMPANY

We are a decentralized exchange for sports trading. We are building a prediction market using smart contracts and blockchain technology. This is a great opportunity to work on a greenfield project, contribute your ideas and create something unique of your own. Join us if you want to work with a strong collaborative team with diverse expertise, designing a sleek and intuitive user experience.


WHAT YOU WILL DO

You’ll be working on a belief market, a variant of prediction markets. At a high level, your responsibilities will include troubleshooting urgent failures and prototyping proof-of-concept features. Our services are built using TypeScript and Python with type checking. They are deployed to AWS ECS and AWS Lambda using Terraform.


You will be monitoring performance and alerts with Grafana, troubleshooting and resolving urgent system issues, and implementing solutions to prevent failures and ensure high availability.


Additionally, you will prototype proof-of-concept features to test product-market fit, to collect and feedback for future production features. You will balance short-term bug fixes with longer-term infrastructure improvements to CI and deployments to reduce technical debt and enhance scalability.


WHAT YOU HAVE

Language Skills

Proficient in English for effective communication, both listening and speaking. Ability to clearly explain algorithms, code logic, and thought processes verbally and in written format.


Work Approach

Capable of balancing quick proof-of-concept work with structured refactoring for long-term sustainability and reduced technical debt.


Technical Expertise

  • Proficient in Typescript or Python. Familiarity with linting and type-checking tools such as MyPy for Python.
  • Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Docker.
  • CI/CD Tools: Github Actions, linter setup.
  • Familiarity with Cloud providers like AWS
  • Experience with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL, including schema design and optimizing query performance for scalability.
  • Experience in system monitoring, emergent bug fixing, and implementing solutions to prevent future failure.

job_description_formatted:
We are seeking a skilled System Engineer with expertise in OpenStack. The Candidate must have experiences and ability in Deployment Openstack, Configuration, and Customization.

The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and maintaining OpenStack environments to meet our organization's evolving infrastructure needs.


As a company operating in Vietnam with mainly international clients, we would like our Openstack System Engineers to understand the client's wishes and fulfill them together with our great development team. You should enjoy working in a family-oriented company that focuses on customer satisfaction and good communication. One of our core values is transparency and we believe that you find it just as important.


The Openstack System Engineers will be responsible for the following one of these tasks:

  • OpenStack Deployment: Lead the deployment process of OpenStack configurations across development, testing, and production environments with ability to setup, configure, tailoring the full stack.
  • OpenStack Troubleshooting and resolving issues. On the basis of the Ticketing Systems the System Engineers must analyze the open issue and find the resolution.
  • Configuration Management: Develop and implement best practices for OpenStack configuration management, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
  • Collaboration on Development and Customization: Collaborate with software developers and architects to customize OpenStack components, integrate new features, and enhance platform functionality.
  • Infrastructure Automation: Implement automation tools and scripts to streamline deployment processes, minimize manual intervention, and improve efficiency.
  • Performance Optimization: Monitor system performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimizations to enhance resource utilization and maximize system throughput.
  • Security and Compliance: Ensure OpenStack environments adhere to industry-standard security practices and regulatory compliance requirements.
  • Documentation and Training: Create detailed documentation, guidelines, and training materials to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure operational excellence.


The Openstack System Engineers is expected to have the following qualifications and skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or 6 years related field experience maturated, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Proven experience in deploying, configuring, supporting and managing OpenStack environments in enterprise-scale deployments
  • Proficiency in Linux system administration, including experience with virtualization technologies such as KVM and Docker.
  • Strong scripting skills (e.g., Shell, Python) for automation and orchestration tasks.
  • Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g., Ansible, Terraform) for provisioning and configuration management.
  • Solid understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and technologies (e.g., VLANs, IP addressing, routing).
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex system issues.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certification in OpenStack (e.g., Certified OpenStack Administrator, Certified OpenStack Engineer).
  • Experience with containerization platforms (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker Swarm).
  • Knowledge of software-defined networking (SDN) concepts and solutions (e.g., Neutron, OVS).
  • Familiarity with cloud-native technologies and architectures.


Send your resume to hr@xenia.tech

job_description_formatted:
As a Developer Relations Engineer (DevRel), you’ll be the bridge between our cutting-edge tech and the global developer community. You'll drive adoption by showcasing the power of our company’s modular architecture, creating educational content, engaging developers, and empowering them to build with our tech. Additionally, you’ll participate in business development (BD) calls to establish meaningful partnerships that expand our ecosystem.


Responsibilities

1. Developer Advocacy

  • Engage with developer communities to promote our companys' vision and technology.
  • Gather feedback from developers to inform product improvements and roadmap.


2. Event Organization & Travel

  • Plan and execute developer-focused events, workshops, and hackathons.
  • Represent our company at Web3 conferences, meetups, and university events.
  • Travel extensively to engage with regional developer communities and expand our companys’ presence.


3. Community Engagement

  • Build and nurture relationships with developers on platforms like Discord, Twitter, and GitHub.
  • Moderate and contribute to discussions in forums and social media to drive awareness.


4. Education & Enablement

  • Deliver talks and presentations at Web3 conferences, meetups, and universities.
  • Build sample dApps, demos, and starter kits to showcase our companys' capabilities.


5. Business Development (BD) Leadership

  • Lead BD calls with projects, communities, and enterprises to establish collaborations.
  • Identify partnership opportunities and communicate our company’s value proposition effectively.
  • Collaborate with the BD team to align technical implementations with strategic partnerships.


Qualifications

1. Event Organization & Travel

  • Proficiency in Web3 development (Solidity, JavaScript, other blockchain languages e.g. Golang, Rust are a plus).
  • Familiarity with the Ethereum blockchain architecture, transaction structure, and cross-chain development.


2.Event and Community Engagement:

  • Passion for engaging with developer communities (on Twitter, GitHub, Discord, etc.).
  • Experience organizing workshops, hackathons, or contributing to open-source projects.
  • Willingness to travel for events and community building.
  • Fluent in English


3.Business and Community Engagement:

  • Passion for engaging with developer communities (on Twitter, GitHub, Discord, etc.).
  • Experience hosting workshops, hackathons, or contributing to open-source projects.
  • Proven ability to lead BD calls and foster strong partnerships with projects or enterprises.


4.Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and storytelling skills to explain complex concepts simply.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently in a remote environment.


Why Join Our Company? 

  • Work with a cutting-edge team revolutionizing Web3.
  • Lead impactful partnerships that shape the future of blockchain.
  • Flexible remote work setup and collaborative environment.
  • Competitive salary, flexible working time
