job_description_formatted:
Overview

Ensure compliance with legal requirements and PepsiCo standards for safety and security management related to factory operations.

Responsibilities

Compliance

  • Prepare for all internal and external audits, ensuring 100% compliance.
  • Lead the (Agro/Manufacturing/ND&T in PepsiCo Ha Nam Plant) team to take necessary actions to meet EHS local Vietnam regulatory and PepsiCo standard requirements.
  • Review and update new regulations, ensuring timely communication and deployment to the operations team.
  • Regularly conduct self-audits and assessments based on specific requirements.
  • Maintain records and provide monthly reports.

EHS training

  • Design and deliver EHS training for contractors, new hires, employees Group 04 (legal), and other required topics to ensure adherence to company policies. - Execute
  • Collaborate with standard owners and HR to develop a comprehensive EHS training plan and matrix.
  • Ensure annual on-the-job EHS training is conducted for all employees and contractors.
  • Coordinate with HR to ensure timely delivery of planned EHS training sessions.
  • Develop and implement local H&S programs to foster a strong safety culture among employees.
  • Work with local fire authorities to organize fire training for the fire team and lead annual emergency evacuation drills.

ISO 45001, ISO 14001 and Highly Protected Rating (HPR)

  • Implement the program and monitor its execution to ensure compliance with ISO 45001 and the HPR system, achieving successful yearly surveillance audits by FM and external agencies.
  • Develop risk assessments and procedures for new lines or facilities to ensure compliance with ISO 45001 and the HPR system.
  • Serve as an internal auditor for the integrated system (ISO 14001 and ISO 45001).
  • Ensure compliance with environmental standards, laws, and regulations, including ISO 14001.

Safety

  • Manage the operations of the OHS Workers team (Group 6). - Consult, Influence
  • Establish and update procedures for implementation at the plant, ensuring compliance with GEHSMS standards, ISO 45001, and legal requirements. - Consult, Influence
  • Collaborate with all departments to conduct annual Risk Assessments and Environmental Aspect & Impact assessments.
  • Lead EHS incident investigations. - Execute
  • Perform daily EHS patrols on the shop floor and contractors’ tasks, conduct weekly inspections, and follow up to close findings on time. Report to the leadership team. - Execute, influence
  • Provide EHS advice and follow up with standard owners to ensure compliance with GEHSMS standards.
  • Conduct quarterly audits for technical standards.
  • Organize and deliver annual emergency drills (confined space, W@H, fire drills, etc.) as scheduled.
  • Attend DOR meetings and update relevant information and data. - Execute
  • Oversee the timesheet management for the WWT and medical teams.
  • Implement Capex projects as required. - Consult, Execute

MESS & GEHSMS Deployment:

  • Lead the MESS program and collaborate with the BU and cross-functional teams to implement the agenda and AOP, ensuring 100% compliance with MESS requirements.
  • Drive the GEHSMS program and work with all functions to ensure full deployment of required activities, maintaining a high level of GEHSMS implementation at the Ha Nam site.
  • Participate in cross-plant MESS and GEHSMS audits.

Sustainability

  • Drive Recon/Pep+ activities at Ha Nam Site
  • Run Glidepath and drive efforts towards achieving excellent sustainability performance.
  • Drive & focus on water sustainability, energy reduction, and GHG reduction across the entire site.
  • Collaborate with BU and Global teams to learn and implement the Pep+ program and best practices.
  • Provide training and monitor KPIs and sustainability activities at Ha Nam Site.

Qualifications

Qualification: Bachelor (University) of Health & safety/ Environment or Engineering related.

Experience:

  • At least 4-5 years of experience in Health & Safety/Environment roles.

Key Skills and competencies:

  • Strong problem-solving and proactive approach.
  • Supervisory skills.
  • Coaching skills (train the trainer).
  • Knowledge of ISO 14001, ISO 45001, GMP, HACCP, etc.
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Good command of English.

job_description_formatted:
Job Description

About Us

Accor is the largest hotel group in Asia Pacific, offering a diverse portfolio of 40+ brands, ranging from economy to luxury and lifestyle accommodations.

This role supports Accor Plus, the loyalty subscription arm of Accor, with a mission to promote and grow the Accor Plus membership, strengthening customer loyalty across Accor’s hotel network. With over 30 years of operation and a growing team of 600+ employees, Accor Plus serves a thriving community of 465,000+ members across Asia Pacific, providing exclusive travel, dining, and lifestyle benefits that enhance their experiences through the Accor Group.

About The Role

Reporting to the Finance Manager, the Accounts Officer will be based full time in Hanoi & responsible for ensuring financial accuracy and compliance, while supporting the team's accounting objectives. More specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • Managing multiple financial tasks with tight deadlines
  • Assisting in Financial reviews, Capex Reconciliations and Intercompany Reconciliations for our Pacific entities.
  • Adapting to changing financial regulations and company policies
  • Preparing reports for the Financial Controller

About You

You will be a junior accounting professional who has a passion for all things finance. To be successful in this role, you must:

  • At least 3-4 years experience in an accounting Role
  • Strong English communication skills
  • Knowledge of local taxation laws

Other advantageous qualities (but not mandatory) would include understanding of other tax regulations across the Pacific region, as well as previous experience in a global organisation.

Why Us?

Enjoy full support with a growing and international brand, plus ongoing training and coaching from our supportive managers, to assist with your accounting journey. Other benefits include

  • Accor Employee discounts for those that love to dine and travel
  • Opportunities to work on international financial operations
  • Career development opportunities, for those that would like to advance in the accounting field

job_summary: Company Description About Grab and Our Workplace Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility. Job Description Get to Know the Team The Growth Insights & Planning (GIP) team is a young, enthusiastic, and passionate team with an intellectual hunger to bring value to both business and society. We work closely with stakeholders across Grab Vietnam and Regional to drive business growth through data-driven insights and strategic initiatives. Our scope encompasses demand planning, growth optimization, country strategy development, and acting as the Project Management for key country strategic projects. The team is responsible for generating actionable insights, proposing strategic projects, and leading cross-functional initiatives to grow Grab's business across Mobility, Deliveries (GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabExpress) and Financial Services in Vietnam. Get to Know the Role For this role, the Senior Manager will identify key growth opportunities, developing strategies, and leading the execution of strategic projects for Grab Vietnam. You'll use deep data-driven insights to analyze market trends, competitor activities, and internal performance to inform strategic decision-making. You'll collaborate with senior leaders and stakeholders across Product, Operations, Tech, Commercial, Marketing, Finance to build plan and deploy operation. You will require managerial responsibilities in mentoring and coaching people to grow. You will report to the Head of Growth Insights and Planning, based onsite in Ho Chi Minh City. The Critical Tasks You Will Perform You will scan the business environment in Vietnam for insights and trends to identify key growth opportunities for the company, building sustainable competitive advantages. You will translate company-level strategies into actionable functional deliverables for Grab Vietnam and re-allocate business portfolio to align with local market opportunities. You will drive decision-making and ensure major initiatives are coherent with Grab Vietnam's strategic direction. You will lead end-to-end cross-functional projects, aligning and influencing teams and senior stakeholders to achieve strategic objectives. You will leverage advanced analytics (e.g., SQL, modeling tools) to uncover insights and inform decision-making, executing complex analyses. You will monitor and optimize key growth and operational metrics for strategic initiatives in Vietnam. You will build presentations to share actionable recommendations on opportunities for growth and improvement to stakeholders. Qualifications What Essential Skills You Will Need Experience: Minimum 7 years in strategy planning or business intelligence, within a top consulting firm or relevant industry, with a clear understanding of the Vietnamese market. Analytical & Modeling: Proven ability to build financial and operational models for investment decisions and scenario planning. Communication: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English and Vietnamese, with the ability to articulate complex ideas to senior leadership. Problem-Solving: Experienced in breaking down complex problems into actionable, data-backed solutions. Project Management: Strong project management and execution skills, including navigating ambiguity and driving initiatives to completion. Experience in people management and fostering a strong growth culture. Technical Proficiency (Preferred): Proficient in SQL and advanced analytics tools. Additional Information Life at Grab We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer: We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance. With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations. Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges. Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours What We Stand For At Grab We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique. job_description_formatted:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

The Growth Insights & Planning (GIP) team is a young, enthusiastic, and passionate team with an intellectual hunger to bring value to both business and society. We work closely with stakeholders across Grab Vietnam and Regional to drive business growth through data-driven insights and strategic initiatives. Our scope encompasses demand planning, growth optimization, country strategy development, and acting as the Project Management for key country strategic projects. The team is responsible for generating actionable insights, proposing strategic projects, and leading cross-functional initiatives to grow Grab's business across Mobility, Deliveries (GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabExpress) and Financial Services in Vietnam.

Get to Know the Role

  • For this role, the Senior Manager will identify key growth opportunities, developing strategies, and leading the execution of strategic projects for Grab Vietnam.
  • You'll use deep data-driven insights to analyze market trends, competitor activities, and internal performance to inform strategic decision-making.
  • You'll collaborate with senior leaders and stakeholders across Product, Operations, Tech, Commercial, Marketing, Finance to build plan and deploy operation.
  • You will require managerial responsibilities in mentoring and coaching people to grow.
  • You will report to the Head of Growth Insights and Planning, based onsite in Ho Chi Minh City.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

  • You will scan the business environment in Vietnam for insights and trends to identify key growth opportunities for the company, building sustainable competitive advantages.
  • You will translate company-level strategies into actionable functional deliverables for Grab Vietnam and re-allocate business portfolio to align with local market opportunities.
  • You will drive decision-making and ensure major initiatives are coherent with Grab Vietnam's strategic direction.
  • You will lead end-to-end cross-functional projects, aligning and influencing teams and senior stakeholders to achieve strategic objectives.
  • You will leverage advanced analytics (e.g., SQL, modeling tools) to uncover insights and inform decision-making, executing complex analyses.
  • You will monitor and optimize key growth and operational metrics for strategic initiatives in Vietnam.
  • You will build presentations to share actionable recommendations on opportunities for growth and improvement to stakeholders.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

  • Experience: Minimum 7 years in strategy planning or business intelligence, within a top consulting firm or relevant industry, with a clear understanding of the Vietnamese market.
  • Analytical & Modeling: Proven ability to build financial and operational models for investment decisions and scenario planning.
  • Communication: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English and Vietnamese, with the ability to articulate complex ideas to senior leadership.
  • Problem-Solving: Experienced in breaking down complex problems into actionable, data-backed solutions.
  • Project Management: Strong project management and execution skills, including navigating ambiguity and driving initiatives to completion.
  • Experience in people management and fostering a strong growth culture.
  • Technical Proficiency (Preferred): Proficient in SQL and advanced analytics tools.

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

  • We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
  • With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
  • Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
  • We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
  • Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

job_description_formatted:
"Caring for People's Health as a Trusted Partner"

STADA is a leading manufacturer of high-quality pharmaceuticals. With a long-standing heritage rooted in pharmacies, we are perceived as a reliable and trustworthy partner since 1895. With our products we help people protect and regain a dignified and able life. With our proven Generics, we ensure that everyday health remains affordable.

At STADA, we follow our purpose of “Caring for People’s Health as a Trusted Partner”. In pursuit of this purpose, we are committed to further accelerating the successful trajectory of our company.

To our employees, we offer an attractive working environment in which they can develop personally. At the moment, we are looking for talents as:

 Quality control Specialist _Commercial Supply Chain

Duration: 6month, at Tuy Hoa/HCM

RESPONSIBILITY:

  • Responsible for GSP (Good Storage Practice) and GDP (Good Distribution Practice):
  • Responsible for GSP (Good Storage Practice) and GDP (Good Distribution Practice) of the warehouse cluster belonging to CSC.
  • Manage documents related to GSP and GDP.
  • Manage and draft SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) for the Logistics team.
  • Train and monitor the employees to comply with GSP and GDP.
  • Do the reports on pharmaceutical-related matters.
  • Prepare and participate in assessments, and coordinate with inspection teams for the warehouses belonging to CSC.
  • Continuously update pharmaceutical laws related to GSP and GDP.
  • Quality control for import product:
  • Coordinate with relevant departments regarding drug quality.
  • Consult and support drug preservation.
  • Contact foreign suppliers to handle customer complaints about products.
  • Collaborate with BU CHC and Rx to handle customer complaints if related to imported goods.
  • Proceed the claim request for imported goods after confirming defects.
  • Other tasks:
  • Participate in evaluating and improving the operational processes of the warehouses belonging to SC.
  • Participate in evaluating warehouse and transportation service providers.
  • Perform other tasks assigned by management.

REQUIREMENT:

  • Bachelor’s degree in pharmaceutical.
  • Previous experience in a quality control or quality assurance role, particularly in the pharmaceutical industry, is desired.
  • Familiarity with warehouse operations and storage practices for medicines.
  • Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills, action planning and organizing.
    • Team spirit, persuasiveness & influence, highly collaborative with all cross functional partners.
    • Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly to changing strategies and priorities.
    • Good communication and training skills.
  • Good at English (both written and spoken).

How we care for you:

  • Aligning with STADA purpose “Caring for people’s health as a trusted partner,” we offer:
  • Health Insurance (+ 2 relatives)
  • Health check package annual
  • Annual leave: 15 days
  • Lunch Allowance

We look forward to receiving your application:

Contact:

Email: recruitment.vn@stada.com/ gia.leduy@stada.com

job_description_formatted:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Electrical Engineering, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Generate prompts that challenge AI.
  • Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers.
  • Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • You have a 3 years of professional experience.
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

job_summary: RBW Consulting are partnered with a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing next-generation, programmed T cell therapies for the treatment of cancer. Using a broad suite of proprietary and modular T cell programming technologies, the company is engineering precisely targeted, controlled and highly active T cell therapies that are designed to better recognise cancer cells, break down their defence mechanisms and eliminate these cells. They have a pipeline of product candidates in development for the treatment of haematological malignancies and solid tumours. The Manager - Tissue Operations is accountable for managing onboarding and on-going performance of Apheresis and Treatment Centres used for Clinical Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T-cell Therapies. This role will serve as the technical operations single point of contact for Apheresis and Treatment Centres located within the designated region and may require management of contract employees. This role is remotely based to service designated regions. Regional travel up to 75% of time may be required. Key Responsibilities Develop and foster relationships with Apheresis, Cell Lab and Treatment Centre Staff for assigned region. Work with Clinical and Commercial CAR-T teams to establish the apheresis collection footprint to support the clinical trial site plans for assigned region. Coordinate with internal teams and collection site staff to ensure all collection site onboarding activities are successfully completed and sites are prepared to perform collections within the required timelines. Communicate collection site on-boarding status to Clinical teams and develop and execute mitigation plans for any delayed timelines. Perform technical site assessments and train collection center staff on collection requirements and attend site audits as required Provide Quality Systems support by participating in deviation activities and impact/investigation assessments for cell collection centers. Work with Quality Assurance and other internal business partners to monitor and assess vendor performance and capacity after site launch. Manage rollout of process changes to assigned sites. Collect VOC (voice of customer) and VOB (voice of business) feedback used for continuous operations improvement Collect and enter data into electronic data management systems Represent the department on cross-functional project teams, as requested. Comply with applicable SOP‚Äôs and regulations. Demonstrated skills and competencies: E ‚Äì Essential P ‚Äì Preferred Experience Experience in Apheresis Operations Management, QA Operations, GMP production, GTP or other relevant operational areas (E) Breadth of experience in regulated (GxP) environment, understanding of HTA (either hospital or pharmaceutical/biopharmaceutical company) (E) Experience working in Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs (P) Experience working with critical raw material suppliers or contract manufacturing organizations (E) Experience in an operational role for supplier qualification and management of external Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs. (P) Has successfully worked in a team-based environment. (E) Experience in delivering process improvements, ideally in processes for qualification, training, and management of external cell procurement (Apheresis) suppliers. (E) Experience managing contracts with external apheresis providers. (P) Prior customer facing role in pharmaceutical/biotech industry (P) Qualifications Undergraduate degree in related science or nursing (E) Advanced degree in related science or nursing (P) Be fluent in English and Vietnamese (E) Skills/Specialist knowledge Ability to rapidly solve problems and deal with organizational complexity Ability to prioritize and complete work with sense of urgency based on criticality Medical, scientific and clinical knowledge Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards High attention to detail skills High organization skills with ability to multi-task several tasks in parallel Customer-centricity ‚Äî Consider the impacts of decisions on the customer (treatment centre), striving to ensure that process changes improve and do not impede customer service when possible, while ensuring compliance with regulations Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills to communicate effectively across all levels within the organization and multiple cultures Please apply here and Harry Henson will be in touch to discuss your application further. job_poster.title: Associate Director - Specialist Recruiter in the Global Freelance Clinical Operations space

job_description_formatted:
RBW Consulting are partnered with a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing next-generation, programmed T cell therapies for the treatment of cancer. Using a broad suite of proprietary and modular T cell programming technologies, the company is engineering precisely targeted, controlled and highly active T cell therapies that are designed to better recognise cancer cells, break down their defence mechanisms and eliminate these cells. They have a pipeline of product candidates in development for the treatment of haematological malignancies and solid tumours.


The Manager - Tissue Operations is accountable for managing onboarding and on-going performance of Apheresis and Treatment Centres used for Clinical Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR) T-cell Therapies. This role will serve as the technical operations single point of contact for Apheresis and Treatment Centres located within the designated region and may require management of contract employees.


This role is remotely based to service designated regions. Regional travel up to 75% of time may be required.


Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and foster relationships with Apheresis, Cell Lab and Treatment Centre Staff for assigned region.
  • Work with Clinical and Commercial CAR-T teams to establish the apheresis collection footprint to support the clinical trial site plans for assigned region.
  • Coordinate with internal teams and collection site staff to ensure all collection site onboarding activities are successfully completed and sites are prepared to perform collections within the required timelines.
  • Communicate collection site on-boarding status to Clinical teams and develop and execute mitigation plans for any delayed timelines.
  • Perform technical site assessments and train collection center staff on collection requirements and attend site audits as required Provide Quality Systems support by participating in deviation activities and impact/investigation assessments for cell collection centers.
  • Work with Quality Assurance and other internal business partners to monitor and assess vendor performance and capacity after site launch.
  • Manage rollout of process changes to assigned sites. Collect VOC (voice of customer) and VOB (voice of business) feedback used for continuous operations improvement
  • Collect and enter data into electronic data management systems Represent the department on cross-functional project teams, as requested.
  • Comply with applicable SOP’s and regulations.


Demonstrated skills and competencies:


E – Essential

P – Preferred


Experience

  • Experience in Apheresis Operations Management, QA Operations, GMP production, GTP or other relevant operational areas (E) Breadth of experience in regulated (GxP) environment, understanding of HTA (either hospital or pharmaceutical/biopharmaceutical company) (E)
  • Experience working in Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs (P)
  • Experience working with critical raw material suppliers or contract manufacturing organizations (E)
  • Experience in an operational role for supplier qualification and management of external Apheresis, Cellular Therapy or Stem Cell Transplant programs. (P)
  • Has successfully worked in a team-based environment. (E)
  • Experience in delivering process improvements, ideally in processes for qualification, training, and management of external cell procurement (Apheresis) suppliers. (E)
  • Experience managing contracts with external apheresis providers. (P)
  • Prior customer facing role in pharmaceutical/biotech industry (P)


Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in related science or nursing (E)
  • Advanced degree in related science or nursing (P)
  • Be fluent in English and Vietnamese (E)


Skills/Specialist knowledge

  • Ability to rapidly solve problems and deal with organizational complexity
  • Ability to prioritize and complete work with sense of urgency based on criticality
  • Medical, scientific and clinical knowledge
  • Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards
  • High attention to detail skills
  • High organization skills with ability to multi-task several tasks in parallel
  • Customer-centricity — Consider the impacts of decisions on the customer (treatment centre), striving to ensure that process changes improve and do not impede customer service when possible, while ensuring compliance with regulations
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills to communicate effectively across all levels within the organization and multiple cultures


Please apply here and Harry Henson will be in touch to discuss your application further.

job_summary: About the Chandler Institute of Governance (CIG) Headquartered in Singapore, CIG is a privately funded non-profit organisation founded on the belief that good governments are the foundation of flourishing, prosperous communities and nations. We support governments globally to develop capabilities, through training programmes, governments projects and partnerships, and knowledge creation. CIG is practitioner focused and internationally oriented. We are managed by former public service leaders from across the world and draw upon a wealth of practitioner experience and knowledge from our global network of experts. We have worked with governments in countries spanning three continents, including Costa Rica, Zambia, Kenya, Malawi, Uganda, South Africa, India, Brunei, the Philippines, Singapore and Vietnam. Founded in 2019, we are an energetic and mission-driven organisation. We are a small organisation, and we work collectively and collaboratively. We are an entrepreneurial organisation ‚Äì we do our best to achieve excellence the first time, and we quickly pivot if we find something does not work. About the Opportunity CIG is looking for a Programmes Manager (Vietnam) to support the planning and implementation of its training programmes and initiatives in collaboration with government partners in Vietnam. The position will be based in Vietnam and will involve the following key responsibilities: Programme Management and Delivery: Assist in the implementation of CIG‚Äôs training programmes with government partners in Vietnam. This could involve conducting needs assessments, identifying and engaging suitable Vietnamese experts, and supporting programme management and delivery on the ground. Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with CIG‚Äôs partners and learners to understand key learning needs and contextualise learning interventions to the local context. Logistics and Administration: Oversee the logistical and administrative aspects of programme implementation in Vietnam and, where necessary, in Singapore. Research & Insights: Conduct research, environmental scanning, and analysis of developments in Vietnam to support the ongoing refinement of CIG‚Äôs engagement strategy in the country. Language & Communication Support: Provide basic interpretation and translation assistance to facilitate communication between the CIG team, partners, and learners. Requirements and Experience Recent graduates are welcome to apply, particularly those enrolled in or holding a degree or diploma in Public Policy or related fields Strong interest in governance, public policy, and adult learning programme development Fluent in both English and Vietnamese, with the ability to provide interpretation and translation support for CIG team meetings with Vietnamese partners Strong project management and execution skills, with the ability to meet tight deadlines, deliver high-quality work, and adapt to changes Strong stakeholder management skills, to be able to bring together learning designers, funders, partners, experts and participants to work together effectively Good situational awareness and creative problem-solving abilities Experience in either public sector work or event management is a plus, but is not required This position is based in Vietnam (mostly in Hanoi), and reports directly to the Dean of the Academy. Please reach out to Christopher Wong (christopher.wong@chandlerinstitute.org) for more inquiries. Show more Show less
job_description_formatted:
About the Chandler Institute of Governance (CIG)

Headquartered in Singapore, CIG is a privately funded non-profit organisation founded on the belief that good governments are the foundation of flourishing, prosperous communities and nations. We support governments globally to develop capabilities, through training programmes, governments projects and partnerships, and knowledge creation.


CIG is practitioner focused and internationally oriented. We are managed by former public service leaders from across the world and draw upon a wealth of practitioner experience and knowledge from our global network of experts. We have worked with governments in countries spanning three continents, including Costa Rica, Zambia, Kenya, Malawi, Uganda, South Africa, India, Brunei, the Philippines, Singapore and Vietnam.


Founded in 2019, we are an energetic and mission-driven organisation. We are a small organisation, and we work collectively and collaboratively. We are an entrepreneurial organisation – we do our best to achieve excellence the first time, and we quickly pivot if we find something does not work.


About the Opportunity

CIG is looking for a Programmes Manager (Vietnam) to support the planning and implementation of its training programmes and initiatives in collaboration with government partners in Vietnam. The position will be based in Vietnam and will involve the following key responsibilities:


  • Programme Management and Delivery: Assist in the implementation of CIG’s training programmes with government partners in Vietnam. This could involve conducting needs assessments, identifying and engaging suitable Vietnamese experts, and supporting programme management and delivery on the ground.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with CIG’s partners and learners to understand key learning needs and contextualise learning interventions to the local context.
  • Logistics and Administration: Oversee the logistical and administrative aspects of programme implementation in Vietnam and, where necessary, in Singapore.
  • Research & Insights: Conduct research, environmental scanning, and analysis of developments in Vietnam to support the ongoing refinement of CIG’s engagement strategy in the country.
  • Language & Communication Support: Provide basic interpretation and translation assistance to facilitate communication between the CIG team, partners, and learners.


Requirements and Experience

  • Recent graduates are welcome to apply, particularly those enrolled in or holding a degree or diploma in Public Policy or related fields
  • Strong interest in governance, public policy, and adult learning programme development
  • Fluent in both English and Vietnamese, with the ability to provide interpretation and translation support for CIG team meetings with Vietnamese partners
  • Strong project management and execution skills, with the ability to meet tight deadlines, deliver high-quality work, and adapt to changes
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, to be able to bring together learning designers, funders, partners, experts and participants to work together effectively
  • Good situational awareness and creative problem-solving abilities
  • Experience in either public sector work or event management is a plus, but is not required


This position is based in Vietnam (mostly in Hanoi), and reports directly to the Dean of the Academy. Please reach out to Christopher Wong (christopher.wong@chandlerinstitute.org) for more inquiries.

job_summary: Overview Our client is an innovative multiplayer blockchain game combining virtual worlds, NFTs, and social interactions. While owning and trading unique in-game assets, players build and explore a vibrant, open-world cooperative environment. The company is focused on ushering in a new era of gaming where game mechanics empower users to fully unlock their creative and financial potential. The company fosters a culture of collaboration, creativity, and innovation, providing a platform that encourages diverse ideas and passionate teamwork. By joining their mission, you will help redefine the gaming landscape and contribute to a groundbreaking experience for players around the globe. We are seeking a Senior Backend Developer to join an ambitious team and play a critical role in the development of the first fully decentralized massively multiplayer online game. The successful candidate will be integral to realizing this exciting vision, using their expertise in backend development while diving into the world of blockchain and Web3 technologies. This role is tailored for professionals who are passionate about backend development and eager to delve into the dynamic world of blockchain and Web3 technologies. In this role you will be able to apply your existing expertise in Node.js, TypeScript, and Postgres. Responsibilities Develop and maintain the backend infrastructure for the company‚Äôs web dashboard and marketplace. Use Postgres and Node.js with TypeScript to create scalable and reliable backend solutions. Integrate backend systems with Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) smart contracts and dApps, ensuring smooth functionality. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features while optimizing existing systems for better performance and security. Participate in code reviews, ensuring high standards of code quality and system security. Stay updated on blockchain technology trends, applying this knowledge to improve backend systems. Qualifications At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, with a proven track record of successful project deliveries. Solid experience in backend development concepts, such as database design, API design, scalability, and security best practices. Experience leading or mentoring junior developers, conducting code reviews, and contributing to team best practices. job_description_formatted:
Overview

Our client is an innovative multiplayer blockchain game combining virtual worlds, NFTs, and social interactions. While owning and trading unique in-game assets, players build and explore a vibrant, open-world cooperative environment. The company is focused on ushering in a new era of gaming where game mechanics empower users to fully unlock their creative and financial potential.


The company fosters a culture of collaboration, creativity, and innovation, providing a platform that encourages diverse ideas and passionate teamwork. By joining their mission, you will help redefine the gaming landscape and contribute to a groundbreaking experience for players around the globe. 


We are seeking a Senior Backend Developer to join an ambitious team and play a critical role in the development of the first fully decentralized massively multiplayer online game. The successful candidate will be integral to realizing this exciting vision, using their expertise in backend development while diving into the world of blockchain and Web3 technologies.


This role is tailored for professionals who are passionate about backend development and eager to delve into the dynamic world of blockchain and Web3 technologies. In this role you will be able to apply your existing expertise in Node.js, TypeScript, and Postgres.

 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain the backend infrastructure for the company’s web dashboard and marketplace.
  • Use Postgres and Node.js with TypeScript to create scalable and reliable backend solutions.
  • Integrate backend systems with Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) smart contracts and dApps, ensuring smooth functionality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features while optimizing existing systems for better performance and security.
  • Participate in code reviews, ensuring high standards of code quality and system security.
  • Stay updated on blockchain technology trends, applying this knowledge to improve backend systems.


Qualifications

  • At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, with a proven track record of successful project deliveries.
  • Solid experience in backend development concepts, such as database design, API design, scalability, and security best practices.
  • Experience leading or mentoring junior developers, conducting code reviews, and contributing to team best practices.
  • Strong ability to manage complex projects, meet deadlines, and collaborate effectively within a team.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, creativity, and innovation in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with blockchain technologies, smart contracts, and experience with EVM-compatible blockchains.

About Lion Studios

Lion Studios is a mobile games publisher that works with mobile developers to get their games discovered by players around the world. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lion Studios’ creative and strategy teams utilize their expertise to help game developers break through the noise and grow their businesses. Since launching in 2018, Lion Studios has driven 90% of its games to the Top 10 in the App Store and Google Play and helped drive 16 games to #1 in the US App Store’s Top Free chart. Many of the studio’s games hit the top 10 and the top 20 across both the App Store and Google Play. Collectively, the studio has driven hundreds of millions of downloads. Check out some of our hit releases: Mr. Bullet, Happy Glass, Save the Girl, and Slap Kings.

Lion Studios is a leading mobile game publisher dedicated to helping developers bring their games to a global audience. Headquartered in San Francisco, our creative and strategy teams leverage their expertise to help game developers break through the noise and scale their businesses. Since our launch in 2018, Lion Studios has propelled 90% of its games into the Top 10 on the App Store and Google Play, with 16 titles reaching #1 on the US App Store’s Top Free chart. Many of our games have secured top positions in the Top 10 and Top 20 on both major platforms, collectively amassing hundreds of millions of downloads. Some of our hit releases include Hexa Sort, Found It: Hidden Object Games, The Superhero League, and Family Tree.

We are seeking a driven and results-oriented Studio Manager to join our team! If you’re eager to make an impact and thrive in a fun, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Who You Are:

  • 3+ years of experience in product/project management, business development, or a related role within the mobile gaming industry (experience in managing gaming studios is a plus).
  • Proven experience in the ideation and development of new mobile games or apps, from concept through to production.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
  • Capable of working independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Onboard and manage gaming studios with diverse game portfolios.
  • Identify promising games and studios in the market, and cultivate strong relationships.
  • Lead the full lifecycle of game development, from ideation through to launch, ensuring the creation of innovative and engaging mobile games.
  • Conduct competitive analysis of the mobile gaming landscape, including user behavior and key metrics, to inform the product roadmap.
  • Align product development with Lion Studios’ strategic and competitive positioning.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with engineers, designers, and marketers to bring game concepts and features to life as an end-to-end product owner.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working on mobile games with a proven track record of driving successful planning, development, and launches.
  • Strong understanding of the latest trends in mobile gaming.
  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage with and understand both technical subjects and emerging technologies, and their relevance to the marketplace.
  • Ability to clearly communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Previous experience in a startup environment.

As an ERA Consultant, you will be helping businesses reduce overhead expenses, alongside industry specialists. job_description_formatted:
ERA Group, a world leader in cost reduction solutions for SMEs, is actively seeking executives to join their Network of independent Consultants.

About Expense Reduction Analysts



Operating since 1992, Expense Reduction Analysts (ERA) is a global consulting company with 750 Consultants across 45 different countries.

ERA helps companies save on overhead expenses and has completed 30,000+ successful cost reduction projects around the globe. ERA specializes in 45 cost categories such as insurance, banking, telecoms, IT, packaging, medical supplies, labour cost, logistics, etc.



What does an ERA Group, Business Consultant do?



An ERA, Consultant is a client facing leader who gets trained to combine industry expertise with core consulting skills, such as problem solving, analytics and the ability to interface with multiple personality types. As an ERA Consultant, you will be helping businesses reduce overhead expenses, alongside industry specialists. You will become an expert in identifying, presenting and delivering cost reduction projects. You will leverage your career experience and expertise to support your clients with cost reduction initiatives.



Not only is ERA’s value proposition “additional cash through savings” very attractive for any type of client, it is also delivered through a clever contingency based model. The client only pays for the cost savings solution, if ERA can show actual additional cash flow. The additional cash flow is then split between the client and the ERA Consultant – a highly attractive business approach for client and consultant!



Responsibilities of the ERA Consultant:



· Follow a proven system to identify and deliver cost reduction projects

· Collaborate with Cost Category Specialists to ensure successful completion of projects

· Use provided analysis to draw conclusions, and develop pertinent and insightful Recommendations

· Prospect for clients following ERA specific programs and systems

· Build long-term client relationships

· Apply networking skills taught by ERA Corporate

· Manage clients throughout the whole cost reduction process

· Work as an independent Consultant within the given structures and processes

· Access a variety of internal programs to successfully manage your pipeline independently



What you'll bring with You:



· Minimum 10 years of professional experience

· Background in Sales, Consulting, Business Development, Finance, Analytics or similar

· Comfortable talking and supporting senior-level executives

· Problem-solving skills

· Good communication and negotiation skills

· Entrepreneurial spirit

· Interest in cost reduction

· Analytical mind

· Independent work style, ability to manage your own time

· Great team player

· You will need to be prepared to make an initial investment as this is a business opportunity.



Why Expense Reduction Analysts (ERA)?

We offer the best of two worlds: A great business proposition, proven systems, and processes as well as the freedom and satisfaction of being in control of your own future.

Expense Reduction Analysts’ methodology shows a quick way to financial freedom and predictable uncapped income. To do this, we provide you with operational processes, a successful consulting model, systems, software, databases, and tools optimized for you.




Please note that when you submit your request for more information, your data will be stored and processed in Expense Reduction Analysts contact management software, so you may receive communications related to your inquiry. job_description_formatted:
Trelleborg is a world leader in engineered polymer solutions for almost every industry on the planet. And we are where we are because our talents brought us here. By specializing in the polymer engineering that makes innovation and application possible, Trelleborg works closely with leading industry brands to accelerate their performance, drive their business forward—and along the way, shape the industry and progress that will benefit humankind in the exciting years ahead. Our people are Shaping Industry from the Inside. Why don´t you join us?

WORKING PLACE: TRELLEBORG SEALING SOLUTIONS VIETNAM CO., LTD

Address: Factory X2, Lot N3, Street N5, N6, Loc An – Binh Son Industrial Park, Long An Commune, Long Thanh District, Dong Nai Province, Vietnam

TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Procurement

  • Responsible to source, negotiate and purchase direct and indirect materials from both local and oversea suppliers.
  • Evaluate supplier’s quotation to ensure that they are in line of work specifications required for the scope.
  • Monitor and prepare price comparation file then submit to ERP System
  • Generate Purchase Orders (POs) and send to suppliers.
  • Establish strong relationships with suppliers to ensure quality and timely delivery of goods and services.
  • Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing to achieve cost efficiency.
  • Monitor supplier performance and resolve any issues related to quality or delivery.
  • Support sourcing project if any.

Import/ Export operations

  • Verify new documents from suppliers, track shipment schedules, update system and reporting files.
  • Monitor and prepare price comparation file then submit to EPRS.
  • Generate Purchase Orders (POs) and send to suppliers/ FWDs.
  • Review customs declarations, prepare documents for import/ export procedures.
  • Prepare documents for supplier payment requests, tax payments, local charges, and permit extensions.
  • Coordinate with FWDs, warehouses, service companies, and operational department to monitor cargo process.
  • Resolve any issues arising during the procedure, notify the ordering department of loses at ports or wear house; support FWDs on explain information and documents to customs and shipping lines.
  • Support FWDs on Monitor and process tax refunds if any.
  • Collect information and documents to determine HS codes.
  • Search for and update information on new documents and regulations, look up HS codes and tax rates.
  • Maintain records.
  • Any requirement from HOD.

Cost Management

  • Verify shipping costs, handling fees
  • Control and explain costs related to Import/ Export procedures.
  • Propose cost optimization for operation.

Transportation and coordination

  • Coordinate vehicles and transportation services for delivery from suppliers to TSS’s warehouse or directly from TSS’s warehouse to customers.
  • Coordinate customs clearance and freight forwarding services.

Updates to related department

  • Notify if any delays during the delivery process.
  • Verify, monitor and inform the related departments of import tax/ export tax rates and policies.
  • Explain any additional costs to accounting.

Collect data and submit Payment request to accountant team.

Education And Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Logistic, customs, Import-Export or relevant majors
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in Customs clearance, Logistics, or Import-Export
  • Minimum 2 years of experience within Procurement process
  • Global and local collaboration environment experience
  • Intermediate English proficiency
  • Experience with ERPS / Fourth Shift / SAP (preferred)
  • Self motivating and able to work on own initiative
  • Organized and structured with a good attention to detail
  • Possesses transferable skills
  • Team work skill

COMPETENCECIES

  • Ability to build good working relationships
  • Delivers to agreed timescales
  • Good organisational skills.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Good working knowledge of an ERP System (preferred).
  • Good computer skills.
  • IT skills and PC familiarity with a particular emphasis on Microsoft Excel Spreadsheets.
  • Excellent planning and communication skills

BEHAVIORAL CHARACTERISTICS

  • Ability to function and work in a Team Environment
  • Build strong channels and relationships with Customers and within Trelleborg
  • Highly organised and flexible to hand or meet priorities
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to work effectively to meet objectives
  • Take initiative and seek additional training or direction as needed
  • Must be able to work accurately and efficiently.
  • Positive work ethic

job_summary: Location: Remote Engagement Type: Full-Time Contract-Based Role Salary Range: $1,250 ‚Äì $1,800/month (commensurate with Experience) Purpose of the Role: We are seeking an experienced Senior Backend Developer with deep expertise in Node.js and TypeScript to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing highly performant backend systems and services that scale, while ensuring reliability and maintainability. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, frontend developers, and DevOps to bring new features and products to life. Key Responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain robust, high-performance, and scalable backend services using Node.js and TypeScript . Lead architectural discussions and provide insights into backend technologies and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure). Collaborate with product owners and frontend teams to ensure seamless integration with frontend services and mobile applications. Drive the adoption of best practices in software engineering, including code reviews, unit testing, and continuous integration. Optimize application performance and ensure high availability and scalability. Mentor junior engineers and contribute to the continuous improvement of the engineering team‚Äôs processes. Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems as needed. Write clean, well-documented, and efficient code adhering to industry standards. Skills & Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in backend development, with a focus on building web applications and APIs. Expert-level knowledge of Node.js and TypeScript with a proven track record of delivering large-scale backend solutions. Strong experience with RESTful APIs, GraphQL , and microservices architecture. Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis). Proficient in working with cloud platforms like AWS or GCP , with a focus on services such as S3. Solid understanding of containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes . Experience with message queues and streaming platforms (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka). Strong focus on security and performance optimization in backend systems. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to lead technical discussions. Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in Distributed Systems and Event-Driven Architectures . Knowledge of Serverless Architectures and associated tools. Familiarity with API security standards , such as OAuth2 and JWT. Contributions to open-source projects or technical blogs would be a plus. job_description_formatted:
Location: Remote

Engagement Type: Full-Time Contract-Based Role

Salary Range: $1,250 – $1,800/month (commensurate with Experience)


Purpose of the Role:

We are seeking an experienced Senior Backend Developer with deep expertise in Node.js and TypeScript to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing highly performant backend systems and services that scale, while ensuring reliability and maintainability. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, frontend developers, and DevOps to bring new features and products to life.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain robust, high-performance, and scalable backend services using Node.js and TypeScript.
  • Lead architectural discussions and provide insights into backend technologies and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
  • Collaborate with product owners and frontend teams to ensure seamless integration with frontend services and mobile applications.
  • Drive the adoption of best practices in software engineering, including code reviews, unit testing, and continuous integration.
  • Optimize application performance and ensure high availability and scalability.
  • Mentor junior engineers and contribute to the continuous improvement of the engineering team’s processes.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems as needed.
  • Write clean, well-documented, and efficient code adhering to industry standards.

 

Skills & Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in backend development, with a focus on building web applications and APIs.
  • Expert-level knowledge of Node.js and TypeScript with a proven track record of delivering large-scale backend solutions.
  • Strong experience with RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and microservices architecture.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis).
  • Proficient in working with cloud platforms like AWS or GCP, with a focus on services such as S3.
  • Solid understanding of containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools such as Kubernetes.
  • Experience with message queues and streaming platforms (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka).
  • Strong focus on security and performance optimization in backend systems.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to lead technical discussions.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in Distributed Systems and Event-Driven Architectures.
  • Knowledge of Serverless Architectures and associated tools.
  • Familiarity with API security standards, such as OAuth2 and JWT.
  • Contributions to open-source projects or technical blogs would be a plus.


Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $1,250 – $1,800 per month


Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday


Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)


Experience:

  • Backend Engineer: 4 years (Required)


Language:

  • English (Required)

job_summary: Company Description About Grab and Our Workplace Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility. Job Description Get to Know the Team As a Associate Account Manager at Grab, you will handle different aspects of account management, creating business proposals and roadmaps to grow brands on our platform. Your role involves project management with partners to ensure smooth campaign execution and the achievement of our Goals. You will also promote our Grab Marketing Solution strategy. Get to Know the Role The Associate Account Management role at GrabMart is crucial for managing relationships with partners and suppliers. Main responsibilities include maintaining partner satisfaction, analyzing performance data to improve outcomes, providing support and advice on optimizing the GrabMart platform, and coordinating with other teams like marketing and logistics to ensure partners receive necessary assistance. You will report to GrabMart Commercial Manager. You will be worked onsite in Ho Chi Minh city. The Critical Tasks You Will Perform Manage a portfolio of existing GrabMart accounts to ensure customer satisfaction and retention. Conduct regular business reviews with customers to identify opportunities for growth and upselling. Develop account plans to achieve sales targets and expand GrabMart's presence in the market. Collaborate with company partners to resolve customer issues and improve overall customer experience. Analyze sales data and market trends to identify opportunities for new business and revenue growth. Qualifications What Essential Skills You Will Need Experience: At least 2 years in business roles, with experience both on client and agency sides being advantageous. Understand about FMCG brand. Experience researching and generating leads: Logical thinking and a good sense of numbers to interpret data and make informed decisions. Experience creating detailed demos that are tailored to customers' pain points and comfortable with operational tasks. Experience establishing communication and engagement with prospects: Proficient in creating and delivering compelling presentations. Experience communicating product benefits appropriate for each prospect: Experience establishing communication and engagement with prospects in both Vietnamese and English, to work with diverse clients and partners. Experience balancing multiple sales opportunities,. Additional Information Life at Grab We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer: We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance. With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations. Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges. Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours What We Stand For At Grab We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. job_description_formatted:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

As a Associate Account Manager at Grab, you will handle different aspects of account management, creating business proposals and roadmaps to grow brands on our platform. Your role involves project management with partners to ensure smooth campaign execution and the achievement of our Goals. You will also promote our Grab Marketing Solution strategy.

Get to Know the Role

The Associate Account Management role at GrabMart is crucial for managing relationships with partners and suppliers. Main responsibilities include maintaining partner satisfaction, analyzing performance data to improve outcomes, providing support and advice on optimizing the GrabMart platform, and coordinating with other teams like marketing and logistics to ensure partners receive necessary assistance.

You will report to GrabMart Commercial Manager.

You will be worked onsite in Ho Chi Minh city.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

  • Manage a portfolio of existing GrabMart accounts to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.
  • Conduct regular business reviews with customers to identify opportunities for growth and upselling.
  • Develop account plans to achieve sales targets and expand GrabMart's presence in the market.
  • Collaborate with company partners to resolve customer issues and improve overall customer experience.
  • Analyze sales data and market trends to identify opportunities for new business and revenue growth.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

  • Experience: At least 2 years in business roles, with experience both on client and agency sides being advantageous. Understand about FMCG brand.
  • Experience researching and generating leads: Logical thinking and a good sense of numbers to interpret data and make informed decisions.
  • Experience creating detailed demos that are tailored to customers' pain points and comfortable with operational tasks.
  • Experience establishing communication and engagement with prospects: Proficient in creating and delivering compelling presentations.
  • Experience communicating product benefits appropriate for each prospect: Experience establishing communication and engagement with prospects in both Vietnamese and English, to work with diverse clients and partners.
  • Experience balancing multiple sales opportunities,.

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

  • We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
  • With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
  • Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
  • We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
  • Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

job_summary: OVERVIEW: We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented People Operations Assistant to support our growing HR team. This role involves assisting with recruitment, handling administrative tasks, and contributing to internal communications and employer branding. As we work toward our ambitious goal of managing a billion-dollar in assets, we‚Äôre looking for someone who shares the same growth mindset‚Äîambitious, responsible, and ready to grow with us. COMPENSATION: 12,000,000-17,000,000 VND (BASE SALARY + COMMISSION + BONUSES) WORKING HOURS: This is a full-time, 100% remote position requiring 40 hours per week, as follows: Morning shift: 8AM - 12PM Vietnam time (4hours) Evening shift: 8PM - 12AM Vietnam time (4hours) Totaling 8 hours a day, 40 hours a week. Internal Communication & Employer Branding (30%) Create internal messages, newsletters, and announcements. Assist with social media and LinkedIn posts to promote company culture. Excellent English and Vietnamese written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Comfortable using tools like Google Workspace, Excel, Canva, and AI platforms. Able to handle confidential information with discretion. Proactive, detail-focused, and open to feedback and learning. Familiarity with LinkedIn, Facebook recruitment, or applicant tracking systems. Interest in internal communications, culture building, or branding. As we work toward our ambitious goal of managing a billion-dollar in assets, we’re looking for

someone who shares the same growth mindset—ambitious, responsible, and ready to grow

with us. We want team members who are not just looking for a job, but for a long-term journey.


COMPENSATION: 12,000,000-17,000,000 VND (BASE SALARY + COMMISSION + BONUSES)


WORKING HOURS:

This is a full-time, 100% remote position requiring 40 hours per week, as follows:

  • Morning shift: 8AM - 12PM Vietnam time (4hours)
  • Evening shift: 8PM - 12AM Vietnam time (4hours)
  • Totaling 8 hours a day, 40 hours a week.
  • Zoom meetings required during working hours.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Recruitment (50%)

  • Assist with job postings, sourcing, and candidate outreach. (Linkedin, Facebook, Indeed, etc.)
  • Schedule and conduct first-round interviews.
  • Maintain candidate records and recruitment trackers.
  • Coordinate with hiring managers and share proposals for review.
  • Support onboarding and documentation for new hires.

Administrative Support (20%)

  • Take detailed notes during team meetings.
  • Prepare reports, templates, and internal documentation.
  • Manage basic admin tools and assist with HR workflow execution.
  • Support company initiatives like tests, quizzes, and resolutions.

Internal Communication & Employer Branding (30%)

  • Create internal messages, newsletters, and announcements.
  • Assist with social media and LinkedIn posts to promote company culture.
  • Collaborate on internal branding materials like posters or visual updates.


REQUIREMENTS:

  • At least 1 year experience in HR, Recruitment, or related field. (Please note: We are only considering candidates with relevant professional experience. Fresh graduates or applicants without directly related experience will not be considered.)
  • Excellent English and Vietnamese written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong organizational and time management abilities.
  • Comfortable using tools like Google Workspace, Excel, Canva, and AI platforms.
  • Able to handle confidential information with discretion.
  • Proactive, detail-focused, and open to feedback and learning.
  • Familiarity with LinkedIn, Facebook recruitment, or applicant tracking systems.
  • Interest in internal communications, culture building, or branding.


BENEFITS

  • PTO, Float Holidays
  • Performance-base bonuses
  • Remote work environment
  • Hands-on global recruitment and collaboration
  • KPI-based commissions and bonuses.
